translated: In the city of Kāmarūpa, you who are present in the city, in the Jālapīṭha, in the Jīkā, divided into six, and in the Madhyapīṭha, moving in the path of three, you are the one with the form of Śṛṅgāṭa.

original: siddhair yā veṣṭitāṅgī parivṛtacaturaiḥ ṣaṣṭibhir yogivṛndair yuktā hṛtpaṅkajena ḍaralakasahajā pātu māṃ rudraśaktiḥ // / //
analyzed: siddhaiḥ yā veṣṭita aṅgī parivṛta caturaiḥ ṣaṣṭibhiḥ yogi vṛndaiḥ yuktā hṛd paṅkajena ḍaralaka sahajā pātu mām rudra śaktiḥ
translated: May the power of Rudra, surrounded by the limbs of the Siddhas, surrounded by the four groups of sixty yogis, united with the lotus of the heart, born with D, R, L, and K, protect me.

original: iti kulālikāmnāye śrīkubjikāmate candradvīpāvatāro nāma prathamaḥ paṭalaḥ
analyzed: iti kulālikāmnāye śrī kubjikāmate candradvīpāvatāraḥ nāma prathamaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Thus ends the first chapter named The Descent of Chandra-Dvipa in the venerable Kubjika Mata of the Kulalika Amana tradition.

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Sri Bhairava said:

original: jaya tvaṃ mālinī devī nirmale malanāśinī /
analyzed: jaya tvam mālinī devī nirmale mala nāśinī
translated: Victory to you, O Goddess Malini, the pure one who destroys impurities.

original: jñānaśaktiḥ prabhur devī buddhis tvaṃ tejavardhanī // / //
analyzed: jñānaśaktiḥ prabhuḥ devī buddhiḥ tvam teja vardhanī
translated: You are the power of knowledge, the powerful Goddess, the intellect, and the enhancer of brilliance.

analyzed: jananī sarva bhūtānām saṃsāre smin vyavasthitā
translated: You are the mother of all beings, established in this world.

original: mātā vīrāvalī devī kāruṇyaṃ kuru vatsale // / //
analyzed: mātā vīrāvalī devī kāruṇyam kuru vatsale
translated: O Goddess, the mother of the Vidyas, be compassionate, O loving one.

analyzed: daṇḍaka
translated: Daṇḍaka🔽You are the supreme power of knowledge, manifest in form,
emerged from the light born of the bliss of the supreme truth,

original: parā jñānaśaktis tvam icchā kriyā ṛjvirekhā punaḥ suptanāgendravat
analyzed: jñāna śaktiḥ tvam icchā kriyā punar supta nāga indra vat
translated: you are the will, action, the straight line, again like a sleeping king of serpents,

original: kuṇḍalākārarūpā prabhur nādaśaktis tu saṅgīyase bhāsurā
analyzed: prabhuḥ nāda śaktiḥ tu saṅgīyase bhāsurā
translated: in the form of a circular shape, you are the powerful power of sound, you are sung as radiant,

original: jyotirūpā surūpā śivā jyeṣṭhanāmā ca vāmā ca raudrī manākhyāmbikā
analyzed: surūpā śivā jyeṣṭha nāmā ca vāmā ca raudrī mana ākhyā ambikā
translated: in the form of light, beautiful, auspicious, known as Jyeshtha, Vama, Raudri, Manaka, Ambika,

analyzed: tvam tri koṇā aumakāraḥ ikāra
translated: You are in the form of a dot, half-moon, and triangle, the syllable Om and I,

analyzed: āpadyase tattva rūpā bhaga ākāra vat sthāyinī
translated: united with the letter E, becoming one, you assume the form of reality, abiding in the form of the Yoni.

original: āditattvodbhavā yonirūpā ca śrīkaṇṭhasambodhanī rudramātā🔽tathānantaśaktiḥ susūkṣmā trimūrtyāmarīśārghinī bhārabhūtis
analyzed: yoni rūpā ca śrīkaṇṭha sambodhanī rudra mātā
translated: You are the Yoni, born from the primordial principle, the one who awakens Shrikantha, the mother of Rudra,🔽and also the infinite power, the most subtle, the one worshipped by the Lord of Immortals in the Trimurti form, the bearer of the burden,

analyzed: sthāṇu bhūtā hara ākhyā ca
translated: consisting of the Lord of the Lunar Days, the one who has become immobile, known as Hara, and the one who enjoys the Lord of Jhanti and the Lord of Bhauti.
You are worshipped by the Lord of Grace, who consists of Sadya, the one who enjoys the great army when associated with cruel company,
the nectar that ends with sixteen, the one whose body is flooded with the flow of the collection of drops, the one who bestows the bliss of perfect supreme bliss,
the one who grants the bliss of liberation, the one who is engaged in playing in the garden of Bhairava,

original: parā mālinī rudramālārcite rudraśaktiḥ khagī siddhayogeśvarī
translated: the supreme Malinī, worshipped with Rudra's garland, the power of Rudra, the sky-goer, the accomplished Yoginī,

original: siddhamātā vibhuḥ śabdarāśīti yonyārṇavī vāgviśuddhāsi vāgeśvarī
analyzed: siddha mātā vibhuḥ śabdarāśiṇī iti vāc viśuddhā asi vāgeśvarī
translated: the accomplished mother, the all-pervading one, the collection of sounds, the ocean of the Yoni letters, the one purified by speech, the mistress of speech,

original: mātṛkāsiddham icchā kriyā maṅgalā siddhalakṣmī vibhūtiḥ subhūtir
translated: the accomplishment of the Mātṛkā, the will, the action, the auspicious one, the accomplished glory, the prosperity, the good fortune,

original: gatiḥ śāśvatā khyāti nārāyaṇī raktacaṇḍā karālekṣaṇā bhīmarūpā
analyzed: gatiḥ śāśvatā khyāti nārāyaṇī rakta caṇḍā karāla īkṣaṇā bhīma rūpā
translated: You are the eternal path, known as Narayani, red and fierce, with terrible eyes and a frightening form,

analyzed: mahā ucchuṣma yāga priyā tvam jayantī ajitā rudra sammohanī
translated: Delighting in the great and dry yaga, victorious, and deluding Rudra.

analyzed: tvam nava ātmāna devasya ca utsaṅgayā an āśritā
translated: You are seated in the lap of the nine-fold self-existent deity,

analyzed: mantra mārga anugaiḥ mantribhiḥ vīra pāna anuraktaiḥ su bhaktaiḥ ca
translated: You are worshipped, O Goddess, by the mantra-following mantriṇīs, the passionate drinkers of the heroes, the good devotees,

analyzed: sampūjyase devi pañcāmṛtaiḥ divya pāna utsavaiḥ eka janma dvijanma
translated: With the five nectars, the divine drinking festivals, by those born in one life, two lives,

analyzed: tri janma catur pañca ṣaṣ sapta janma udbhavaiḥ taiḥ ca nāraiḥ
translated: Three, four, five, six, or seven lives, and by those good and auspicious men,

analyzed: śubhaiḥ phalguṣaiḥ tarpyase madya māṃsa priye
translated: You are satisfied, O lover of wine and meat.

analyzed: mantra vidyā vrata udbhāṣibhiḥ muṇḍa kaṅkāla kāpālibhiḥ
translated: By those who speak of mantras, knowledge, and vows, by the shaven-headed, skeleton-bearing, skull-bearing,

analyzed: divya caryā anurūḍhaiḥ namaskāraḥ oṃkāra svāhā svadhākāra vauṣaṭ vaṣaṭ
translated: Those who have attained divine conduct, by the salutations, the Oṃkāra, Svāhā, Svadhā, Vaṣaṭ,

analyzed: kāra phaṭkāra hūṃkāra jātībhiḥ etaiḥ ca mantra akṣara uccāribhiḥ
translated: Vaṣaṭkāra, Phaṭkāra, Hūṃkāra, and Jāti sounds, by those who utter these mantra syllables,

analyzed: vāma hasta sthitaiḥ ca akṣasūtra āvalī jāpibhiḥ sādhakaiḥ putrakaiḥ
translated: By the practitioners, the sons,

analyzed: mātṛbhiḥ maṇḍale dīkṣitaiḥ yogibhiḥ yoginī vṛnda melāpakaiḥ
translated: The mothers initiated in the maṇḍala, by the yogis, the gatherers of the host of yoginīs,

original: rudrakrīḍālasaiḥ pūjyase yogināṃ yogasiddhiprade devi tvaṃ
analyzed: rudra krīḍā alasaiḥ pūjyase yoginām yoga siddhi prade devi tvam
translated: O Goddess, you are worshipped by yogis who move slowly like Rudra, O bestower of yogic accomplishments,

original: padmapattropamair locanaiḥ snehapūrṇais tu yaṃ paśyase
analyzed: padma pattra upamaiḥ locanaiḥ sneha pūrṇaiḥ tu yam paśyase
translated: By those who see you with eyes like lotus petals, filled with affection,

analyzed: tasya divya antarīkṣa sthitā sapta pātāla sat khecarī siddhiḥ avyāhatā
translated: For them, the attainment of the celestial and aerial beings, the seven netherworlds, and the excellent sky-walkers is unobstructed.

original: vartate / bhaktito yaḥ paṭhed daṇḍakaṃ ekakālaṃ dvikālaṃ trikālaṃ
analyzed: vartate bhaktitaḥ yaḥ paṭhet daṇḍakam eka kālam dvi kālam tri kālam
translated: One who recites the Dandaka with devotion, once, twice, or thrice a day,

original: śuciḥ saṃsmared yaḥ sadā mānavaḥ so'pi śastrāgnicaurārṇave
analyzed: śuciḥ saṃsmaret yaḥ sadā mānavaḥ saḥ api śastra agni caura arṇave
translated: The pure human being who always remembers you, O Goddess, he too is protected from weapons, fire, thieves, and the ocean,

original: parvatāgre 'pi saṃrakṣase devi putrānurāgān mahālakṣmi ye
analyzed: parvata agre saṃrakṣase devi putra anurāgāt mahā lakṣmi ye
translated: And even on a mountain peak, O Goddess, out of love for your children, O Great Lakshmi,

analyzed: hema caura anya dāra anuṣaktāḥ ca brahma ghna go ghnā mahā doṣa duṣṭā
translated: Those who steal gold, those who are attached to other's wives, those who kill Brahmins and cows, those who are greatly sinful and wicked,

original: vimuñcanti saṃsmṛtya devi tvadīyaṃ mukhaṃ pūrṇacandrānukāraṃ🔽sphuraddi vyamāṇikyasatkuṇḍalodghṛṣṭagaṇḍasthalaṃ
analyzed: vimuñcanti saṃsmṛtya devi tvadīyam mukham pūrṇa candra anukāram  sphurat di
translated: They are released, O Goddess, by remembering your face, which resembles the full moon,🔽With cheeks rubbed by beautiful earrings of sparkling gems,

original: ye 'pi baddhā dṛḍhair bandhanair nāgapāśair bhujābaddha
analyzed: ye pi baddhāḥ dṛḍhaiḥ bandhanaiḥ nāgapāśaiḥ bhuja ābaddha
translated: Those who are bound tightly with strong bonds, with serpent nooses, with arms and legs bound,

analyzed: pāda argalaiḥ te pi tvad nāma saṅkīrtanāt devi muñcanti
translated: They too are released, O Goddess, by chanting your name,

analyzed: ghoraiḥ mahā vyādhibhiḥ saṃsmṛtya pāda aravinda dvayam te
translated: By remembering your pair of lotus feet, O Goddess, from terrible and great diseases,
O Mahakalika, whose radiance is like the fire at the end of time, O Skanda, Govinda, Brahma, Indra, Chandra, and Surya,

analyzed: puṣpāyudhaiḥ mauli mālā ali sat padma kiñjalka sat piñjaraiḥ sevyase
translated: I am your servant, O you who are served by those whose hair is yellow like the filaments of beautiful lotuses,

analyzed: sarva vīra ambike bhairavī bhairavaḥ te śaraṇya āgataḥ haṃ
translated: O mother of all heroes, O Bhairavi, I have come to you for refuge, O Bhairava.

analyzed: kṣamasva aparādham kṣamasva aparādham śive
translated: Forgive my offense, forgive my offense, O Shiva.

analyzed: evam stutā mahādevī bhairaveṇa mahātmanā
translated: Thus praised by the great Bhairava, the great goddess,

original: tato liṅgaṃ vinirbhidya nirgatā parameśvarī // / //🔽nīlāñjanasamaprakhyā kubjarūpā vṛkodarā /
analyzed: tatas liṅgam vinirbhidya nirgatā parameśvarī  nīlāñjana sama prakhyā kubja rūpā vṛkodarā
translated: then emerging from the linga, the supreme goddess,🔽dark like blue collyrium, hunchbacked, with a voice like a wolf,

analyzed: īṣat karāla vadanā barbara ūrdhva śiroruhā
translated: with a slightly terrible face, with matted hair standing on end,

analyzed: surūpā ca virūpā ca aneka ākāra rūpiṇī
translated: beautiful and ugly, assuming many forms,

analyzed: vāma prasārita karā vāma devīm uvāca ha
translated: with her left hand outstretched, spoke to Vamadevi,

analyzed: ājñā ānanda samāviṣṭā stuti ānanda ākulīkṛtā
translated: pervaded by the bliss of knowledge, agitated by the bliss of praise,

original: na vedmi ko 'tra māṃ stauti kāhaṃ kasya varapradā // / //🔽uvācaivaṃ mahāsattvā dṛṣṭipāto madīyakaḥ /
analyzed: na vedmi kaḥ tra mām stauti kā aham kasya vara pradā  uvāca evam mahā sattvāḥ dṛṣṭipātaḥ madīyakaḥ
translated: I do not know who is praising me here, who I am, or to whom I should grant boons.

original: āśīviṣeva duṣprekṣyaḥ sa kathaṃ dhāritas tvayā // / //
analyzed: āśīviṣā iva duṣprekṣyaḥ sa katham dhāritaḥ tvayā
translated: The great being said this: My glance is like a poisonous snake, difficult to look at. How did you bear it?

original: prārthayasva tadā kiñcid yat te manasi rocate // / //
analyzed: prārthayasva tadā kiñcid yat te manasi rocate
translated: Then ask for something that pleases your mind.

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Bhairava said:

analyzed: prasādāya mahādevi dada ājñā anugraham mama
translated: For the grace of the great goddess, grant me the favor of knowledge.

original: tapasā tava cogreṇa mama hāniḥ kujāmbike // / //
analyzed: tapasā tava ca ugreṇa mama hāniḥ kuja ambike
translated: By your fierce austerity, O mother of the planet, there has been a loss to me.

original: sañjātā tena me devi pūrvam uktam idaṃ mayā /
analyzed: sañjātā tena me devi pūrvam uktam idam mayā
translated: Therefore, O goddess, this was previously said by me.

analyzed: evam śrutvā mahādevī sa lajjā gadgada īkṣanā
translated: Having heard this, the great goddess, with embarrassment and faltering eyes,

original: kiṃ te siddhaṃ mahādeva yena lajjāpitā vayam // / //
analyzed: kim te siddham mahādeva yena lajjā pitāḥ vayam
translated: What has been accomplished by you, O great god, by which we have been embarrassed?

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Bhairava said:

analyzed: pūrvam uktam mayā tubhyam ājñā samaya gocare
translated: Previously, it was said by me to you in the domain of the samaya of the command,

analyzed: mad tulyā anugṛhītvā tu paścāt bhava gaṇa ambikā
translated: Having been favored by me as equal, later you will become the mother of the Gaṇas.

analyzed: kasya idam siddha santānam pāramparya krama āgatam
translated: Whose is this lineage of the accomplished ones, which has come through the lineage of teachers?

original: matsakāśāt punas tubhyaṃ tvatsakāśāt punar mama // / //
analyzed: mad sakāśāt punar tubhyam tvad sakāśāt punar mama
translated: From me again to you, and from you again to me.

original: evaṃ tad bhairavaṃ vākyaṃ śrutvā devī parāṅmukhī /
analyzed: evam tat bhairavam vākyam śrutvā devī parāṅmukhī
translated: Having heard these words of Bhairava, the goddess turned away.

analyzed: sañjātā kubjikā rūpā lajjātaḥ rabhasa uditā
translated: Having become embarrassed, she arose suddenly in the form of Kubjikā.

original: kiṃ tu lajjāyase devi pūrvam ājñā mayā tava /
analyzed: kim tu lajjāyase devi pūrvam ājñā mayā tava
translated: But why are you embarrassed, O goddess? Previously, the command was given by me to you.

original: idānīṃ dada me śīghraṃ mā śaṅkā mā vilambaya // / //
analyzed: idānīm dada me śīghram mā śaṅkā mā vilambaya
translated: Now quickly give it to me, do not suspect, do not delay.

analyzed: śrī kubjikā uvāca
translated: The venerable Kubjika said:

analyzed: a prabuddha pramattena yadā tat rabhasa uditam
translated: When that was rashly uttered by one who is not awakened and heedless,

original: tat kiṃ nigrahabuddhyā vā yuktaṃ tvedaṃ kujeśvara // / //
analyzed: tat kim nigraha buddhyā vā yuktam tvā idam kuja īśvara
translated: O Lord of the Kulas, is it proper to consider it as a matter of punishment?

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: The venerable Bhairava said:

original: sarvānugrahake devi kiṃ na budhyasi cātmani /
analyzed: sarva anugrahake devi kim na budhyasi ca ātmani
translated: O Goddess who bestows grace on all, why do you not understand this in yourself?

original: na mayā rahitaṃ kiñcin na tvayā rahitaṃ kvacit // / //
analyzed: na mayā rahitam kiñcid na tvayā rahitam kvacid
translated: There is nothing anywhere devoid of me, nor is there anything devoid of you.

analyzed: anyonya guṇa yogena kārya kāraṇa yogataḥ
translated: By the union of mutual qualities and the relation of cause and effect,

original: tvaṃ gurur mama deveśi ahaṃ te na vicāraṇāt // / //
analyzed: tvam guruḥ mama deveśi aham te na vicāraṇāt
translated: you are my Guru, O Goddess of the Lord of Gods, I am yours, not by deliberation.

analyzed: rudra bhairava vīrāṇām eṣā ca ājñā na kasyacid
translated: This is the command of Rudra, Bhairava, and the Heroes, not of anyone else.

original: yadi śiṣyaṃ na manyetha mitratvena tadā dada // / //
analyzed: yadi śiṣyam na manyetha mitra tvena tadā dada
translated: If you do not consider the disciple, then give it to me as a friend.

original: evaṃ brūte tadā devyā sarvam etad bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam brūte tadā devyā sarvam etat bhaviṣyati
translated: When the Lord speaks thus, all this will come to pass.

analyzed: paścimā idam kṛtam deva pūrva bhāga vivarjitam
translated: This is done in the west, O Lord, devoid of the eastern part.

original: candradvīpaṃ manoramyaṃ deva tyaktuṃ na me manaḥ /
analyzed: candradvīpam manaḥ ramyam deva tyaktum na me manaḥ
translated: O Lord, my mind does not wish to abandon the delightful Island of the Moon.

analyzed: paścimam sarva mārgāṇām tvam tāvat anuśīlaya
translated: You should first follow the western path of all paths.

analyzed: paścima āmnāya mārgaḥ yam siddhānām akhilam dada
translated: This is the path of the Western Tradition, which grants everything to the perfected ones.

original: gacchāmy ahaṃ punas tatra bhārate kulaparvatam // / //
analyzed: gacchāmi aham punar tatra bhārate kulaparvatam
translated: I am going back there to the Kula mountain in Bhārata.

analyzed: anādi yuga paryantam kīrtayāmāsa tad vidām
translated: From the beginning of the primordial age until now, it has been praised by those who know it.

analyzed: śrīparvatam kumāra ākhyam chāyā chatra vibhūṣitam
translated: The glorious mountain named Kumāra, adorned with shade and an umbrella.

analyzed: evam uktvā gatā tūrṇam śrīmat kaumāra parvatam
translated: Having said this, she quickly went to the glorious Kumāra mountain.

analyzed: tatra chāyā ātmikā devī avyaktā vyakta rūpiṇī
translated: There, the goddess in the form of shade, unmanifest yet manifest,

analyzed: kṣapitvā kāla paryāyam yāvat ālokayet diśām
translated: Having passed a long time, as far as she could see in the directions,

original: uttarāṃ tāvat tat sarvaṃ liṅgapūrṇaṃ mahāvanam // / //
analyzed: uttarām tāvat tat sarvam liṅga pūrṇam mahā vanam
translated: To the north, all that great forest of Liṅga-pūrṇa,

analyzed: aśīti yojana āyāmam samantāt parimaṇḍalam
translated: Eighty yojanas in length and breadth, circular all around,

analyzed: catur dvāra samopetam tīrtha koṭibhiḥ āvṛtam  aneka siddha saṃchannam manaḥ ramyam anopamam
translated: Endowed with four gates, surrounded by millions of holy places,🔽Concealed by many perfected beings, delightful, incomparable,

analyzed: tamaḥ guṇa gaṇa ākīrṇam aneka āścarya saṃkulam  devyā adṛṣṭi nipātena akasmāt śrīḥ upasthitā
translated: Filled with the qualities of the tamas quality, full of many wonders,🔽By the fall of the goddess's glance, suddenly prosperity appeared.

analyzed: tena śrīśailam uddiṣṭam devyānām apratiṣṭhitam
translated: Therefore, it is called Śrīśaila, the unsurpassed by the goddess.

original: aṅguṣṭhena kṛtā rekhā svasthānasya ca tasya vai /
analyzed: aṅguṣṭhena kṛtā rekhā sva sthānasya ca tasya vai
translated: The line drawn by the thumb is of his own place.

original: tatra jātā nadī divyā sāsīmā ubhayor api // / //
analyzed: tatra jātā nadī divyā sā asīmā ubhayoḥ api
translated: There the divine river was born, the boundary of both.

original: tacchāyāṃ niścalāṃ kṛtvā ājñāṃ dattvā tu śāmbhavīm /
analyzed: tad chāyām niścalām kṛtvā ājñām dattvā tu śāmbhavīm
translated: Having made the shadow motionless and given the order of Shambhu,

original: atra yo viśate kaścit sa me tulyo bhaviṣyati // / //
analyzed: atra yaḥ viśate kaścid sa me tulyaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Whoever enters here will be equal to me.

analyzed: hartā kartā svatantraḥ sau bhraṣṭa jñāna prakāśakaḥ
translated: He is the doer, the independent one, the revealer of fallen knowledge.

analyzed: ājñātaḥ guṇam aiśvaryam trailokye sa carācare
translated: The knowledge, qualities, and lordship in the three worlds with the moving and unmoving.

analyzed: evam ākṣepayitvā tu gatā trikūṭa parvatam
translated: Having thus rebuked, he went to the Trikuta mountain.

original: tatra kālaṃ kṣapitvā tu kiṣkindhākhyam anugrahet // / //
analyzed: tatra kālam kṣapitvā tu kiṣkindhā ākhyam anugrahet
translated: Having spent time there, he would favor the one called Kishkindha.

analyzed: tasya ca ājñā vibhūtim tu dattvā anugṛhya rākṣasān
translated: Having given the prosperity of his order and favored the demons,

original: yena tiṣṭhāmy ahaṃ tīre samudrasya tv aśaṅkitā // / //
analyzed: yena tiṣṭhāmi aham tīre samudrasya tu aśaṅkitā
translated: By whom I remain on the shore of the ocean without fear.

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca

analyzed: toṣitā udya tvayā nāthe pṛccha pṛccha su durlabham

translated: Śrī Kubjikā said:

analyzed: pṛcchāmi praṇaya āviṣṭā ajñāna guṇa śālinī

analyzed: parama artham yadā deva tadā syāt siddhi sādhanam

translated: Please explain with grace, how is the teacher the conduct?

analyzed: sādhanam sarva vastūnām yena ekena prapadyate

analyzed: mantra tantreṇa yogena ājñātaḥ sampravartate
translated: It proceeds by the knowledge of the mantra and tantra yoga.

analyzed: tat sarvam helayā nāthaḥ eka uccārāt vada prabho
translated: O Lord, please tell me all that by the utterance of the one syllable, O Lord.

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Bhairava said:

analyzed: tena te kledanā mārgam kathayāmi sura arcite
translated: Therefore, O Goddess worshipped by the gods, I tell you the path of moistening.
The one who brings about eternal bliss, the one who awakens the meaning of welfare,

analyzed: gurum anveṣayet yatnāt subhagam priya darśanam
translated: One should search for the guru with effort, who is fortunate and pleasant to behold.

analyzed: śubha jāti su vṛtti stham śubha deśa samudbhavam

analyzed: jñāna vijñāna sampannam samasta artha viśāradam
translated: Endowed with knowledge and wisdom, skilled in all matters,

analyzed: kāla jñam nipuṇam dakṣam sāmartha jñam akutsitam
translated: Knowing time, skillful, dexterous, knowing capability, not despised,

analyzed: sarva avayava sampannam vyaṅga doṣa vivarjitam
translated: Endowed with all limbs, free from the faults of deformity.

analyzed: vedha ghaṭṭa nirodha jñam loka mārga viśāradam
translated: Who knows the obstruction of piercing and striking, who is skilled in the worldly path,

original: kriyākāṇḍarataṃ śāntaṃ subhaktaṃ guruvatsalam // / //🔽susantuṣṭam alobhiṣṭhaṃ tapasvijanavatsalam /
analyzed: kriyā kāṇḍa ratam śāntam su bhaktam guru vatsalam  su santuṣṭam alobhiṣṭham tapasvi jana vatsalam
translated: Who is devoted to ritual action, peaceful, a good devotee, affectionate towards the guru,🔽Well-satisfied, most non-greedy, affectionate towards the people of austerity,

analyzed: pratipanna jana ānandam śauryavantam dṛḍha vratam  vidyām abhaya dātāram laulya cāpalya varjitam
translated: Who delights the people who have approached, who is valorous, firm in vows,🔽Who gives knowledge and fearlessness, who is free from fickleness and restlessness,

analyzed: ācāra pālakam dhīram samayeṣu kṛta āspadam
translated: Who upholds good conduct, who is steadfast, who is established in the commitments,

original: āgataṃ na tyajed vastuṃ yo gatvā na parigrahet /
analyzed: āgatam na tyajet vastum yaḥ gatvā na parigrahet
translated: One should not abandon a thing that has come, one who having gone does not accept,

original: sa gurur na manuṣyānāṃ devānām api durlabhaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa guruḥ na manuṣyānām devānām api durlabhaḥ
translated: That guru is not of humans, but is difficult to find even by gods.

original: śaktihīnaṃ guruṃ prāpya śiṣye muktiḥ kutaḥ priye /
analyzed: śakti hīnam gurum prāpya śiṣye muktiḥ kutas priye
translated: O Beloved, how can there be liberation for the disciple when obtaining a guru who is devoid of power?

analyzed: mūla chinne yathā vṛkṣe kutas puṣpa phala ādikam
translated: Just as there are no flowers, fruits, etc. on a tree whose root has been cut,

original: evaṃvidhaṃ guruṃ prāpya ko na mucyeta bandhanāt /
analyzed: evaṃvidham gurum prāpya kaḥ na mucyeta bandhanāt
translated: Having obtained a guru of this kind, who would not be liberated from bondage?

analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā sarva bhāvena śiṣyaḥ ca ārādhayet gurum

original: ātmanā ca dhanenaiva dāsatvena bhajet tu tam /
analyzed: ātmanā ca dhanena eva dāsa tvena bhajet tu tam
translated: And should serve him with his own wealth and as a slave.

original: tāvad ārādhayed devi prasanno yāvat sa guruḥ // / //
analyzed: tāvat ārādhayet devi prasannaḥ yāvat sa guruḥ
translated: O Goddess, he should worship him as long as the guru is pleased,

original: prasanno dadate dīkṣāṃ yayā pāśakṣayo bhavet /
analyzed: prasannaḥ dadate dīkṣām yayā pāśa kṣayaḥ bhavet
translated: If pleased, he grants initiation by which the bonds are destroyed.

original: prabodho bhavate tasya gṛhṇāti yadi tatkramāt // / //
analyzed: prabodhaḥ bhavate tasya gṛhṇāti yadi tat kramāt

original: akramād dadate yas tu akramād gṛhṇate tu yaḥ /
analyzed: akramāt dadate yaḥ tu akramāt gṛhṇate tu yaḥ
translated: But he who grants it out of sequence and he who accepts it out of sequence,

analyzed: dvau etau niścitau baddhau pāśaiḥ kula samudbhavaiḥ

original: yāvad aṣṭau tathā pañca trīṇy abdāni subhāvitaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat aṣṭau tathā pañca trīṇi abdāni su bhāvitaḥ

original: tāvan na kārayed dīkṣāṃ niṣiddhas tu kulānvaye // / //
analyzed: tāvat na kārayet dīkṣām niṣiddhaḥ tu kula anvaye

original: atha ced gurusāmarthyād dadate dayayā śiśoḥ /
analyzed: atha ced guru sāmarthyāt dadate dayayā śiśoḥ

original: tathāpi tena kartavyaṃ dāsatvaṃ tu guroḥ kule // / //
analyzed: tathā api tena kartavyam dāsa tvam tu guroḥ kule

original: ākruṣṭaḥ śatadhā vāpi tāḍitas tu sahasradhā /
analyzed: ākruṣṭaḥ śatadhā vā api tāḍitaḥ tu sahasradhā

original: evaṃ kṛte na yasyāsti virāgas tasya yogyatā // / //
analyzed: evam kṛte na yasya asti virāgaḥ tasya yogyatā

original: guruṇā roṣito vātha yo dadyād uttaraṃ kvacit /
analyzed: guruṇā roṣitaḥ vā atha yaḥ dadyāt uttaram kvacid

analyzed: sa tu naśyati duṣṭa ātmā ajīrṇe bhojanam yathā

analyzed: guroḥ kopam na kartavyam vāc manaḥ kāya karmabhiḥ

analyzed: tasya kopāt dahiṣyanti prāpta jñānam marīcayaḥ
translated: The rays will burn the attained knowledge by his anger.

analyzed: martya lokam samāsādya kiñcid jñāḥ guravaḥ yadi
translated: If the gurus, who are partially enlightened, reach the mortal world,

original: tadā jñānasya kā rakṣā jñānacauraṃ haranti tāḥ // / //
analyzed: tadā jñānasya kā rakṣā jñāna cauram haranti tāḥ
translated: then how can there be protection of knowledge? They steal the knowledge thief.

analyzed: kṣamā śīlam gurum matvā yadi śiṣya upamānayet
translated: If a disciple, considering the guru to be forgiving and virtuous, disrespects him,

analyzed: prāptam me jñāna sadbhāvam gacchāmaḥ kathanam vinā

analyzed: tasya rodha ādikāḥ devyaḥ mūka tvam janayanti vai
translated: The goddesses such as Rodini cause him to become mute.

analyzed: na rohati yathā bījam dagdham tadvat idam priye
translated: Just as a burnt seed does not grow, O beloved, so is this.

analyzed: ājñā yogam kriyā mantram muṣitvā yaḥ palāyate
translated: One who, having stolen the knowledge yoga, ritual mantra, and fled,

original: na ca tena samaṃ yāti tatraivāyāti niścitam // / //
analyzed: na ca tena samam yāti tatra evā āyāti niścitam

analyzed: na abubhukṣāḥ bubhukṣāḥ vā ghṛṇī kṣīṇa tanuḥ bhavet

analyzed: ukta anukteṣu kāryeṣu upekṣām na eva kārayet
translated: One should not remain indifferent to tasks that have been done or not done.

analyzed: śaṭhaḥ tu duṣṭa bhāvaḥ ca mṛṣāvādya pravādakaḥ
translated: But a deceitful one with evil intentions, a false speaker and slanderer,

analyzed: antaraṅgī na sadbhāvī sa naṣṭaḥ kañjinī yathā

analyzed: dvidhā bhāva abhipannasya bhinna bhāvaḥ itas tatas
translated: One who is beset with duality, with a divided mind here and there,

analyzed: yaḥ evam vartate mūḍhaḥ sa naṣṭaḥ kañjikam yathā

analyzed: ājñā sphurantam ānandam gurum tyaktvā anyam āśrayet

analyzed: sanniruddhaḥ tu sarvatra rājya bhraṣṭaḥ yathā nṛpaḥ
translated: But one who is restrained everywhere is like a king who has lost his kingdom.

analyzed: śarīram dravya vijñānam vastra vāhana bhūṣaṇam
translated: The body, knowledge of substances, clothes, vehicles, ornaments,

analyzed: gurau santoṣite sarvam toṣitam sa carācaram
translated: When the guru is satisfied, all that moves and does not move is satisfied.

translated: There is none equal to the guru in the world of mortals, and even more so in the sky,

analyzed: yaḥ tārayet duḥkha mahā arṇava oghāt kim tasya kartum sa karoti śiṣyaḥ

analyzed: na mātā na pitā ca eva na bhrātā na eva bāndhavāḥ
translated: Neither a mother nor a father, nor a brother, nor a relative,

analyzed: upakāram hi kurvanti kurute yādṛśam guruḥ
translated: Do such a favor as a guru does.

original: evaṃ matvā varārohe duḥkhe duḥkhī sukhe sukhī /
analyzed: evam matvā varārohe duḥkhe duḥkhī sukhe sukhī
translated: Thinking thus, O beautiful lady, be sorrowful in sorrow and joyful in joy.

analyzed: guroḥ vairodhikam sthānam pramādāt api na vrajet
translated: One should not go even out of carelessness to a place that is inimical to the guru.

analyzed: upaviṣṭasya pārśve tu kartavyam mārjana ādikam
translated: While the guru is seated, one should do tasks like cleaning.

analyzed: bhikṣā pātram nivedyeta puṣpa dhāṭīm vahet sadā
translated: One should offer the alms bowl and always carry a basket of flowers.

analyzed: antaraṅgam na kartavyam vāc manaḥ kāya karmaṇā
translated: One should not engage in intimacy with the guru physically, verbally, or mentally.

original: yat kiñcid gurave kāryaṃ tat kartavyam aśaṅkitaiḥ // / //
analyzed: yat kiñcid gurave kāryam tat kartavyam aśaṅkitaiḥ
translated: Whatever needs to be done for the guru should be done without hesitation.

analyzed: yaḥ evam vartate śiṣyaḥ sukha duḥkha samāśrayī
translated: A disciple who behaves thus, sharing in the guru's happiness and sorrow,

original: tasya siddhir na dūrasthā mokṣaḥ svādhīnatāṃ gataḥ // / //
analyzed: tasya siddhiḥ na dūra sthā mokṣaḥ svādhīna tām gataḥ
translated: For him, success is not far away, and liberation is under his control.

analyzed: guruṇā āpāditam sarvam upadeśam prapūjayet
translated: One should honor all the teachings imparted by the guru.

original: tasmād evaṃ viditvā tu gurur devo na cānyathā // / //
analyzed: tasmāt evam viditvā tu guruḥ devaḥ na ca anyathā
translated: Therefore, knowing this, the guru is God, and not otherwise.

analyzed: triṣkālam praṇipātena dhyāna yogena tam yajet
translated: One should worship Him with prostrations three times a day and with the yoga of meditation.

analyzed: adṛṣṭa vigraha īśānam upalabhyeta na anyathā
translated: One will not attain the Lord of the invisible form in any other way.

analyzed: mantra dhyāna tapaḥ upāyaiḥ caryā yogaiḥ anekadhā
translated: By the means of mantras, meditation, austerities, practices and yogas in many ways,

original: na paśyanti paraṃ śambhuṃ yāvan nopāsayed gurum // / //
analyzed: na paśyanti param śambhum yāvat na upāsayet gurum
translated: One does not see the supreme Śambhu as long as one does not worship the Guru.

analyzed: dhyāyantaḥ sadā bhaktyā mad rūpam guruṇā uditam
translated: Even though one always meditates with devotion on my form as taught by the Guru,

analyzed: tathā api na bhavet saukhyam śāmbhavam paramārthataḥ
translated: Still, one does not attain the bliss of Śambhu in the highest sense.

analyzed: yāvat mūrdhnā upari pādāḥ ājñā yuktaḥ su bhāvitaḥ
translated: As long as the feet are well-contemplated on the head along with the Command,

analyzed: tāvat na jāyate śīghram adṛṣṭa guṇa lakṣaṇam
translated: For so long, the unseen qualities and characteristics do not arise quickly.

original: gururūpavidhau yadi niścalatā tad upāsati mūrdhni dhṛtāṅghriyugam /
analyzed: guru rūpa vidhau yadi niścala tā tat upāsati mūrdhni dhṛta aṅghri yugam
translated: If one worships with unwavering devotion the form of the Guru, with the feet placed on the head,

analyzed: acireṇa bhavati aṇima ādi guṇa aṣṭaka śambhu padam
translated: One soon attains the qualities of the eight Siddhis beginning with aṇimā, and the state of Śambhu.

analyzed: ājñā hīne parokṣa tvam trayāṇām darśitam mayā
translated: I have shown the state of being beyond the senses of the three who lack the Command,

analyzed: rudra bhairava vīrāṇām kathanāt yogaḥ pravartate
translated: By describing the Rudras, Bhairavas, and Vīras, yoga proceeds.

analyzed: siddhe siddham vinirdiṣṭam pratyakṣa guṇa lakṣaṇam
translated: The accomplished one is said to possess the qualities of direct perception.

original: ājñātaḥ sampravarteta sā cājñā guravo viduḥ // / //
analyzed: ājñātaḥ sampravarteta sā ca ājñā guravaḥ viduḥ
translated: One should engage in it with the teacher's command, and that command is known by the teachers.

analyzed: śāstre śāstre smṛtam jñānam mayā aneka vidhānataḥ
translated: The knowledge mentioned in each scripture has been understood by me in many ways.

analyzed: pratyakṣa mantra nihitā siddha ājñā siddha gocare
translated: The accomplished command, hidden in the mantras perceived directly, is in the domain of the accomplished ones.

analyzed: tena idam siddha santānam guru deva upalakṣitam
translated: Therefore, this lineage of the accomplished ones is characterized by the teacher and the deity.

analyzed: yasya ca ajñāni pātena sambodhaḥ śāmbhavaḥ bhavet
translated: And by whose descent of the teacher's command, the Śaivite enlightenment would occur.

analyzed: pratyakṣam guravam tyaktvā jñāna rūpam kula īśvaram
translated: Having abandoned the teacher in visible form, the lord of the Kula,

analyzed: katham ārādhanāni atra kurute mohita ātmanaḥ
translated: how does one, deluded in mind, worship elsewhere?

analyzed: nirvāṇa agnau jvalat dīpte yaḥ nyatra agnau vrajet kudhīḥ
translated: The one of dull intellect who goes to another fire, leaving the blazing fire of nirvāṇa,

original: devāgāraṃ guruṃ tyaktvā vrajaty adhobhavaṃ tu saḥ // / //
analyzed: devāgāram gurum tyaktvā vrajati adhas bhavam tu saḥ
translated: he goes to the state of the lower ones, abandoning the temple and the teacher.

analyzed: pūrva karma viśuddhasya śaktipātaḥ su nirmalaḥ
translated: For one purified by previous karma, the descent of Śakti is very pure.

analyzed: tīvra śakti nipātaḥ sya śīghram eva prapadyate
translated: The intense descent of Śakti occurs quickly for him.

analyzed: malakāya prapūrṇasya mandam mandam pravartate
translated: For one filled with the body of impurity, it proceeds slowly and slowly.

analyzed: abhāgyasya api ṣaṣ māsāt tīvra tvam samprapadyate
translated: Even for the unfortunate one, the intensity occurs within six months.

analyzed: yāvat na sarva bhāvena martya lokam upāgatam
translated: As long as it has not come to the mortal world with all its being,

original: gurumūrtidharaṃ śambhuṃ tāvat pāto na śāmbhavaḥ // / //
analyzed: guru mūrti dharam śambhum tāvat pātaḥ na śāmbhavaḥ
translated: As long as one does not fall from the state of Śiva, one should worship Śambhu, the embodiment of the Guru.

original: madvīryaḥ pārado yadvat patitaḥ sphuṭitaḥ kaṇaiḥ /
analyzed: mad vīryaḥ pāradaḥ yadvat patitaḥ sphuṭitaḥ kaṇaiḥ
translated: Just as mercury, my essence, falls and shatters into particles,

original: tadvac ca deśikendrāṇāṃ rūpeṇa prabhramāmy aham // / //
analyzed: tadvat ca deśika indrāṇām rūpeṇa prabhramāmi aham
translated: in the same way, I wander in the form of the great Gurus.

original: mama vīryaprasūtās te ācāryāḥ sūtakeva hi /
analyzed: mama vīrya prasūtāḥ te ācāryāḥ sūtakā iva hi
translated: They, born from my essence, are like the Gurus born from the womb.

analyzed: vindhanti saṃskṛtāḥ santaḥ bhaktyā oṣadhi su jāraṇāt
translated: When purified, the good ones, by the proper preparation of devotion and medicine, establish (me).

original: aham ekaḥ kulālo vai khecarādau guṇojjvalaḥ /
analyzed: aham ekaḥ kulālaḥ vai khecara ādau guṇa ujjvalaḥ
translated: I alone am the potter, shining with qualities in the sky and elsewhere,

analyzed: sṛjāmi nikhilam sarvam guru tve saṃvyavasthitaḥ
translated: established in the state of Guru, I create everything.

analyzed: sādākhyaḥ khecarāṇām ca piṅgaḥ haṃ pavana udbhavaḥ
translated: I am the one called Sadā, the tawny one born from the wind of the sky-goers,

analyzed: tejase nanta rūpaḥ ham nugrahī īśaḥ jala udbhavaḥ
translated: for splendor, I am Ananta-rūpa, the one who bestows grace, born from water.

analyzed: śrīkaṇṭhaḥ ham nivṛtti ante kulīśaḥ ham kṣitī tale
translated: I am Śrīkaṇṭha at the end of Nivṛtti, I am Kulīśa on the surface of the earth,

analyzed: akhilam sarvam ekaḥ api anekadhā sthitaḥ
translated: I grace everything, though one, I abide in many ways.

original: yena yena hi bhāvena pṛcchito 'haṃ yathā yathā /
analyzed: yena yena hi bhāvena pṛcchitaḥ ham yathā yathā
translated: In whatever way and with whatever attitude I am asked,

original: tathā tathā mayā sarvaṃ gurutve sampradarśitam // / //
analyzed: tathā tathā mayā sarvam guru tve sampradarśitam
translated: in the same way and by the same means, everything is shown by me in the state of Guru.

analyzed: atrā eva siddha santāne pratyakṣaḥ ham vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Here in the Siddha Tantra, I am established in the manifest form.

analyzed: guru mūrtau sthitaḥ nityam yasya ājñā sampravartate
translated: Always abiding in the Guru's form, whose command proceeds.

analyzed: suvarṇasya yathā ākārāḥ saṃjñā bhedaiḥ anekadhā
translated: Just as gold, in various forms and names,

analyzed: kaṭa kaṅkaṇa keyūraiḥ kaṇṭhī mudrā aṅgulīyakaiḥ
translated: In bracelets, armlets, necklaces, and finger rings,

analyzed: tathā te guravaḥ jñeyāḥ mama ājñā aṅga samudbhavāḥ
translated: So should those Gurus be known, born from the limbs of my command.

original: rasavad vedhakā jñeyā stokaṃ stokaṃ bahuṃ bahum // / //
analyzed: rasa vat vedhakā jñeyā stokam stokam bahum bahum
translated: The alchemists should be known as having the essence, a little for a little, much for much.

original: palakoṭipalānāṃ ca guñjād evaṃ na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: pala koṭi palānām ca guñjāt evam na saṃśayaḥ

analyzed: evam vibhūtiḥ ākhyātā yuga rūpa anusāriṇī
translated: Thus the glory is declared, following the form of the yuga.

original: palena vihito vedhaḥ kiṃ guñjāto na vidhyati /

translated: When there is refinement everywhere, one should not think of much or little.

analyzed: para apara vibhāgena kāla bhāva vaśena ca

I am indeed a Pala measure of Mercury, and he is born from a Guñjā measure.

analyzed: sama pādena ca āruhya guroḥ agre a jānataḥ

analyzed: guroḥ āsthāna saṃsthāne ca āruhya pādukaiḥ saha
translated: Having mounted on the Guru's seat with shoes on,

analyzed: guru dṛṣṭi gate pāde japate tasya pūrvavat
translated: when the foot comes within the Guru's sight, one should repeat as before.

original: jyeṣṭho bhrātā guror mātā guroḥ sthānārcakās tu ye // / //
analyzed: jyeṣṭhaḥ bhrātā guroḥ mātā guroḥ sthāna arcakāḥ tu ye
translated: The Guru's elder brother, the Guru's mother, and those who worship the Guru's seat,

original: trīṇy etās tatsamā jñeyā draṣṭavyā guruvad yathā /
analyzed: trīṇi etāḥ tad samāḥ jñeyāḥ draṣṭavyāḥ guru vat yathā
translated: these three should be known as equal to the Guru and should be seen as such.

original: apamānya yadā hy etān ātmasambhāvitaḥ kudhīḥ // / //
analyzed: apamānya yadā hi etān ātma sambhāvitaḥ kudhīḥ
translated: If, out of self-importance, the evil-minded one disrespects them,

analyzed: prāyaścittī sa lakṣeṇa śudhyate guru pūjayā
translated: he becomes subject to expiation and becomes pure by worshipping the Guru with one hundred thousand repetitions.

original: upamardya guroḥ sthānaṃ pāpātmā yatra tiṣṭhati // / //
analyzed: upamardya guroḥ sthānam pāpa ātmā yatra tiṣṭhati
translated: Where the sinful one remains, having disregarded the Guru's seat,

analyzed: tasya darśana sambhāṣāt pātakinaḥ bhavanti te
translated: by seeing and speaking to him, they become sinners.

original: yadā sādhuḥ prasannātmā tadā lakṣatrayeṇa vai // / //
analyzed: yadā sādhuḥ prasanna ātmā tadā lakṣa trayeṇa vai
translated: When the virtuous one is pleased, then by three hundred thousand repetitions,

original: maṇḍalānāṃ sahasreṇa gurupūjā tv anantaram /🔽pādukopānahau chattraṃ śayyāpaṭṭo 'tha bhājanam // / //
analyzed: maṇḍalānām sahasreṇa guru pūjā tu anantaram  pādukā upānahau chattram śayyā paṭṭaḥ bhājanam
translated: After that, the worship of the Guru with a thousand mandalas.🔽Sandals, shoes, an umbrella, a bed, a cloth, a vessel,

original: pādena saṃspṛśed yas tu śire dhṛtvāṣṭakaṃ japet // / //🔽iti kulālikāmnāye śrīkubjikāmate manthānabhedapracāraratisaṅgamo nāma tṛtīyaḥ paṭalaḥ 🔽śrīkubjikā uvāca🔽tṛptāhaṃ devadeveśa bījamantrair anekadhā /
analyzed: pādena saṃspṛśet yaḥ tu śire dhṛtvā aṣṭakam japet  iti kulālikāmnāye śrī kubjikāmate manthānabhedapracāraratisaṅgamaḥ nāma tṛtīyaḥ paṭalaḥ  śrī kubjikā uvāca  tṛptā aham devadeveśa bīja mantraiḥ anekadhā
translated: One who touches with the foot, holding the Aṣṭaka, should repeat the mantra.

original: cakraiś ca vividhākāraiḥ sadyaḥpratyayakārakaiḥ // / //🔽adyāpi saṃśayo nātha mantrāṇāṃ nirṇayaṃ prati /🔽pūrvaṃ ca kathitā mantrāḥ saptakoṭir asaṅkhyayā // / //🔽sādhanāni punas teṣāṃ sadyaḥpratyayakārakāḥ /🔽kliṣyanti manujātyantaṃ japahomaparāyaṇāḥ // / //🔽vrataiś ca vividhākāraiḥ kaṣṭaiś cāndrāyaṇādibhiḥ /🔽kimarthaṃ te na sidhyanti japtvā koṭiśatair api // / //🔽tvaṃ ca devo vibhuḥ kartā tvayoktaṃ sat yam ucyate /
analyzed: cakraiḥ ca vividha ākāraiḥ sadyas pratyaya kārakaiḥ 🔽adyā api saṃśayaḥ nātha mantrāṇām nirṇayam prati 🔽pūrvam ca kathitāḥ mantrāḥ sapta koṭiḥ asaṅkhyayā 🔽sādhanāni punar teṣām sadyas pratyaya kārakāḥ 🔽kliṣyanti manuja atyantam japa homa parāyaṇāḥ 🔽vrataiḥ ca vividha ākāraiḥ kaṣṭaiḥ cāndrāyaṇa ādibhiḥ 🔽kimartham te na sidhyanti japtvā koṭi śataiḥ api 🔽tvam ca devaḥ vibhuḥ kartā tvayā uktam sat yam ucyate
translated: Thus ends the third chapter named The Practice of the Union of Joy in the Disclosure of the Churning in the venerable Kulaśekhara, the Tantra of Kubjikā, in the teaching of the venerable Kulālī.

original: avicāreṇa tad grāhyaṃ mithyā kiṃ deva bhāṣitam // / //
analyzed: avicāreṇa tat grāhyam mithyā kim deva bhāṣitam
translated: Without consideration, that should be accepted. O God, is it false that is spoken?

original: dhvaṃsitāś ca tvayā lokā māyārūpeṇa bhairava // / //
analyzed: dhvaṃsitāḥ ca tvayā lokāḥ māyā rūpeṇa bhairava
translated: And by you, the worlds have been destroyed by the form of illusion, O Bhairava.

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Bhairava said:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu mahā prājñe vastu codya vikalpini
translated: Well done, well done, O greatly wise one, who is inclined to question the reality!

original: ye mayā kathitā mantrāḥ pūrvaṃ ye kāmasiddhidāḥ // / //
analyzed: ye mayā kathitāḥ mantrāḥ pūrvam ye kāma siddhi dāḥ
translated: Those mantras that were told by me before, which bestow the accomplishment of desires,

analyzed: te gopitāḥ mayā devi varṇa rūpāḥ prakāśitāḥ
translated: They have been concealed by me, O Goddess, and their form has been revealed.

translated: Therefore, they are not successful even by reciting them hundreds of millions of times.

analyzed: oṃkāreṇa tu te guptāḥ namaskāreṇa bhāmini
translated: But they are concealed by the syllable Om, O beautiful lady, by the salutation.

original: tena guptena guptās te śeṣā varṇās tu kevalāḥ // / //
analyzed: tena guptena guptāḥ te śeṣāḥ varṇāḥ tu kevalāḥ
translated: By that concealment, they are concealed, the remaining syllables are only single.

analyzed: eka akṣarāḥ dvi akṣarāḥ ca catur pañca nava akṣarāḥ
translated: Some are one syllable, some two syllables, some four, five, or nine syllables.

original: kūṭamantrāś ca ye kecit piṇḍamantrās tathaiva ca // / //
analyzed: kūṭa mantrāḥ ca ye kecid piṇḍa mantrāḥ tathā eva ca
translated: And those that are secret mantras, and likewise the concise mantras,

analyzed: ekāśīti padāḥ ca anye sahasra antāḥ śata ardhikāḥ
translated: And others consisting of eighty-one parts, ending with a thousand, and half a hundred,

original: sarve te niṣphalāḥ proktāḥ kiṃ tu jīvavivarjitāḥ // / //
analyzed: sarve te niṣphalāḥ proktāḥ kim tu jīva vivarjitāḥ
translated: All of them are said to be fruitless, but they are devoid of life.

original: loke prasiddham evaṃ hi jīvahīnā mṛtāḥ kila /
analyzed: loke prasiddham evam hi jīva hīnāḥ mṛtāḥ kila
translated: Thus it is well known in the world that the dead are indeed devoid of life.

original: mṛtasya copacāreṇa kiṃ teṣāṃ jīvitaṃ bhavet // / //
analyzed: mṛtasya ca upacāreṇa kim teṣām jīvitam bhavet
translated: And what would be the life of those who are dead by the performance of the obsequies?

analyzed: evam mantrāḥ varārohe akṣara arthe vyavasthitāḥ
translated: Thus, O fair lady, the mantras are established in the meaning of the syllables.

original: vratacaryair na sidhyanti sat yam etad udāhṛtam // / //
analyzed: vrata caryaiḥ na sidhyanti sat yam etat udāhṛtam
translated: It is said that they are not accomplished by the practices of vows.

original: sidhyante jīvayuktās tu kim atra pravicāryate /
analyzed: sidhyante jīva yuktāḥ tu kim atra pravicāryate
translated: But they are accomplished when united with life. What is there to ponder over here?

analyzed: anyonya valitāḥ ca eva bheditāḥ dvādaśa svaraiḥ
translated: And they are mutually embraced and divided by the twelve vowels.

analyzed: rañjitāḥ śakti bījena sidhyante varavarṇini
translated: They are delighted by the seed of Shakti and are accomplished, O fair-complexioned lady.

analyzed: uktāḥ kāma pradāḥ sarve sarve ca amogha śaktayaḥ
translated: All of them are said to bestow desires and all of them have unfailing power.

analyzed: śiva vaktra udbhavāḥ sarve manana trāṇa dharmiṇaḥ
translated: All of them originate from Shiva's mouth and have the nature of reflection and protection.

original: trāṇaṃ tu rakṣaṇaṃ proktaṃ tac ca varṇavivarjitam // / //
analyzed: trāṇam tu rakṣaṇam proktam tat ca varṇa vivarjitam
translated: Protection is said to be guarding, and that is devoid of letters.

analyzed: śuddha sphaṭika sakāśam cāra uccāra vivarjitam
translated: Resembling pure crystal, devoid of the utterance of a and u,

analyzed: jvalantam svena tejena hṛd padme saṃvyavasthitam
translated: Shining with its own brilliance, situated in the lotus of the heart.

original: bhāvayec chūnyam ātmānam ekībhūtaṃ tayā saha /
analyzed: bhāvayet śūnyam ātmānam ekībhūtam tayā saha
translated: One should contemplate on the void self, united with her,

analyzed: suṣumṇā cāra yogena udyantam ravi bimba vat
translated: Rising like the orb of the sun through the practice of the Susumna path.

analyzed: ojāpūka ākramān bhittvā vidyākubja pade sthitam
translated: Having pierced through the sequence of Oja, Apa, and Ka, situated in the state of Vidyakubja,

original: tāvat kampaty asau yogī stobham āyāti tatkṣaṇāt // / //
analyzed: tāvat kampati asau yogī stobham āyāti tad kṣaṇāt
translated: The yogi trembles for that long, and at that moment, he becomes motionless.

original: mudrā mantraṃ tathā bhāṣā sarvaṃ jānāti tattvataḥ /
analyzed: mudrā mantram tathā bhāṣā sarvam jānāti tattvataḥ
translated: Mudra, mantra, and language - he knows all of them truly.

analyzed: kubjīśāna padam prāptam supta avasthā prajāyate
translated: Having attained the state of Kubjishana, the state of sleep arises.

analyzed: īṣat mātram vijānāti supta avasthā vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Established in the state of sleep, he knows just a little.

analyzed: brahmarandhra gatā ca ājñā kāṣṭha vat tiṣṭhate tadā
translated: The command located in the brahmarandhra remains like a piece of wood at that time.

analyzed: yava mātra pramāṇam tu tri koṇa ākṛtim uttamam
translated: The supreme, triangular form, just the size of a barley grain,

analyzed: vaḍavāmaṇi indriyam yadvat mīlana unmīlanāni ca
translated: like the supreme organ of the mare, closing and opening -

original: tatra madhye gataṃ cetaḥ kāṣṭhāvasthā tu jāyate /
analyzed: tatra madhye gatam cetaḥ kāṣṭha avasthā tu jāyate
translated: the mind goes in the middle of that, and the state of wood arises.

analyzed: bherī mṛdaṅga śabda ādyaiḥ gīta vādyaiḥ anekadhā
translated: By the sounds of drums, kettledrums, and so on, by the many songs and musical instruments,

original: na śṛṇoti na paśyeta na cānyaṃ manyate prabhum /
analyzed: na śṛṇoti na paśyeta na ca anyam manyate prabhum
translated: he does not hear, does not see, and does not think of any other lord.

analyzed: khaḍga cakra ādibhiḥ śastraiḥ chidyamānaḥ na vindati
translated: When being cut by swords, discuses, and other weapons, he does not feel it.

analyzed: īṣat mātram vijānāti śaktyā avasthā varānane
translated: O beautiful-faced one, he knows just a little, in the state of Shakti.

original: śaktyantaṃ tu yadā prāptas tadā cotpatate kṣaṇāt // / //
analyzed: śakti antam tu yadā prāptaḥ tadā ca utpatate kṣaṇāt
translated: When he has attained the end of Shakti, then he flies up in an instant.

analyzed: evam krameṇa deveśi śakti uccāram samabhyaset
translated: In this way, O Goddess of the gods, one should practice the utterance of Shakti in sequence.

analyzed: satata abhyāsa yogena vāc īśa tvam prajāyate
translated: By the yoga of constant practice, the state of being the lord of speech is produced.

original: māsam ekaṃ yadābhyastaṃ kāvyakartā na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: māsam ekam yadā abhyastam kāvya kartā na saṃśayaḥ
translated: If practiced for one month, one becomes a poet, there is no doubt.

original: dvibhir māsair vapuṣmantaḥ kṣuttṛṣṇādyair na bādhyate // / //
analyzed: dvibhiḥ māsaiḥ vapuṣmantaḥ kṣut tṛṣṇā ādyaiḥ na bādhyate
translated: Within two months, one becomes handsome and is not afflicted by hunger, thirst, and so on.

analyzed: vicaret akhilān lokān yāvat ābhūtasamplavam
translated: One can roam all the worlds until the dissolution of all beings.

original: akṣarārthena ye mantrās teṣām eva vidhiḥ sphuṭam // / //
analyzed: akṣara arthena ye mantrāḥ teṣām eva vidhiḥ sphuṭam
translated: The method is clear only for those mantras whose meaning is in the syllables.

analyzed: śrī kubjikā uvāca
translated: The venerable Kubjikā said:

analyzed: akṣara artha upadeśaḥ ca sampradāyaḥ ca kaulikaḥ
translated: The teaching on the meaning of the syllables and the Kaula tradition,

original: yathā vijñāyate deva prasādaṃ kuru bhairava // / //
analyzed: yathā vijñāyate deva prasādam kuru bhairava
translated: O god, please be gracious and explain how it is known, O Bhairava.

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: The venerable Bhairava said:

original: śṛṇu devi pravakṣyāmi mantrāṇāṃ nirṇayaṃ sphuṭam /
analyzed: śṛṇu devi pravakṣyāmi mantrāṇām nirṇayam sphuṭam
translated: Listen, O goddess, I will explain clearly the determination of mantras.

original: prastārādiranekaiś ca ye mantrāś coditāḥ priye // / //
analyzed: prastāra ādiḥ anekaiḥ ca ye mantrāḥ coditāḥ priye
translated: O beloved, those mantras that are enjoined by the various methods beginning with the prasthāna,

analyzed: akṣara arthena te jñeyāḥ khaṇḍa mantrāḥ śiva uditāḥ
translated: should be known by their syllabic meaning as the fragmentary mantras taught by Śiva,

analyzed: rañjakena samāyuktāḥ upadeśaḥ sura arcite
translated: conjoined with the colorant, O goddess worshipped by the gods.

original: sampradāyo bhaved devi so 'pi ṣaṭsu prabhedataḥ /
analyzed: sampradāyaḥ bhavet devi saḥ pi ṣaṭsu prabhedataḥ
translated: O goddess, the tradition would be, and that also in six divisions.

original: pallavo yogarodhaś ca sampuṭo grathanas tathā // / //
analyzed: pallavaḥ yogarodhaḥ ca sampuṭaḥ grathanaḥ tathā
translated: The pallava, the yoga-rodha, the samputa, the grathana,🔽and the prasthāna, O goddess, are the six divisions of the tradition.

original: vidarbhaś ca ṣaḍ ete hi sampradāyāḥ prakīrtitāḥ /
analyzed: vidarbhaḥ ca ṣaṭ ete hi sampradāyāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: Vidarbha, and these six are proclaimed as the traditions.

original: mālinī śabdarāśiś ca kauliko vidhir uttamaḥ // / //
analyzed: mālinī śabdarāśiḥ ca kaulikaḥ vidhiḥ uttamaḥ
translated: Mālinī, Śabdarāśi, and the excellent Kaulika rite,

original: sā tu jñeyā varārohe bhedāḥ pañcāśa suvrate /
analyzed: sā tu jñeyā varārohe bhedāḥ pañcāśa suvrate
translated: That should be known, O beautiful lady, the divisions are fifty, O lady of good vows.

original: kulaṃ tu ṣaḍvidhaṃ jñeyaṃ tasya vakṣyāmi lakṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: kulam tu ṣaḍvidham jñeyam tasya vakṣyāmi lakṣaṇam
translated: The Kula should be known as sixfold, I will tell its characteristics,

original: paraṃ bījaṃ tathā mūlam āgamo vidhir eva ca /
analyzed: param bījam tathā mūlam āgamaḥ vidhiḥ eva ca
translated: The supreme seed, the root, the scripture, and the rite itself,

analyzed: varṇa rāśi samāyuktaḥ ṣaḍvidhaḥ tu kula kramaḥ
translated: Endowed with the collection of letters, the Kulakrama is indeed sixfold.

analyzed: sakalaḥ niṣkalaḥ ca eva tathā sakalaniṣkalaḥ
translated: The complete, the incomplete, and also the complete and incomplete,

analyzed: sūkṣmaḥ bhinna kalaḥ ca eva kalā atītaḥ varānane
translated: The subtle, the divided, and the one beyond the parts, O beautiful lady,

original: ṣaṭprakāro bhaven mantro jñātavyaḥ siddhim icchatā /
analyzed: ṣaṣ prakāraḥ bhavet mantraḥ jñātavyaḥ siddhim icchatā
translated: The mantra should be known to be of six kinds by one who desires success.

analyzed: śuddha dvandva ja saṭkīrṇaḥ upadeśaḥ tri bhedataḥ
translated: The instruction is threefold, pure, dual, and mixed.

analyzed: śrī kubjikā uvāca
translated: Śrī Kubjikā said:

original: sūcitā mantramārge tu ye mantrā lakṣaṇānvitāḥ /
analyzed: sūcitāḥ mantra mārge tu ye mantrāḥ lakṣaṇa anvitāḥ
translated: Those mantras endowed with characteristics that are indicated on the path of mantra,

analyzed: te jñeyāḥ tvad prasādena dhyāna dhāraṇa yogataḥ
translated: They should be known through the yoga of meditation and retention by your grace.

original: kulamārgagatā deva yathā bhavati tat katham /
analyzed: kula mārga gatā deva yathā bhavati tat katham
translated: O God, how does it become one who follows the path of Kula?

original: kathaṃ tu pallavo yoga ādi ṣaṭsu prakārataḥ // / //
analyzed: katham tu pallavaḥ yogaḥ ādi ṣaṭsu prakārataḥ
translated: How is the sprout yoga in the six kinds?

original: kaulikaṃ ṣaḍvidhaṃ kiṃ tu mantrāṇāṃ ṣaḍvidhā gatiḥ /
analyzed: kaulikam ṣaḍvidham kim tu mantrāṇām ṣaḍvidhā gatiḥ
translated: But what is the sixfold Kaula and the sixfold state of the mantras?

original: trividhaś copadeśaś ca etad icchāmi veditum // / //
analyzed: trividhaḥ ca upadeśaḥ ca etat icchāmi veditum
translated: And the threefold instruction - I wish to know this...

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Bhairava said:

original: pallavo ādideśe tu yogo madhye vijānataḥ /
analyzed: pallavaḥ ādideśe tu yogaḥ madhye vijānataḥ
translated: The Pallava is in the beginning, the Yoga is in the middle for the wise one.

analyzed: rodhaḥ tu ādi madhya ante sampuṭaḥ ca ādiḥ anta gaḥ
translated: The Rodha is at the beginning, middle and end, and the Samputa is at the beginning and end...

analyzed: grathanam ca antare jñeyam akṣara akṣara yogataḥ
translated: The Grathana should be known in the middle, through the union of the manifest and unmanifest.

analyzed: vidarbhaḥ mantram ādau tu mantra ante vīra nāyike
translated: The Vidharbha is at the beginning of the mantra, O heroine of the heroes, at the end of the mantra...

analyzed: mālā grathanam etat hi jñātavyam mantra vādinā
translated: This is the garland-binding that should be known by the reciter of mantras.

original: pallavo mantrabodhe tu yogo jñeyas tu sarvadā // / //
analyzed: pallavaḥ mantrabodhe tu yogaḥ jñeyaḥ tu sarvadā
translated: The Pallava is in the understanding of the mantra, the Yoga should always be known...

analyzed: amalīkaraṇe ca eva sandhānasya vidhau priye
translated: And in the purification of the impurities, in the rite of union, O beloved.

original: yogas tu kathito hy evaṃ rodhaś caivānukathyate // / //
analyzed: yogaḥ tu kathitaḥ hi evam rodhaḥ ca eva anukathyate
translated: Yoga is thus described, and Rodha is also narrated...

analyzed: tīvra mantra pada stambhe vāc stambhe sainya stambhane
translated: In the paralysis of intense mantra words, in the paralysis of speech, in the paralysis of the army,

analyzed: hasti ādi śakaṭa yantre nāvā ante ca prakīrtitaḥ
translated: In the machine of the elephant and other vehicles, at the end of the boat, it is proclaimed...

original: teṣu rodhaḥ praśasyeta paśūnām utkrameṣu ca /
analyzed: teṣu rodhaḥ praśasyeta paśūnām utkrameṣu ca
translated: Among them, Rodha is praised, and in the transgressions of the animals.

analyzed: sampuṭaḥ mantra rakṣāsu vaśyā arthe ca eva yojayet
translated: The samputa is to be employed for the protection of mantras and for subjugation.

analyzed: amṛtīkaraṇe ca eva viṣe sthāvara jaṅgame
translated: And for the deathless state, for the immobile and mobile poisons,

analyzed: śāntika ādiṣu kāryeṣu sampuṭaḥ tu
translated: The samputa is recommended for pacifying and other rites.

analyzed: grathanam rūpa kāryeṣu ākṛṣṭi ādiṣu karmasu
translated: The binding is for the purposes of form and for the rites of attraction and so on.

analyzed: sandhāne tu varārohe grathanam samudāhṛtam
translated: O beautiful lady, the binding is declared for the union.

analyzed: vidarbhaḥ sarva kāryeṣu ukta anukteṣu vastubhiḥ
translated: The vidarbha is for all rites, for the mentioned and unmentioned things.

original: kartavyaṃ satataṃ devi yadi siddhiṃ samīhate // / //
analyzed: kartavyam satatam devi yadi siddhim samīhate
translated: O Goddess, it should always be done if one desires accomplishment.

analyzed: etat devi samākhyātam sampradāya vidhiḥ śubhaḥ
translated: O Goddess, this auspicious tradition has been declared.

original: na mayā kasyacit khyātaṃ satyaṃ satyaṃ gaṇāmbike // / //
analyzed: na mayā kasyacid khyātam satyam satyam gaṇa ambike
translated: It has not been revealed to anyone by me, it is true, true, O Mother of the Ganas.

original: sāmprataṃ kulamārgas tu yathā bhavati tac chṛṇu /
analyzed: sāmpratam kula mārgaḥ tu yathā bhavati tat śṛṇu
translated: Now listen to how the Kula path is,

analyzed: param binduḥ samākhyātaḥ hṛd padme sura nāyike
translated: The supreme bindu is declared in the lotus of the heart, O chief of the gods.

original: grahaṇaṃ tasya copāyas taṃ jñeyaṃ kaulikaṃ param /
analyzed: grahaṇam tasya ca upāyaḥ tam jñeyam kaulikam param
translated: The means of grasping it is to be known as the supreme Kaula.

original: bījaṃ kuṇḍalinī śaktir yā karoti gamāgamam // / //
analyzed: bījam kuṇḍalinī śaktiḥ yā karoti gama āgamam
translated: The seed is the power of Kundalini, which causes coming and going.

original: tasyāntaṃ tu tato jñātvā bījaṃ kaulikam uttamam /
analyzed: tasya antam tu tatas jñātvā bījam kaulikam uttamam
translated: Having known its end, the seed is the supreme Kaula.

original: mūlaṃ śaktiḥ smṛtā kubjī jagataḥ kāraṇātmikā // / //
analyzed: mūlam śaktiḥ smṛtā kubjī jagataḥ kāraṇa ātmikā
translated: The root is known as Kubjikā's power, the cause of the universe.

analyzed: tasyāḥ jātam aśeṣam tu ābrahma bhuvana antikam
translated: Everything up to the world of Brahmā is born from her.

analyzed: sṛjate yena suśroṇi kārya kāraṇa yogataḥ
translated: By which, O beautiful-hipped one, she creates through the union of cause and effect.

analyzed: jñeyāḥ dharmiṇi dharmi tvam yathā ūṣmā kṛṣṇavartmanaḥ
translated: The quality of being qualified should be known in the qualified, just as heat is in a black line.

analyzed: etat kaulikam ākhyātam mūla saṃjñā varānane
translated: This is said to be Kaulika, the root-named, O beautiful-faced one.

original: āgamas tatra sūtrārtho vidhis tatraiva coditā /
analyzed: āgamaḥ tatra sūtra arthaḥ vidhiḥ tatra eva coditā
translated: The scripture there is the meaning of the sūtra, and the injunction is stated there itself.

analyzed: varṇa rāśi kramaḥ jñeyaḥ nādi pha anta svarūpataḥ
translated: The sequence of the collection of letters should be known in the form of the letters from na to pha.

analyzed: ādi kṣāntaḥ ca deveśi śabda rāśi kramaḥ viduḥ
translated: O Goddess of the gods, the wise know the sequence of the collection of sounds from the beginning to the end.

analyzed: etat kaulikam ākhyatam ṣaṣ prakāram varānane
translated: This is said to be Kaulika, of six kinds, O beautiful-faced one.

analyzed: sakala ādi krameṇa eva vakṣyamānam nibodhata
translated: Understand what is being said in the sequence beginning with the complete.

analyzed: brahma sthaḥ sakalaḥ mantraḥ aṣṭatriṃśat kalaiḥ yutaḥ
translated: The complete mantra resides in Brahmā, endowed with the thirty-eight parts.

analyzed: pūri aṣṭaka samopetaḥ udbhava sthaḥ vijānataḥ
translated: Endowed with the group of eight purities, it abides in the udbhava state for the wise.
O Goddess, the incomplete mantra resides in the throat, devoid of parts and time.

original: rudrasthānagato bhadre mantro bhāvair dvibhir yutaḥ /
analyzed: rudra sthāna gataḥ bhadre mantraḥ bhāvaiḥ dvibhiḥ yutaḥ
translated: O good lady, the mantra resides in the Rudra state, endowed with two essences.

original: sthūlajālakalair yukto bindvādīnāṃ ca sambhavaiḥ // / //🔽sūkṣmādhārasthito hy ekaḥ sparśākhyo mantravedakaḥ /
analyzed: sthūla jāla kalaiḥ yuktaḥ bindu ādīnām ca sambhavaiḥ  sūkṣma ādhāra sthitaḥ hi ekaḥ sparśa ākhyaḥ mantra vedakaḥ
translated: Endowed with the gross and subtle nets, and with the possibilities of the Bindu and others.🔽The one who is established in the subtle support, known as Sparsha, is the knower of mantras.

original: sakalo niṣkalaś cāsau mantro jñeyas tu suvrate // / //
analyzed: sakalaḥ niṣkalaḥ ca asau mantraḥ jñeyaḥ tu suvrate
translated: He is both Sakala and Niskala. The mantra should be known, O one of good vows.

analyzed: vilīnaḥ bindudeve tu yoni ākāra svarūpataḥ
translated: Dissolved in the Bindu deity, in the form of the Yoni.

analyzed: śabda sparśa vinirmuktaḥ mantraḥ jñeyaḥ tu niṣkalaḥ
translated: The mantra should be known as Niskala, free from sound and touch.

original: sūkṣmāt sūkṣmataro devi sa ca sūkṣmo nigadyate /
analyzed: sūkṣmāt sūkṣmataraḥ devi sa ca sūkṣmaḥ nigadyate
translated: Subtler than the subtle, O Goddess, he is said to be subtle.

original: kālarūpaḥ smṛto bindus taṃ bhittvā vrajate yadi // / //
analyzed: kāla rūpaḥ smṛtaḥ binduḥ tam bhittvā vrajate yadi
translated: If the Bindu, remembered as the form of time, is penetrated by him, he proceeds.

analyzed: ūrdhva pade pravṛttasya suṣumṇā ādhāra gocaraḥ
translated: When engaged in the upward state, he reaches the abode of Susumna.

analyzed: pralīnaḥ śabdadeve tu cicchakti pratibodhitaḥ
translated: Dissolved in the Sound deity, awakened by the power of consciousness.

original: bhinnakalaḥ smṛto hy evaṃ layātītas tu mokṣadaḥ /
analyzed: bhinna kalaḥ smṛtaḥ hi evam layātītaḥ tu mokṣa daḥ
translated: Thus he is remembered as Bhinnakala, and the one beyond dissolution grants liberation.

analyzed: pañca avasthā samākhyātā mantrāṇām amita ojasām
translated: The five states of mantras of immeasurable power have been described.

original: yāvad evaṃ na vindeta tāvat siddhiḥ kuto bhavet /
analyzed: yāvat evam na vindeta tāvat siddhiḥ kutas bhavet
translated: As long as one does not attain this, how can there be success?

analyzed: hṛd kaṇṭha tālu jihvā oṣṭhau danta nāsā udbhava akṣarāḥ
translated: The letters arising from the heart, throat, palate, tongue, lips, teeth, and nose.

analyzed: kṣaṇa pradhvaṃsinaḥ devi yathā utpattiḥ tathā kṣayaḥ
translated: O Goddess, as there is origination, so is destruction of things that perish in a moment.

original: kṛtakā hy acetanā śūnyā anityā jalpakārakāḥ // / //
analyzed: kṛtakāḥ hi śūnyāḥ anityāḥ jalpa kārakāḥ
translated: They are created, insentient, empty, impermanent, and mere talkers.

analyzed: pañca avasthā prabhinnaḥ tu tadā mantram iha ucyate
translated: But when divided into five states, then it is called mantra here.

original: evaṃ mantragatiṃ jñātvā sidhyante līlayā narāḥ // / //
analyzed: evam mantra gatim jñātvā sidhyante līlayā narāḥ
translated: Knowing the path of mantra in this way, men are easily successful.

analyzed: piṅgala bhruve nāmena ṣaṣṭhamam tu su locane

analyzed: nuda yugmam tri pañca eva kūṭa yugmam dvis aṣṭakam

analyzed: herī yugmam smṛtam bhadre ṣaḍviṃśakam anuttamam

analyzed: geri yugmam tathā proktam saptaviṃśatimam padam

analyzed: ca eva dvis abhyāsāt aṣṭāviṃśa varānane

analyzed: ghurilā iti tathā api evam ūnatriṃśam udāhṛtam

analyzed: namaḥ mātṛ gaṇāya iti triṃśakam kathitam sphuṭam

analyzed: samasta pada saṃyogāt parimāṇam śata ardhakam

analyzed: dvitīyam kathitam devi tṛtīyam

analyzed: ṭhala madhya āsana āsīnam caturtha svara bheditam

analyzed: mantrāṇām dīpakam devi yathā karmaṇi yojayet

analyzed: vidyāyāḥ tu prasaṅgena pañca praṇavam uddhṛtam

analyzed: sāmpratam śṛṇu kalyāṇi vidyā māhātmyam uttamam

analyzed: āhnika cheda sañjāte śatam ekam udīrayet

analyzed: kāka ulūka kapotānām pakṣiṇām ghātane kṛte

Those who kill snakes, cats, and Dundubha (a kind of drum) and those who kill fish,

translated: If one out of negligence censures the preceptor, the son, the practitioner, or one who knows the rules,

The people from Konkana, China, Bahlika, Bengal, and Kamrupa,
