analyzed: tad śarīra gatāḥ varṇāḥ pañca praṇava bheditāḥ
translated: those letters located in the body, divided by the five Praṇavas,

analyzed: pañcayonyāḥ svarūpeṇa varṇam ekaika saṅkhyayā
translated: by the nature of the five Yonis, with each letter counted as one,
Bhairava is the mass of sound, by the sequence from the letter A to the end.

original: te varṇāḥ pañcapraṇavaiḥ sampuṭec ca pṛthak pṛthak /
analyzed: te varṇāḥ pañca praṇavaiḥ sampuṭet ca pṛthak pṛthak
translated: Those letters should be encapsulated separately with the five Praṇavas,

analyzed: ādi kṣānta krameṇa eva niyojanam udāhṛtam
translated: the employment is declared by the sequence from the letter A to the end.

original: dvābhyāṃ tu grathanaṃ kāryaṃ samastasyāpi śobhane /
analyzed: dvābhyām tu grathanam kāryam samastasya api śobhane
translated: O beautiful one, the entire (Vidyā) should be strung together with two (letters).

original: sapta varṇān dadec cādau madhye vidyāpadaṃ dadet // / //🔽punaḥ sapta padasyānte tasyānte tu padaṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: sapta varṇān dadet ca ādau madhye vidyā padam dadet  punar sapta padasya ante tasya ante tu padam punar
translated: One should place the seven letters at the beginning, in the middle one should place the Vidyā pada,🔽again at the end of the pada, again at the end of that,

original: punaḥ saptakam uccārya padaṃ ca tadanantaram // / //
analyzed: punar saptakam uccārya padam ca tad anantaram
translated: having uttered the group of seven again, and after that the pada,

analyzed: anena krama yogena nirvāhena tu yojayet
translated: one should employ it by this method of sequence, by the Nirvāha (method).

original: kṣāntaṃ vai yāva deveśi tāvad eva niyojayet // / //
analyzed: kṣāntam vai deveśi tāvat eva niyojayet
translated: O Goddess of the Lord of gods, as long as it is tolerated, one should engage in it to that extent.

analyzed: pada saṅkhyā samastasya nirvāha ubhaya dīpite
translated: The number of words and the accomplishment of the entire [Vidyā] are illuminated by both.

original: mālinī dvādaśair bhedaiḥ śabdarāśis tu ṣoḍaśaiḥ // / //
analyzed: mālinī dvādaśaiḥ bhedaiḥ śabdarāśiḥ tu ṣoḍaśaiḥ
translated: Mālinī [Vidyā] has twelve divisions, and the collection of sounds has sixteen.

original: anena kramaśaḥ sarve varṇāś caiva pṛthak pṛthak /
analyzed: anena kramaśas sarve varṇāḥ ca eva pṛthak pṛthak
translated: By this, all the letters are individually arranged in order.

analyzed: cala cakra vibhāgena pada vidyām yadā yajet
translated: When one worships the Vidyā of words by the division of the moving wheel,

original: tadā kṣobhaṃ karoty āśu divyādivyetaraṃ priye /
analyzed: tadā kṣobham karoti āśu divya adivya itaram priye
translated: then, O beloved, it quickly causes agitation, divine and otherwise.

original: yonayaḥ pañcadhā yās tu sarvāḥ klidyanti nānyathā // / //
analyzed: yonayaḥ pañcadhā yāḥ tu sarvāḥ klidyanti na anyathā
translated: The five types of wombs are all moistened, not otherwise.

original: drāvaṇaṃ kṣobhaṇaṃ mohaṃ jṛmbhaṇaṃ śoṣaṇaṃ tathā /
analyzed: drāvaṇam kṣobhaṇam moham jṛmbhaṇam śoṣaṇam tathā
translated: Dissolution, agitation, stupefaction, yawning, and drying -

original: sarvān tān kurute devi yadā śaktisamo bhavet // / //
analyzed: sarvān tān kurute devi yadā śakti samaḥ bhavet
translated: O Goddess, it brings about all of them when it becomes equal to Śakti.

analyzed: prasupta bhujaga ākārāḥ dvādaśānte varānane
translated: O beautiful-faced one, it has the form of a sleeping serpent at the end of the twelve [finger spaces].

original: nābhiṣṭhā tu tathāpy evaṃ draṣṭavyā parameśvari // / //
analyzed: na abhiṣṭhā tu tathā api evam draṣṭavyā parameśvari
translated: And likewise, O Supreme Goddess, it should be seen in the navel.

original: dṛśyate dehamadhye tu vyomānte ca parāparā /🔽tasyāgre tu tato mantraṃ hutāśakaṇikākṛtim // / //
analyzed: dṛśyate deha madhye tu vyoma ante ca parāparā  tasya agre tu tatas mantram hutāśa kaṇikā ākṛtim
translated: It is seen in the middle of the body, at the end of the sky, as supreme and inferior.🔽Then, in front of it, the mantra, having the form of a spark of fire,

original: uccāreta tato mantraṃ śabdarūpaṃ hṛdi priye /
analyzed: uccāreta tatas mantram śabda rūpam hṛdi priye
translated: One should utter the mantra, O beloved, in the form of sound in the heart.

analyzed: śabda ante śaktiḥ uccāryā īṣat manda ga mārutā
translated: At the end of the sound, the power should be uttered, with a slightly slow breeze.

analyzed: padma sūtra nibha ākārā uccāryā sa anunāsikā
translated: Having the form of a lotus thread, it should be uttered with nasalization.

analyzed: uccāra anta avasāne tu jñātavya alāta cakra vat
translated: At the end of the utterance, it should be known like a whirling firebrand.

analyzed: tatra madhya gatam devi caitanyam mantra saṃyutam
translated: There, O Goddess, the consciousness located in the middle, along with the mantra,

analyzed: prasphurat kiraṇa anekaiḥ koṭiśas dikṣu avasthitaiḥ
translated: Resides in the directions with millions of radiating rays.

original: tasyāpy ante tato devi śaktir ādyā manonmanī /
analyzed: tasya api ante tatas devi śaktiḥ ādyā manonmanī
translated: Beyond that, O Goddess, is the primordial power, the mind-born,

original: atītā tu yadā sā vai tadā bindvī udāhṛtā // / //
analyzed: atītā tu yadā sā vai tadā bindvī udāhṛtā
translated: When it is past, then it is called the Bindu.

analyzed: bindu ante vyāpakaḥ devaḥ māyā atītaḥ nirāmayaḥ
translated: At the end of the Bindu, the all-pervading God, beyond Maya, free from disease,

analyzed: sa śivaḥ bhāvanā atītaḥ nirguṇaḥ guṇa sambhavaḥ
translated: That Shiva, beyond thought, devoid of qualities, the source of qualities,

analyzed: adhikārī sarvakārī ca śaktyātītaḥ mahā prabhuḥ
translated: The authorized one, the doer of all, beyond power, the great lord,

analyzed: anena krama yogena kramaḥ kāryaḥ su niścitaiḥ
translated: By this sequence, the sequence should be performed by the well-determined ones.

original: ātmā manaś ca mantraś ca śivaḥ śaktis tathaiva ca /
analyzed: ātmā manaḥ ca mantraḥ ca śivaḥ śaktiḥ tathā eva ca
translated: The self, the mind, the mantra, Shiva, and Shakti,

analyzed: ekībhāva gataḥ devi jñātavyaḥ siddhim īhakaiḥ
translated: Should be known as merged into one state by those seeking perfection, O Goddess.

analyzed: tasmāt prāṇa samam jāpyam mantra ante nāda gocare
translated: Therefore, the repetition should be equal to the breath, at the end of the mantra, in the domain of sound.

original: nādasyānte tato jñātvā etat smaraṇam ucyate // / //
analyzed: nādasya ante tatas jñātvā etat smaraṇam ucyate
translated: Having known the end of the sound, this is said to be recollection.

original: smaraṇaṃ śaktir uddiṣṭā yā karoti gamāgamam /
analyzed: smaraṇam śaktiḥ uddiṣṭā yā karoti gama āgamam
translated: Recollection is declared to be power, which brings about going and coming.

original: tasyānte tu parā sūkṣmā sā kalā amṛtātmikā // / //
analyzed: tasya ante tu parā sūkṣmā sā kalā amṛta ātmikā
translated: At its end is the supreme, subtle, that energy which is of the nature of nectar.

analyzed: laya atītā arūpā tu svayam vedyā avicārataḥ
translated: Beyond dissolution, formless, to be known by oneself, without deliberation.

original: na tasya lakṣaṇaṃ devi na lakṣo naiva yojanā // / //
analyzed: na tasya lakṣaṇam devi na lakṣaḥ nā eva yojanā
translated: O Goddess, it has no characteristic, no mark, no arrangement.

original: na kṣayo naiva vṛddhiś ca śuklakṛṣṇau na caiva hi /🔽na rātrir na dinaṃ caiva na sandhyā ayanaṃ tathā // / //
analyzed: na kṣayaḥ nā eva vṛddhiḥ ca śukla kṛṣṇau na ca eva hi  na rātriḥ na dinam ca eva na sandhyā ayanam tathā
translated: It has no decrease, no increase, and no light and dark fortnights.🔽There is no night, no day, no twilight, no solstices.

original: viṣuvaṃ naiva deveśi saṅkrāntir naiva vidyate /
analyzed: viṣuvam nā eva deveśi saṅkrāntiḥ nā eva vidyate
translated: O Goddess of the Lord of Gods, there is no equinoctial point, no transit.

analyzed: sarva avastha gatim jñātvā vijñānam upajāyate
translated: Knowledge arises from knowing the state of all things.

analyzed: etat kaulikam ākhyātam umāmāheśvaram priye
translated: This is declared to be Kaula, O Beloved, the state of Uma and Mahesvara.

original: utpateta na sandeho lakṣajāpāc calasya tu // / //
analyzed: utpateta na sandehaḥ lakṣa jāpāt calasya tu
translated: One would fly up, there is no doubt, by reciting the mantra one lakh times of the moving one.

original: calā śaktiḥ samākhyātā lakṣaṇena udāhṛtā /🔽avarṇā varṇasaṃyogā mālinī sā udāhṛtā // / //
analyzed: calā śaktiḥ samākhyātā lakṣaṇena udāhṛtā  avarṇā varṇa saṃyogā mālinī sā udāhṛtā
translated: The moving power is declared, described by its characteristics.🔽She is called Malini, who is beyond letters, united with letters.

analyzed: pada bheda gatā hi ekā asaṅkhyātā varānane
translated: She is one, present in the division of words, uncountable, O Beautiful-faced One.

analyzed: evam tad graham ākhyātaḥ sadyas pratyaya kārakaḥ
translated: Thus, the seizing of that [graha] is explained, causing immediate conviction.

analyzed: na kasyacid mayā ākhyātam umā māheśvaram priye
translated: O beloved, I have not told this to anyone, the Uma Maheshvara [mantra].

original: satataṃ japate yas tu yoginīvallabho bhavet // / //
analyzed: satatam japate yaḥ tu yoginī vallabhaḥ bhavet
translated: One who always recites it becomes a beloved of the Yoginis.

original: ṣaṇmāsāc chudhyate devi brahmaghno 'pi na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṣ māsāt śudhyate devi brahma ghnaḥ u pi na saṃśayaḥ
translated: O Goddess, even a killer of Brahmins becomes purified in six months, there is no doubt.

analyzed: paśyate virajām śāntām jyotiḥ rūpām mahā dyutim
translated: One sees the stainless, peaceful, light-formed, greatly radiant [goddess].

original: japasya lakṣaṇaṃ devi idānīṃ śṛṇu sāmpratam /
analyzed: japasya lakṣaṇam devi idānīm śṛṇu sāmpratam
translated: O Goddess, now listen to the definition of japa [recitation].

original: ekoccāraśatānte tu parāvasthā tu gīyate // / //🔽śatabhedaḥ samākhyātas tadguṇo daśa eva tu /🔽sahasrabhedam ity uktaṃ lakṣaḥ śataguṇaḥ smṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: eka uccāra śata ante tu parā avasthā tu gīyate  śata bhedaḥ samākhyātaḥ tad guṇaḥ daśa eva tu  sahasra bhedam iti uktam lakṣaḥ śataguṇaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: At the end of a hundred recitations, the supreme state is sung.🔽The hundred divisions are declared, and ten times that [are the divisions of] a thousand.🔽A hundred thousand is said to be a hundred times that [number].

analyzed: koṭi bhedaḥ śatānām tu lakṣāṇām varavarṇini
translated: O best of women, a crore is the number of hundreds and lakhs.

original: etaj japavidhānaṃ tu kathitaṃ tava śobhane // / //
analyzed: etat japa vidhānam tu kathitam tava śobhane
translated: This is the method of japa that has been told to you, O beautiful one.

analyzed: muktakaḥ śata bhedena yuktam śataguṇam śatam
translated: A hundred times a hundred is the number of hundred divisions.

analyzed: cala cakra vibhāgena lakṣa bhedam udāhṛtam
translated: The division of a lakh is stated by the division of the moving wheel.

analyzed: cala cakram yadā devi koṭi bhedaḥ varānane
translated: O Goddess, when the moving wheel is a crore, O beautiful-faced one,

original: bāhyataḥ kathito bhadre adhyātmikam ataḥ śṛṇu // / //🔽udbhave śatabhedas tu sahasro viśleṣake viduḥ /
analyzed: bāhyatas kathitaḥ bhadre adhyātmikam atas śṛṇu  udbhave śata bhedaḥ tu sahasraḥ viśleṣake viduḥ
translated: O Bhadra, it has been told externally; now listen to the internal.🔽In manifestation, it is known to have a hundred divisions, in separation, a thousand.

original: laye tu lakṣabhedo vai layātīte tu koṭayaḥ // / //
analyzed: laye tu lakṣa bhedaḥ vai laya atīte tu koṭayaḥ
translated: In dissolution, it has a hundred thousand divisions, and in transcendence of dissolution, crores.

original: vāmā jyeṣṭhā tathā raudrī bindvī ca samudāhṛtā /
analyzed: vāmā jyeṣṭhā tathā raudrī bindvī ca samudāhṛtā
translated: Vama, Jyeshtha, Raudri, and Bindu are mentioned.

original: icchā jñānī kriyā śāntā krameṇaiva surārcite // / //
analyzed: icchā jñānī kriyā śāntā krameṇa eva sura arcite
translated: O Devi, the most worshipped, Iccha, Jñana, Kriya, and Shanti are in order.

original: ātmacāragatiṃ jñātvā japaḥ kāryaḥ sadā budhaiḥ /
analyzed: ātma cāra gatim jñātvā japaḥ kāryaḥ sadā budhaiḥ
translated: Having known the movement of the self, japa should always be performed by the wise.

analyzed: anena eva akṣasūtreṇa lakṣa lakṣaṇa lakṣite
translated: With this very rosary, characterized by lakhs of characteristics,

analyzed: kartavyaḥ hi japaḥ nityam sarva śāstra viśāradaiḥ
translated: japa should always be performed by those skilled in all scriptures.

original: bhuvanākhye varārohe śaktyākhye tu tathaiva hi // / //
analyzed: bhuvana ākhye varārohe śakti ākhye tu tathā eva hi
translated: O beautiful lady, in the world called Bhuvana, and in Shakti,

analyzed: cāra uccāra vibhāgena japaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ udāhṛtaḥ
translated: japa is said to be best by the division of movement and utterance.

original: mālā pañcāśikā proktā sūtraṃ śaktiḥ śivātmikā // / //
analyzed: mālā pañcāśikā proktā sūtram śaktiḥ śiva ātmikā
translated: The rosary is said to be of fifty, the thread is Shakti, of the nature of Shiva.

analyzed: grathanam kuṇḍalī śaktiḥ laya ante meru saṃsthitam
translated: The binding is the Shakti of Kundalini, remaining at the end of dissolution in Meru.

analyzed: etat guptataram kāryam akṣa sūtram śiva ātmakam
translated: This rosary of the nature of Shiva should be kept very secret.

original: prakaṭaṃ naiva kartavyaṃ na meruṃ laṅghayet kvacit /
analyzed: prakaṭam nā eva kartavyam na merum laṅghayet kvacid
translated: It should not be made public, and Meru should never be transgressed.

analyzed: śaṅkha sphaṭika rudrākṣaputram jīvaka riṣṭakāḥ
translated: Conchs, crystals, rudrākṣas, putrajīvakas, and bricks,

original: evamādyāḥ smṛtā ye tu maṇimālā varānane /
analyzed: evamādyāḥ smṛtāḥ ye tu maṇimālāḥ varānane
translated: O beautiful-faced one, such as these are considered to be the rosary of gems.

original: na tatra vidyate devo na mantro naiva cetanā // / //
analyzed: na tatra vidyate devaḥ na mantraḥ na eva cetanā
translated: There is no god there, no mantra, and no consciousness,

original: yatra yatra sthitā mālā na doṣo vidyate priye /
analyzed: yatra yatra sthitā mālā na doṣaḥ vidyate priye
translated: Wherever the rosary is placed, O beloved, there is no fault.

original: mantranyāse kṛte devi kila gopyaṃ tu kārayet // / //
analyzed: mantra nyāse kṛte devi kila gopyam tu kārayet
translated: O Goddess, having performed the deposition of mantras, one should indeed make it secret,

original: śarīraṃ kutra gopyaṃ tu kārayīta varānane /
analyzed: śarīram kutra gopyam tu varānane
translated: Where should one make the body secret, O beautiful-faced one?

analyzed: mantra nyāse kṛte hi ātmā sakalīkṛta vigrahaḥ
translated: Having performed the deposition of mantras, the self with the body fully completed,

original: yathā gopyaṃ na yuñjeta tadvac caivākṣamālikā /
analyzed: yathā gopyam na yuñjeta tadvat ca eva akṣamālikā
translated: One should not engage in what is to be kept secret, and likewise the rosary.

original: akṣaṃ cendriyam ity uktaṃ sūtraṃ kuṇḍalinī smṛtā // / //
analyzed: akṣam ca indriyam iti uktam sūtram kuṇḍalinī smṛtā
translated: The sense organ is said to be the bead, and the kundalini is remembered to be the thread,

original: lakṣaṃ tu sā parā sūkṣmā kalā hy amṛtavāhinī /🔽saṃyogakāriṇī vyomni tena sūtreti kīrtitā // / //
analyzed: lakṣam tu sā parā sūkṣmā kalā hi amṛta vāhinī  saṃyoga kāriṇī vyomni tena sūtrā iti kīrtitā
translated: The supreme subtle digit, the carrier of nectar,🔽The cause of union in the sky, therefore it is proclaimed as the thread.

original: saṅkhyāgrahaṇakāryeṣu sā coktā akṣamālikā /🔽śaṅkhādyās tu varārohe japakarmaṇi śasyate // / //
analyzed: saṅkhyā grahaṇa kāryeṣu sā ca uktā akṣamālikā  śaṅkha ādyāḥ tu varārohe japa karmaṇi śasyate
translated: In the matter of counting and grasping, that rosary is said to be,🔽O beautiful lady, the conch and others are praised in the act of japa.

analyzed: śaṅkhajam tu śriyā kāmaḥ sphāṭikam mukti hetave
translated: One desiring prosperity should use the conch, and the crystal for the sake of liberation,
O Beloved! Padmāksā (Lotus-eyed) and Padmaja (Lotus-born) are said to be the bestowers of nourishment by Śrī.

original: rudrākṣaiḥ siddhim āpnoti yac cānyaṃ khecarīpadam /
translated: One attains perfection with Rudrākṣas, and also the state of a sky-wanderer.

analyzed: jīvakā sarvadā jñeyā gopucchā grathitā anaghe
translated: Jīvakā (a kind of coral) should always be known, O sinless one, when strung with the tip of a cow's tail.

analyzed: vidrumā vaśya kāryeṣu mauktikā sarva kāma dā
translated: Coral is for subjugation, pearls grant all desires.

original: anyāni tu smṛtā ye vai ratnajā parameśvari // / //
analyzed: anyāni tu smṛtāḥ ye vai ratnajā parameśvari
translated: Other gems that are remembered, O Supreme Goddess,

analyzed: sarvadā te samuddiṣṭāḥ na atra kārya vicāraṇāt
translated: are always indicated, no doubt should be entertained about this.

analyzed: riṣṭakā akṣa asthi jā mālā abhicāre praśasyate
translated: A rosary made of bones or stones is recommended for black magic.

original: nāgavaṅgas tathā lohā miśrāś cānye 'pi ye smṛtāḥ /🔽māraṇe tāṃ praśasyeta stambhane mohane tathā // / //
analyzed: nāga vaṅgaḥ tathā lohāḥ miśrāḥ ca anye ye smṛtāḥ  māraṇe tām praśasyeta stambhane mohane tathā
translated: Nāga (a kind of coral), Vanga (a kind of coral), and other metals that are remembered,🔽are recommended for killing, paralyzing, and deluding.

analyzed: kampane dhvaṃsane devi kartavyā ca abhicārake
translated: O Goddess, it should be used for shaking, destroying, and black magic.

original: evam anye 'pi ye proktās teṣāṃ śreṣṭhā tu śaṅkhajā // / //
analyzed: evam anye ye proktāḥ teṣām śreṣṭhā tu śaṅkha jā
translated: Thus, among those mentioned, the best is the one made of conch shell.

analyzed: praśastā sarva kāryeṣu japa karmaṇi śasyate
translated: It is recommended for all rites and is praised for japa (repetition of mantra).

original: śaṅkhāvartā tu yā nāḍī śikhānte tu vyavasthitā // / //
analyzed: śaṅkha āvartā tu yā nāḍī śikhā ante tu vyavasthitā
translated: The nāḍī (channel) that is in the form of a conch-shell whorl is situated at the tip of the flame.

analyzed: tena śaṅkha mayam proktam akṣa sūtram surādhipe
translated: Therefore, O Lord of gods, the rosary is said to be made of conch shell.

original: sphuṭate mastake yā sā dvidhā caiva visarpiṇī // / //
analyzed: sphuṭate mastake yā sā dvidhā ca eva visarpiṇī
translated: That which bursts in the head is twofold, and spreading.

analyzed: sphāṭikam tena ca uddiṣṭam guru vaktre pratiṣṭhitam
translated: It is indicated by that as crystal, established in the teacher's mouth.

original: raudrībhāvaḥ smṛto rudras tālvagre ca vyavasthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: raudrībhāvaḥ smṛtaḥ rudraḥ tālu agre ca vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Rudra is remembered as the state of Rudra, and is located at the tip of the palate.

analyzed: śabda sparśa rasaḥ rūpam gandha tanmātra saṃyutam
translated: Sound, touch, taste, form, and the subtle element of smell,

original: vikāritve pravarteta nirodhāl lakṣam eva ca // / //
analyzed: vikāri tve pravarteta nirodhāt lakṣam eva ca
translated: When engaged in modification, it functions due to obstruction, and also due to the mark.

analyzed: tena rudrākṣa mālāyāḥ japaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ udāhṛtaḥ
translated: Therefore, the repetition on a Rudraksha rosary is said to be the best.

analyzed: putra vat udare kṛtvā prasupta amṛta kuṇḍalī
translated: Having placed it in the womb like a son, the sleeping Amritakundali,

original: tayā nīyaty asau jīva adhaś cordhvena bhāvini /
analyzed: tayā nīyati asau jīva adhas ca ūrdhvena bhāvini

analyzed: devyāḥ rūpa dharam cakram dhyāyet evam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: One should meditate on the Cakra in the form of the Goddess in this way, there is no doubt.

original: eṣa bandhas tu mudrāyāḥ kathitas te kuleśvari /
analyzed: eṣa bandhaḥ tu mudrāyāḥ kathitaḥ te kuleśvari
translated: This is the binding of the mudrā, O Queen of Kula, which has been told to you.

analyzed: tri tattvena tu mantreṇa vakṣyamānena kārayet
translated: One should perform it with the mantra of the three principles, which will be spoken.

original: drāvaṇaṃ kṣobhaṇaṃ caiva ākarṣavaśam eva ca /
analyzed: drāvaṇam kṣobhaṇam ca eva ākarṣa vaśam eva ca
translated: Dissolution, agitation, and attraction under control,

analyzed: pūjā vidhānam deveśi devyāyāḥ vīra vandite
translated: The method of worship, O Goddess of the Lord, O Goddess praised by the heroes.

analyzed: śrī kubjikā uvāca
translated: Śrī Kubjikā said:

analyzed: tri śikhā padma mudrā ca yonimudrā viśeṣataḥ
translated: The three-crested lotus mudrā and especially the yoni mudrā,

original: tāsāṃ lakṣaṇam ākhyāhi yathāvat sphuṭato vada // / //
analyzed: tāsām lakṣaṇam ākhyāhi yathāvat sphuṭataḥ vada
translated: Please tell their characteristics as they are, speak clearly.

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Śrī Bhairava said:

original: mudrāṇāṃ lakṣaṇaṃ devi kathayāmi samāsataḥ /🔽hastābhyāṃ kārayed ādau sampuṭaṃ cordhvadiṅmukham // / //
analyzed: mudrāṇām lakṣaṇam devi kathayāmi samāsatas    kārayet
translated: O Goddess, I will tell the characteristics of the mudrās in brief.🔽First, one should make a hollow with the hands facing upwards,

original: aṅgulyā grathayet sarvāḥ saṃśliṣṭam ubhayeṣv api /
analyzed: aṅgulyā grathayet sarvāḥ saṃśliṣṭam ubhayeṣu api
translated: One should twist all the fingers together, even on both sides.

analyzed: tarjanyā anāmikau kuñcya saṃśliṣṭau madhya saṃsthitau
translated: The index and ring fingers are bent and joined, with the middle finger in the middle.

original: tābhyāṃ mūle mukhaṃ kāryaṃ tarjanyāyā varānane /🔽saṃśliṣṭau sammukhau dvau tu madhyamau ūrdhvadiṅmukhau // / //
analyzed: tābhyām mūle mukham kāryam tarjanyāyāḥ varānane  saṃśliṣṭau sammukhau dvau tu madhyamau ūrdhva diṅmukhau
translated: O beautiful-faced one, the mouth is made at the base of those with the index finger.🔽The two middle fingers are joined and facing each other, with the tips pointing upwards.

analyzed: saṃyogena varārohe aṅguṣṭhau ca kaniṣṭhakau
translated: O beautiful lady, the thumb and little finger are joined.

original: tādṛśīva hi kartavyā triśikhā tu vidhīyate // / //🔽karābhyāṃ sampuṭaṃ kāryaṃ maṇibandhau tu saṃhatau /
analyzed: tādṛśī iva hi kartavyā triśikhā tu vidhīyate  karābhyām sampuṭam kāryam maṇibandhau tu saṃhatau
translated: They should be made like that, and the three-crested one is prescribed.🔽The hands should be made into a hollow space, with the wrists joined.

analyzed: agra aṅgulyā prasāryeta aṅguṣṭhau madhya saṃsthitau
translated: The index finger should be extended, with the thumbs in the middle.

original: padmamudrā samākhyātā yonimudrām ataḥ śṛṇu /🔽hastābhyāṃ sampuṭaṃ kāryaṃ kaniṣṭhā madhya yojayet // / //
analyzed: padma mudrā samākhyātā yonimudrām atas śṛṇu  hastābhyām sampuṭam kāryam kaniṣṭhā madhya yojayet
translated: The lotus mudra is thus declared. Listen now to the yoni mudra.🔽The hands should be made into a hollow space, with the little and middle fingers joined.

analyzed: puṭa ākārau karau kṛtvā aṅguṣṭhau madhya saṃsthitau
translated: Having made the hands into a hollow space, with the thumbs in the middle,

analyzed: niḥsṛtā vāma hastasya aṅgulyā tu kanīyasī
translated: the little finger of the left hand is extended.

analyzed: yonimudrā smṛtā bhadre sarveṣām kṣobha kārikā
translated: O fortunate one, the yoni mudra is remembered as causing agitation for all.

analyzed: etāḥ mudrāḥ samākhyātāḥ dhyāna pūjā visarjane
translated: These mudras are declared for meditation, worship, and dismissal.

original: sāmprataṃ khecarīṇāṃ tu yathā mudrā khagādhipe /
analyzed: sāmpratam khecarīṇām tu yathā mudrā khaga adhipe
translated: Now, O Lord of Birds, I shall tell you in brief the mudras of the sky-goers,

analyzed: kathayāmi samāsena tvad prītyā khaga gāminī
translated: Out of love for you, O you who move in the sky.

original: anāmā karṇike yojyā ṣoḍaśāraṃ tu pīḍayet /
analyzed: anāmā karṇike yojyā ṣoḍaśāram tu pīḍayet
translated: The ring finger should be placed in the pericarp and the sixteen petals should be squeezed.

original: pīḍanād ṛjutāṃ yāti khagamārge tu bhāvini // / //
analyzed: pīḍanāt ṛju tām yāti khaga mārge tu bhāvini
translated: By squeezing, it becomes straight in the path of flying in the sky, O future one.

original: phādināntagate lakṣe khagatiś ca na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: phā dina anta gate lakṣe kha gatiḥ ca na saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is no doubt that the movement of the bird is in the range from Pha to Na.

original: ṣaṭpattraṃ mūrdhnitaḥ kṛtvā tarjanyāgre tu yojayet // / //
analyzed: ṣaṭpattram mūrdhni itas kṛtvā tarjanyā agre tu yojayet
translated: Having made six petals on the head, one should join them at the tip of the index finger.

analyzed: śūnye śūnya manaḥ bhūtvā sampīḍyeta parasparam
translated: In the void, having become one whose mind is void, they should be squeezed against each other.

analyzed: ṣaṭpattram tu vikāśyeta udāna preritena tu
translated: The six petals should be opened by the upward-moving breath.

original: bhāvayen nādiphāntaṃ tu khagatīti na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: bhāvayet tu khagatī iti na saṃśayaḥ
translated: One should contemplate on the range from Na to Pha, there is no doubt about the movement of the bird.

original: dvādaśārordhvanālena lambikānte niveśayet // / //🔽bhedanaṃ kuñcitenaiva cārgalaṃ kūrmasaṃyutam /
analyzed: bhedanam kuñcitena eva ca argalam kūrma saṃyutam
translated: With the twelve-spoked upper axle, one should place it at the end of the uvula.🔽The splitting is done with the bent one, the bolt is accompanied by the tortoise.

analyzed: bhāvayet nādi pha antam tu khagatim vīra vandite
translated: One should contemplate on the range from Na to Pha, O you who are worshipped by the heroes, there is no doubt about the movement of the bird.

original: padmamudrā tridhā proktā yonimudrām ataḥ śṛṇu /
analyzed: padma mudrā tridhā proktā yonimudrām atas śṛṇu
translated: The lotus mudra is said to be of three kinds, listen now to the yoni mudra.

original: yoniṃ yonau samākramya mudgareṇa tu bhedanam // / //
analyzed: yonim yonau samākramya mudgareṇa tu bhedanam
translated: Having entered the yoni into the yoni, the splitting is done with the pestle.

analyzed: visarga dvaya saṃyogāt khaga gāmī bhavet dhruvam
translated: By the union of two emissions, one certainly becomes a sky-goer.

analyzed: amṛta ākhyā parā yoniḥ bhāvayet mastaka upari
translated: The supreme womb called nectar should be contemplated above the head.

analyzed: ākramya gandhamārgam tu yojanā nādi phānta gā
translated: Having occupied the path of smell, extending from ya to pha,

original: khagatir bhavatedevaṃ yonimārge vicakṣaṇaḥ // / //🔽uccārya vāmaśaktiṃ tu sandhayed granthimadhyataḥ /
analyzed: kha gatiḥ yoni mārge vicakṣaṇaḥ  uccārya vāma śaktim tu sandhayet granthi madhyataḥ
translated: the wise one becomes a sky-goer in the path of the womb.🔽Having uttered the power of the left, one should unite it in the middle of the knot.

original: vikṣepam ūrdhvataḥ kṛtvā pare yonau tu bhāvanā // / //
analyzed: vikṣepam ūrdhvatas kṛtvā pare yonau tu bhāvanā
translated: Having thrown it upwards, one should contemplate in the supreme womb.

original: anena khagagāmitvaṃ bhavate tu na saṃśayaḥ /🔽yonimudrā samākhyātā tribhedā parikīrtitā // / //
analyzed: anena khaga gāmi tvam bhavate tu na saṃśayaḥ  yonimudrā samākhyātā tri bhedā parikīrtitā
translated: By this, one certainly becomes a sky-goer.🔽The yoni mudra is said to be of three kinds.

analyzed: triśikhā lakṣaṇam devi kathyamānam nibodhata
translated: O Goddess, listen to the description of the characteristics of the three-crested mudra.

original: karābhyāṃ caiva tarjanyāṃ pīḍayet tat prayatnataḥ // / //
analyzed: karābhyām ca eva tarjanyām pīḍayet tat prayatnataḥ
translated: One should press the index fingers with the hands with effort.

original: brahmanāḍyā dvirabhyāsād āsanaṃ mandarasya tu /🔽triśikhā nāma mudreyam arpaṇaṃ khagamārgayoḥ // / //
analyzed: brahmanāḍyāḥ dvis abhyāsāt āsanam mandarasya tu  triśikhā nāma mudrā iyam arpaṇam khaga mārgayoḥ
translated: By the practice of the Brahma nadi twice, the seat of Mandara,🔽this mudra is called the three-crested, which is offered to the path of the sky-goer.

analyzed: golakam śūnya mārga stham patha traya gatam priye
translated: O Beloved, the ball is situated in the path of emptiness, in the three paths.

analyzed: kṣepaṇam bindukoṭi ūrdhvam avanīm kramya pādayoḥ
translated: Having thrown it above the tip of the bindu, having gone down to the earth, to the feet,

original: guhye niveśya mantrajñas triśikhaṃ khecaraṃ priye /
analyzed: guhye niveśya mantra jñaḥ tri śikham khecaram priye
translated: O Beloved, the knower of mantras should place the three-crested Khecara in the secret place.

analyzed: anena khaga gāmī sau bhavate sādhaka uttamaḥ
translated: By this, that excellent practitioner becomes one who moves through the sky.

analyzed: karaṇam ca ūrdhva mūlam syāt bandhayet khaga maṇḍalam
translated: The instrument should be with the root above, and one should bind the circle of the sky-goer.

original: ākramya pañcamaṃ tatra karābhyāṃ caiva śūlini // / //
analyzed: ākramya pañcamam tatra karābhyām ca eva śūlini
translated: Having occupied the fifth there with both hands, O trident-holder.

analyzed: jānukau kurpare yojya vikṣepaḥ guhya madhyataḥ
translated: The knees should be joined to the ankles, and the distraction is in the middle of the secret place.

analyzed: vedhanam brahmarandhrasya kathitam tu tapodhane
translated: The piercing of the brahmarandhra is thus described, O ascetic woman.

original: khagamārgagatis tv evaṃ bhavate tu sulocane /
analyzed: khaga mārga gatiḥ tu evam bhavate tu su locane
translated: Thus, O beautiful-eyed one, one attains the movement along the path of the sky-goer.

analyzed: eṣā mudrā samākhyātā nava bhedaiḥ vyavasthitā
translated: This mudra is said to be established in nine divisions.

original: mudrā śaktir iti khyātā mudritaṃ drāvayiṣyati /
analyzed: mudrā śaktiḥ iti khyātā mudritam drāvayiṣyati
translated: Mudra is known as Shakti, and what is sealed will be melted.

analyzed: tena mudrā samākhyātā kathitā parameśvari
translated: Therefore, O Supreme Goddess, the mudra is said to be described.

original: mudritaṃ gopitaṃ proktaṃ cicchaktyā yā parāparā /
analyzed: mudritam gopitam proktam cicchaktyā yā parāparā
translated: What is sealed is said to be hidden, by the supreme and inferior consciousness power.

original: na jñāyate varārohe sā tu mudrā udāhṛtā // / //
analyzed: na jñāyate varārohe sā tu mudrā udāhṛtā
translated: O beautiful lady, that which is not known is said to be the mudra.

analyzed: ajñāna mala rūpeṇa yāvat baddhaḥ sa pudgalaḥ
translated: As long as the individual soul is bound by the impurity of ignorance,

original: na jānāti parātmānaṃ tāvan māyā pravartate // / //
analyzed: na jānāti parātmānam tāvat māyā pravartate
translated: as long as he does not know the supreme self, Maya operates.

original: bhinne tamasi caikatvaṃ yadā paśyati mānavaḥ /
analyzed: bhinne tamasi ca eka tvam yadā paśyati mānavaḥ
translated: When a man sees unity in the broken darkness,

original: tadā sā tu parā proktā bandhamokṣakarī priye // / //
analyzed: tadā sā tu parā proktā bandha mokṣa karī priye
translated: then that is said to be the supreme, O beloved, which brings about bondage and liberation.

original: ekā sā paramā śaktiḥ saṃsthitā tu śivecchayā /
analyzed: ekā sā paramā śaktiḥ saṃsthitā tu śiva icchayā
translated: That one supreme power abides by Śiva's will,

analyzed: mocayanti graha ādibhyaḥ pāśa oghān drāvayanti ca
translated: they liberate from the planets and others, and melt away the multitude of fetters.

original: mocanād drāvaṇād yasmān mudrākhyāḥ śaktayaḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: mocanāt drāvaṇāt yasmāt mudrā ākhyāḥ śaktayaḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: Because of liberating and melting, the powers are known as mudrās.

analyzed: kha gatiḥ hi ūrdhva bhāvena khaga mārgeṇa nityaśas
translated: The sky-gait is always by the upward state and by the path of the sky-goers.

original: carate sarvajantūnāṃ khecarī tena sā smṛtā /
analyzed: carate sarva jantūnām khecarī tena sā smṛtā
translated: It moves in the bodies of all beings, therefore it is known as Khecarī.

original: paratv' ekā tu sā jñeyā punaś caiva tridhā smṛtā // / //
analyzed: paratu ekā tu sā jñeyā punar ca eva tridhā smṛtā
translated: That one should be known as supreme, and again it is remembered as threefold.

original: icchā jñānī kriyā sā tu varṇarūpam upāgatā /
analyzed: icchā jñānī kriyā sā tu varṇa rūpam upāgatā
translated: It is will, knowledge, and action, having assumed the form of letters.

analyzed: pañcāśa bheda bhinnā sā ekā evam udāhṛtā
translated: It is said to be one and the same, divided into fifty varieties.

analyzed: aṅga avayava sampūrṇā mālayitvā jagat sthitā
translated: Having made a garland of the world, it abides with all the parts of the body complete.

analyzed: nādi pha anta svarūpeṇa tena sā mālinī smṛtā
translated: Therefore, it is known as Mālinī, in the form of the letter a and the letter pha.

original: sapta koṭyas tu mantrāṇām aprameyās tu yāḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: sapta koṭyaḥ tu mantrāṇām aprameyāḥ tu yāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The mantras are said to be seven million, and those that are remembered as immeasurable,

original: svatantrasthās tu tāḥ sarvā mudritāḥ parameśvari // / //
analyzed: sva tantra sthāḥ tu tāḥ sarvāḥ mudritāḥ parameśvari
translated: all of them are independent, sealed by the Supreme Lord.

analyzed: tena mudrā samākhyātā sadyas pratyaya kārikā
translated: By that, the mudra is proclaimed, which brings about immediate conviction.

original: avayave mātṛrūpā tu svaiḥ svair aṃśair vyavasthitā // / //
analyzed: avayave mātṛ rūpā tu svaiḥ svaiḥ aṃśaiḥ vyavasthitā
translated: In the parts, she is in the form of the mother, established by her own parts.

analyzed: brahmā aṃśā ca eva rudrā aṃśā kaumāryā aṃśā varānane
translated: O beautiful-faced one, she is the part of Brahma, the part of Rudra, and the part of Kumari.

original: vaiṣṇavyā caiva yāmyāṃśā aindryāṃśā ca tathānaghe // / //
analyzed: vaiṣṇavyā ca eva yāmyā aṃśā aindryā aṃśā ca tathā anaghe
translated: O sinless one, she is the part of Vishnu, the part of Yama, and the part of Indra.
She is the leader of the Yoginis, the part of Yoga, the leader of the lords of Yoga and Yoga.

original: ete hy aṃśāḥ smṛtāḥ sapta punaḥ saptasu saptasu // / //
analyzed: ete hi aṃśāḥ smṛtāḥ sapta punar saptasu saptasu
translated: These are remembered as the seven parts, again in the seven and seven.

analyzed: brahmāṇyāḥ saptam uddiṣṭāḥ sapta māheśvarī punar
translated: The seven of Brahma are mentioned, and again the seven of Maheshvari.

original: kaumāryāḥ saptamuddiṣṭā vaiṣṇavyāḥ sapta eva ca // / //
analyzed: kaumāryāḥ saptam uddiṣṭāḥ vaiṣṇavyāḥ sapta eva ca
translated: The seven of Kumari are mentioned, and the seven of Vaishnavi as well.

original: vārāhī saptamuddiṣṭā aindrāṇyāḥ sapta eva tu /
analyzed: vārāhī saptam uddiṣṭā aindrāṇyāḥ sapta eva tu
translated: The seven of Varahi are mentioned, and the seven of Indrani as well.

original: cāmuṇḍā saptamuddiṣṭā evaṃ vai sapta saptasu // / //
analyzed: cāmuṇḍā sapta uddiṣṭā evam vai sapta saptasu
translated: The seven of Chamunda are mentioned, thus the seven in the seven.

analyzed: pañcāśa ekona vai devyāḥ bhuvana āvali saṃsthitāḥ
translated: The circles of worlds are situated in the goddess, fifty-nine in number.

original: atra bhedair anekaiś ca saṃsthitā bhuvanāvaliḥ // / //
analyzed: atra bhedaiḥ anekaiḥ ca saṃsthitā bhuvana āvaliḥ
translated: Here, the circles of worlds are situated with many divisions.

original: tasya dehagatā romāḥ koṭyas trīṇi prakīrtitāḥ /
analyzed: tasya deha gatāḥ romāḥ koṭyaḥ trīṇi prakīrtitāḥ
translated: His body hairs are proclaimed to be three and a half crores.

original: lakṣāṇi caiva pañcāśad romāṇāṃ tu tadudbhavā // / //
analyzed: lakṣāṇi ca eva pañcāśat romāṇām tu tad udbhavā
translated: And fifty lakhs of body hairs arise from that.

analyzed: ekaika romakūpeṣu yoginyaḥ koṭi saṃsthitāḥ
translated: In each pore of the hair, there are millions of Yoginis.

original: trikoṭikoṭikoṭīnāṃ koṭayas tu anekadhā // / //🔽yathā cāmbaraparyantā pṛthivyādiṣu sambhavāḥ /
analyzed: tri koṭi koṭi koṭīnām koṭayaḥ tu anekadhā  yathā ca ambara paryantā pṛthivī ādiṣu sambhavāḥ
translated: There are trillions and trillions of them in many ways.🔽Just as there are innumerable atoms in the earth and other elements up to the sky,

original: aṇavas tv apramāṇās tu tattve tattve tv anekadhā // / //
analyzed: aṇavaḥ tu apramāṇāḥ tu tattve tattve tu anekadhā
translated: they are immeasurable, in many ways in each reality.

original: sūkṣmarūpās tathā rudrā eṣāṃ saṅkhyā na vidyate /
analyzed: sūkṣma rūpāḥ tathā rudrāḥ eṣām saṅkhyā na vidyate
translated: The Rudras have subtle forms, their number is not known.

original: vyāpitaṃ tu samastaṃ hi rudraiḥ sūkṣmataraiḥ priye // / //
analyzed: vyāpitam tu samastam hi rudraiḥ sūkṣmataraiḥ priye
translated: O Beloved, the entire universe is pervaded by even subtler Rudras.

analyzed: evam mudrā samākhyātā vyāpayitvā aprameyataḥ
translated: Thus, the Mudra is declared, pervading the immeasurable.

original: ekā eva parā mudrā yasyedaṃ tiṣṭhate jagat // / //
analyzed: ekā eva parā mudrā yasya idam tiṣṭhate jagat
translated: This universe rests on that one supreme Mudra.

original: yaṃ yaṃ spṛśati sā hy aṅgaṃ sā sā mudrā vidhīyate /
analyzed: yam yam spṛśati sā hi aṅgam sā sā mudrā vidhīyate
translated: Whatever limb it touches, that is declared to be the Mudra.

original: nṛtyaṃ valgaṃ tathā hāsyaṃ rodanaṃ sphoṭam eva ca // / //
analyzed: nṛtyam valgam tathā hāsyam rodanam sphoṭam eva ca
translated: Dancing, jumping, laughing, crying, and clapping,

original: yad vikāraṃ prakurvanti tat sarvaṃ mudrasaṃjñakam /
analyzed: yat vikāram prakurvanti tat sarvam mudrā saṃjñakam
translated: whatever transformation they perform, all that is called Mudra.

original: aṅgulyā aṅganā proktā aṅge carati nityaśaḥ // / //
analyzed: aṅgulyā aṅganā proktā aṅge carati nityaśas
translated: The finger is said to be the woman, it always moves in the body.

analyzed: aṅgulyā tena ca uddiṣṭā mudrābandhe varānane
translated: O Beautiful-faced one, the Mudra is indicated by the finger in binding the Mudra.

original: kaṃ śarīram iti khyātaṃ nyastā tasmin pravartate // / //
analyzed: kam śarīram iti khyātam nyastā tasmin pravartate
translated: The body is known as Ka, it is placed and functions in it.

analyzed: helā gamana mārgeṇa tena kanīyasī
translated: By that path of easy movement, it is called the ring finger.

analyzed: anāmā nāma rahitā koṭi bhedaiḥ vyavasthitā
translated: The ring finger, devoid of name, is established with millions of distinctions.

original: nāmaṃ na śakyate vaktum anāmā tena gīyate /
analyzed: nāmam na śakyate vaktum anāmā tena gīyate
translated: The name cannot be spoken, therefore it is sung as the ring finger.

original: madhye pravartate nit yam āśrayā pudgalasya tu // / //
analyzed: madhye pravartate nid yam āśrayā pudgalasya tu
translated: It always moves in the middle, depending on the individual.

analyzed: tatra ādhārāt vrajet ūrdhvam punarāgamanam priye
translated: There, it should move upwards from the support, and return again, O beloved.

analyzed: madhyamā nāma tena atra kathitā mantra vādinām
translated: The middle finger is called by that name for the reciters of mantras here.

analyzed: tarjanam kurute nityam saṃyojana viyojanam
translated: It always makes the threatening gesture, for the purpose of binding and releasing.

analyzed: tarjayantī mahā moham pāśa jālam anantakam
translated: It threatens the great delusion, the endless net of bonds.

original: tarjanī tena sā proktā mudrā sarveṣu cottamā /

analyzed: yā nāḍī sā bhavet varṇaḥ tayā nāḍyā tu veṣṭayet
translated: That which is a channel is a letter, and one should encircle with that channel.

original: yadi candraṃ vahec cakraṃ sūryaṃ vā cakram uttamam /
analyzed: yadi candram vahet cakram sūryam vā cakram uttamam
translated: If the wheel carries the moon or the sun, or the supreme wheel,

original: tasya madhye svayaṃ sthitvā viśvo 'ham iti cintayet // / //
analyzed: tasya madhye svayam sthitvā viśvaḥ ham iti cintayet
translated: remaining in its center, one should think I am the universe

original: ahaṃ brahmā tathā viṣṇur ahaṃ devo maheśvaraḥ /
analyzed: aham brahmā tathā viṣṇuḥ aham devaḥ maheśvaraḥ
translated: I am Brahma, Vishnu, I am the god Maheshvara,

original: bhairavo 'ham iti devi cintayitvā tu sādhakaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhairavaḥ ham iti devi cintayitvā tu sādhakaḥ
translated: I am Bhairava, O Goddess, having thought thus, the practitioner

analyzed: hṛd madhye cintayet cakram nāḍī varṇaiḥ tathā akṣaraiḥ
translated: should contemplate the wheel in the middle of the heart, with the colors of the channels and the syllables,

original: ādyakṣaraṃ japen mantraṃ punar ādyaṃ niyojayet // / //
analyzed: ādi akṣaram japet mantram punar ādyam niyojayet
translated: he should recite the first syllable of the mantra, and again apply the first

analyzed: evam saṃsmṛtya vidhivat sarva karmāṇi sādhayet
translated: having thus remembered according to the rules, one should accomplish all actions,

analyzed: arcanam havanam dhyānam japam ekānta rūpiṇam
translated: worship, oblation, meditation, japa, and the solitary form

analyzed: karma kṛtvā kujeśāni kujeśāya nivedayet
translated: having performed the action, O Mistress of the Lord of the Planet, one should dedicate it to the Lord of the Planet.

analyzed: tatas dhyānam prakurvīta viśuddhena antarātmanā
translated: Then one should perform meditation with a pure inner self

original: sa eva mantram uccārya ādyādau yāvad antimam /
analyzed: saḥ eva mantram uccārya ādya ādau yāvat antimam
translated: he alone, uttering the mantra, from the beginning to the end,

analyzed: nādena tu gatim kuryāt svacchanda gati bhāvitaḥ
translated: should move with sound, contemplated in the state of spontaneous movement

original: brahmaṃ bhittvā tato viṣṇuṃ rudram īśvaram eva ca /
analyzed: brahmam bhittvā tatas viṣṇum rudram īśvaram eva ca
translated: having pierced through Brahma, Vishnu, Rudra, and Isvara,

analyzed: setu madhyena gamanam kuñcikā udghāṭayet bilam
translated: the movement through the middle of the dam will open the door of the cave

original: udghāṭya paramaṃ sthānam aghoraṃ yatra saṃsthitam /
analyzed: udghāṭya paramam sthānam aghoram yatra saṃsthitam
translated: Having opened the supreme place where the Aghora is situated,

analyzed: aṣṭākapāla ghorīśam tri akṣaram samanusmaret
translated: One should remember the three-syllabled mantra of the eight-faced lord.

analyzed: sarva mantreṣu hṛdayam yat kubjīśa śikhā ātmakam
translated: The heart of all mantras is that which is in the form of the crest of Kubjīśa.

analyzed: manasā smṛta mātreṇa khecara tvam prajāyate
translated: By merely being remembered in the mind, one attains the state of being able to fly in the sky.

analyzed: sarva vighna upaśamanam mantram tri akṣaram uttamam
translated: The three-syllabled mantra, which is the best, for pacifying all obstacles,

original: śeṣaṣaṭkaṃ tu yad devi tadaṅgāny asya kalpayet // / //
analyzed: śeṣa ṣaṭkam tu yat devi tad aṅgāni asya kalpayet
translated: One should consider the remaining six as its limbs, O Goddess.

original: japtavyaṃ tu śikhāsūtraṃ sakṛt siddhiḥ prajāyate /
analyzed: japtavyam tu śikhā sūtram sakṛt siddhiḥ prajāyate
translated: The sacred thread should be recited once, and success is attained.

analyzed: ākāśa ādi prasiddhi artham siddhiḥ anyāsu kā kathā
translated: For the sake of the well-known accomplishments such as flying in the sky, what to speak of other accomplishments?

analyzed: mantra sannaddha dehaḥ tu sādhakaḥ
translated: The practitioner, even in all states, with the body fortified by the mantra,

original: tiṣṭhan jāgran svapan gacchan bhuñjāno maithune rataḥ // / //
analyzed: tiṣṭhan jāgran svapan gacchan bhuñjānaḥ maithune rataḥ
translated: Whether standing, awake, sleeping, going, eating, or engaged in sexual intercourse,

analyzed: caryā dhārī nirācāraḥ mantra saṃsmaraṇāt śuciḥ
translated: The one who practices, free from conduct, is purified by the recollection of the mantra.

analyzed: sāmānya smaraṇāt eva vyādhibhiḥ na abhibhūyate
translated: Even by the mere recollection of the general (mantra), one is not overcome by diseases.

original: prajvalan dṛśyate bhūtair yasyedaṃ tu śarīragam /
analyzed: prajvalan dṛśyate bhūtaiḥ yasya idam tu śarīra gam
translated: By whom this (mantra) is seen blazing in the body by the spirits,

original: ataḥ kiṃ bahunoktena siṃhasyaiva yathā mṛgāḥ // / //
analyzed: atas kim bahunā uktena siṃhasya eva yathā mṛgāḥ
translated: What is the use of speaking much? As deer are by the lion.

original: gandhena pralayaṃ yānti satyaṃ satyaṃ mahātape /
analyzed: gandhena pralayam yānti satyam satyam mahā tape
translated: By the scent, they go to destruction, truly, truly, in the great heat.

original: japena sādhayet sarvaṃ vratastho yas tu sādhakaḥ // / //
analyzed: japena sādhayet sarvam vrata sthaḥ yaḥ tu sādhakaḥ
translated: The practitioner who is in a vow should accomplish everything by japa.

original: pūrvam eva japel lakṣaṃ sidhyate ghoramūrdhajam /
analyzed: pūrvam eva japet lakṣam sidhyate ghora mūrdhajam
translated: One should first perform a hundred thousand japas, then the terrible-headed (mantra) is accomplished.

original: aviditvā vidhānena kiñcit kāryaṃ na sādhayet // / //
analyzed: a viditvā vidhānena kiñcid kāryam na sādhayet
translated: Without knowing the rules, one should not accomplish any rite.

original: yaḥ kuryād vidhihīnaṃ tu sa vighnaiś cābhibhūyate /
analyzed: yaḥ kuryāt vidhi hīnam tu sa vighnaiḥ ca abhibhūyate
translated: One who performs (a rite) lacking the rules is overcome by obstacles.

analyzed: tasmāt padārtha navakam jñātavyam tu kujeśvari
translated: Therefore, O daughter of the lord of the mountains, the nine ritual objects should be known.

analyzed: kṣetrasthānāni suśroṇi jñātavyāni su niścitaiḥ
translated: The places of the sacred sites should be known by the well-determined ones.

original: kṣetraṃ vratāni mantrāś ca akṣasūtraṃ japaṃ tathā // / //
analyzed: kṣetram vratāni mantrāḥ ca akṣasūtram japam tathā
translated: The sacred site, vows, mantras, rosary, japa,

original: dhyānaṃ pūjā tathā dravyaṃ varṇaṃ mukhasamanvitam /
analyzed: dhyānam pūjā tathā dravyam varṇam mukha samanvitam
translated: meditation, worship, substances, and the color along with the face,

analyzed: mukha hīnāḥ na sidhyanti agnihotra vivarjitāḥ
translated: without the face, are not accomplished, devoid of the sacrificial fire.

original: mukham āhavanīyaṃ syāt tasmin mantrāḥ sadā sthitāḥ /
analyzed: mukham āhavanīyam syāt tasmin mantrāḥ sadā sthitāḥ
translated: The face is the sacrificial fire; the mantras always reside in it.

original: aghoraṃ kālam ity uktam aghoraṃ viṣṇur ucyate // / //
analyzed: aghoram kālam iti uktam aghoram viṣṇuḥ ucyate
translated: Aghora is said to be time; Aghora is said to be Vishnu.

original: aghoras tvaṃ maheśāni aghoraś cāham eva ca /
analyzed: aghoraḥ tvam maheśāni aghoraḥ ca aham eva ca
translated: You are Aghora, O Mahesani, and I am indeed Aghora.

analyzed: bahu rūpa dharaḥ hi agniḥ pracaṇḍaḥ kālam anta gaḥ
translated: Fire assumes many forms, is fierce, and swallows time.

original: sa śivaḥ paramo brahmā nirvāṇaḥ sa sadāśivaḥ /
analyzed: sa śivaḥ paramaḥ brahmā nirvāṇaḥ sa sadāśivaḥ
translated: He is Shiva, the supreme Brahman, nirvana, and Sadashiva.

original: īśvaraḥ sa paro nityam asmāt parataro na hi // / //
analyzed: īśvaraḥ sa paraḥ nityam asmāt parataraḥ na hi
translated: He is the supreme lord, eternal, for there is none higher than him.

original: anena smṛtamātreṇa sarvaduḥkhaiḥ pramucyate /🔽dāridrasiṃho 'ghorīśo vyādhisiṃhaḥ kuleśvari // / //
analyzed: anena smṛta mātreṇa sarva duḥkhaiḥ pramucyate
translated: Merely by remembering him, one is freed from all sufferings.🔽Aghorisha, the lion of poverty, and Kuleshwari, the lion of disease,
The fierce and wicked lion, the destroyer of great sins,

analyzed: sarva tīrtha abhiṣekaḥ ca sapta japtena jāyate
translated: By reciting it seven times, one becomes consecrated in all the holy places.

original: śatajaptena devena sarvayajñaphalaṃ labhet /🔽dīkṣānirvāṇakārī syāt trisaptaparivartanāt // / //
analyzed: śata japtena devena sarva yajña phalam labhet  dīkṣā nirvāṇa kārī syāt tri sapta parivartanāt
translated: By reciting it a hundred times, one attains the fruit of all sacrifices.🔽By reciting it twenty-one times, one becomes initiated and attains nirvana.

analyzed: daśa āvartena duritam brahmahatyām vyapohati
translated: By reciting it ten times, one destroys the sin of Brahmanicide.

analyzed: daśa āvartāt guru upekṣī smaraṇāt eva mucyate
translated: By merely remembering it ten times, one is freed from the neglect of the guru.

analyzed: vidhi hīne tathā pāne pañcabhiḥ ca upapātakī
translated: By reciting it five times, one becomes a minor sinner in drinking without proper rites.

original: śatena caiva triṣkālyaṃ varṣāt siddhir yathepsitā // / //
analyzed: śatena ca eva triṣkālyam varṣāt siddhiḥ yathā īpsitā
translated: By reciting it a hundred times three times a day, one attains the desired success within a year.

original: balavatāṃ ripūṇāṃ tu vyastam āvartayet prabhuḥ /
analyzed: balavatām ripūṇām tu vyastam āvartayet prabhuḥ
translated: The lord should turn it upside down for powerful enemies.

analyzed: dakṣiṇa āsyaḥ mahādevi sahasreṇa nipātayet
translated: O Great Goddess, with the face turned to the south, he should strike with a thousand.

analyzed: saṅgrāma kāle smartavyam asi pattra gatam hṛdi
translated: At the time of battle, it should be remembered in the heart, as if it were a sword leaf.

original: veṣṭantaṃ mātṛbhiḥ sainyaṃ bhakṣa bhakṣeti bhāṣayet // / //
analyzed: veṣṭantam mātṛbhiḥ sainyam bhakṣa bhakṣa iti bhāṣayet
translated: He should say to the army surrounded by the mothers, Eat, eat.

original: hatadarpāḥ prajāyante na punaḥ saṃharanti ca /
analyzed: hata darpāḥ prajāyante na punar saṃharanti ca
translated: They are born with their pride destroyed and do not gather again.

original: duḥsvapne dviguṇaṃ jāpyaṃ vraṇe caiva caturguṇam // / //
analyzed: duḥsvapne dviguṇam jāpyam vraṇe ca eva caturguṇam
translated: In a bad dream, the recitation should be doubled, and in a wound, it should be quadrupled.

original: lūtā daśaguṇaṃ caiva viṣe vai viṃśatis tathā /
analyzed: lūtā daśaguṇam ca eva viṣe vai viṃśatiḥ tathā
translated: In a spider bite, it should be ten times, and in poison, twenty times.

original: dine dine śataṃ japtvā vibhūtir vardhate ' cirāt // / //
analyzed: dine dine śatam japtvā vibhūtiḥ vardhate cirāt
translated: By reciting a hundred times each day, one's prosperity increases quickly.

original: prāṅmukho yasya nāmnā tu sādhyārūḍho hṛdi sthitaḥ /
analyzed: prāc mukhaḥ yasya nāmnā tu sādhya ārūḍhaḥ hṛdi sthitaḥ
translated: Facing east, with the name of the one mounted on the moon in the heart,

analyzed: vaśībhavati rājānam śata jāpyena dhīmatā
translated: The wise one, by reciting a hundred times, brings the king under control.

analyzed: sapta ahāt sa bala upetaḥ vaśībhavati na anyathā
translated: Within seven days, he becomes subject to one's will, not otherwise.

original: dine dine sahasreṇa nāsti tad yan na sādhayet // / //
analyzed: dine dine sahasreṇa na asti tat yat na sādhayet
translated: What he cannot accomplish within seven days by reciting a thousand times each day, that does not exist.

analyzed: āditya abhimukhaḥ bhūtvā sahasram parivartayet
translated: Facing the sun, one should recite a thousand times.

original: yat kiñcid vihitaṃ citte saptāhāt sādhayiṣyati // / //
analyzed: yat kiñcid vihitam citte sapta ahāt sādhayiṣyati
translated: Whatever is conceived in the mind, he will accomplish within seven days.

original: nyastaṃ sarvāṅgikaṃ mantraṃ bhairavākārasaṃsthitam /🔽sa tu bhojanakāle tu pātre sañcintya sādhakaḥ // / //
analyzed: nyastam sarva āṅgikam mantram bhairava ākāra saṃsthitam  sa tu bhojana kāle tu pātre sañcintya sādhakaḥ
translated: The mantra that has been placed in all the limbs, abiding in the form of Bhairava,🔽That practitioner, at the time of eating, having contemplated in the vessel,

analyzed: sampūrṇa śaśinam dhyāyet bhuñjānaḥ mṛtam aśnute
translated: Meditating on the full moon, while eating, he enjoys nectar.
Situated in the center of the full moon, sealed above and below,

analyzed: paryaṭet sādhakaḥ nityam sarva śreyam avāpnuyāt
translated: The practitioner should always wander, he will attain all that is auspicious.

original: yad icchet sādhakaḥ siddhiṃ hṛdi kṛtvā kujeśvaram // / //
translated: Whatever accomplishment the practitioner desires, having made Kujeshvara in the heart,

analyzed: candra maṇḍala madhya stham svacchanda gati bhāvitam
translated: Situated in the center of the moon-mandala, contemplated with the state of independent movement,

analyzed: tad praviṣṭam vicinteta antyāt antam para aparam
translated: One should think of it as entered, from the end to the end, the supreme and the inferior,

original: parasparaṃ tu sañcintya yāvad brahmabilaṃ gataḥ // / //
analyzed: parasparam tu sañcintya yāvat brahmabilam gataḥ
translated: Having contemplated each other, having gone to the Brahma-hole,

original: iti kulālikāmnāye śrīkubjikāmate svacchandaśikhādhikāro nāmāṣṭamaḥ paṭalaḥ
analyzed: iti kulālikāmnāye śrī kubjikāmate svacchandaśikhādhikāraḥ nāma aṣṭamaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eighth chapter named the authority of the tuft of the will of Kubjika in the Shri Kubjika Mata of the Kula tradition.

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Bhairava said:

original: bhedayitvā paraṃ tattvaṃ hakāraṃ nāma nāmataḥ /
analyzed: bhedayitvā param tattvam hakāram nāma nāmataḥ
translated: Having divided the supreme reality, the syllable ha is known by name.

original: so 'ṣṭākapālo vijñeyas tasyākāśaṃ tu tac chiraḥ // / //
analyzed: saḥ u ṣṭākapālaḥ vijñeyaḥ tasya ākāśam tu tat śiraḥ
translated: He should be known as having eight faces, his head is the sky,

analyzed: aghoram iti vikhyātam dvātriṃśa akṣara bhūṣitam
translated: It is known as Aghora, adorned with thirty-two syllables.

original: tasmāt sañjāyate sṛṣṭiḥ sā tu sṛṣṭir hṛdi sthitā // / //
analyzed: tasmāt sañjāyate sṛṣṭiḥ sā tu sṛṣṭiḥ hṛdi sthitā
translated: From that, creation arises, that creation is located in the heart.

original: dvātriṃśa mātaras tās tu cakrārūḍhā vicintayet /
analyzed: dvātriṃśa mātaraḥ tāḥ tu cakra ārūḍhāḥ vicintayet
translated: One should contemplate those thirty-two mothers mounted on the wheel.

original: caṇḍā ghaṇṭā mahānāsā sumukhī durmukhī balā // / //
analyzed: caṇḍā ghaṇṭā mahānāsā sumukhī durmukhī balā
translated: Caṇḍā, Ghaṇṭā, Mahānāsā, Sumukhī, Durmukhi, Balā,

original: revatī prathamā ghorā saumyā bhīmā mahābalā /
analyzed: revatī prathamā ghorā saumyā bhīmā mahābalā
translated: Revati, the first Ghorā, Saumyā, Bhīmā, Mahābalā,

original: jayā ca vijayā caiva ajitā cāparājitā // / //
analyzed: jayā ca vijayā ca eva ajitā ca aparājitā
translated: Jayā, Vijayā, Ajitā, Aparājitā,

analyzed: mahotkaṭā virūpākṣī śuṣkā ca ākāśamātarā
translated: Mahoktā, Virūpākṣī, Śuṣkā, and Ākāśamātṛkā,

analyzed: sehārī jātahārī ca daṃṣṭrālī śuṣkarevatī
translated: Seharī, Jātaharī, Daṃṣṭrā,lī, Śuṣkarevatī,
Pippalī, Puṣpaharī, Aśanī, Sasyahārikā,

analyzed: bhadrakālī subhadrā ca bhadrabhīmā subhadrikā
translated: Bhadrakālī, Subhadrā, Bhadrabhīmā, Subhadrī,

analyzed: manasā pūjayet bhakṣya bhojya ādibhiḥ kramāt
translated: One should mentally worship them in order with food, drink, and so on.

original: puṣpair nānāvidhair devi nānālaṅkārakādibhiḥ // / //🔽sravantaṃ cintayet tastham amṛtaṃ sarvatomukham /
analyzed: puṣpaiḥ nānāvidhaiḥ devi nānā alaṅkāraka ādibhiḥ  sravantam cintayet amṛtam sarvatomukham
translated: With various kinds of flowers, O Goddess, with various ornaments and so on,🔽One should contemplate the flowing nectar facing all directions.

analyzed: tena āpyāyita dehaḥ tu tad kṣaṇāt virajaḥ bhavet
translated: With the body nourished by that, one becomes free from impurities in an instant.

original: yāgaṃ tu mānasaṃ kṛtvā kasya siddhir na jāyate /
analyzed: yāgam tu mānasam kṛtvā kasya siddhiḥ na jāyate
translated: Having performed the mental sacrifice, whose accomplishment does not arise?

analyzed: sampūrṇa maṇḍalam dhyātvā aghoram nāma nāmataḥ
translated: Having meditated on the full moon, the one named Aghora by name,

analyzed: saḥ u ṣṭākapālaḥ pravaraḥ tattva vyāpī nirakṣaraḥ
translated: He is the best with eight faces, pervades reality, is without letters,

original: sa eva candrarūpī syāt karṇikāyāṃ vicintayet // / //
analyzed: saḥ eva candra rūpī syāt karṇikāyām vicintayet
translated: And is indeed the form of the moon. One should contemplate him in the pericarp.

original: tattvaṃ tatra mahānādaṃ hakāraṃ nāma nāmataḥ /
analyzed: tattvam tatra mahā nādam hakāram nāma nāmataḥ
translated: The principle there is the great sound, the one named H-sound by name,

analyzed: ṣaṭpadārtha yutaḥ devi navakena prasidhyati
translated: Endowed with the six categories, O Goddess, he is accomplished by the group of nine.

original: sa eva līyate viṣṇor viṣṇu rudrasamāśritaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva līyate viṣṇoḥ viṣṇu rudra samāśritaḥ
translated: He alone dissolves into Vishnu, Vishnu is dependent on Rudra,

original: sa eva kālo vijñeyaḥ sarvabhakṣo hutāśanaḥ // / //
analyzed: saḥ eva kālaḥ vijñeyaḥ sarva bhakṣaḥ hutāśanaḥ
translated: He alone should be known as time, the all-consuming fire.

original: sa eva līyate māyā sā ca viṣṇuḥ prakīrtitā /
analyzed: saḥ eva līyate māyā sā ca viṣṇuḥ prakīrtitā
translated: He alone dissolves into Maya, and she is declared to be Vishnu,

original: sā śaktir nirmalā kubji kālo vai yena bhakṣitaḥ // / //
analyzed: sā śaktiḥ nirmalā kubji kālaḥ vai yena bhakṣitaḥ
translated: That power is pure, O Kubji, by whom time is devoured.

original: sa viṣṇuḥ śivatāṃ yāti setuṃ bhittvā kuleśvari /
analyzed: sa viṣṇuḥ śiva tām yāti setum bhittvā kuleśvari
translated: That Vishnu attains Shivahood, O Mistress of Kula, having broken the dam,

original: sa ca turyapadaṃ prāpya unmanatvaṃ hi tat padam // / //
analyzed: sa ca turya padam prāpya unmana tvam hi tat padam
translated: And he, having attained the state of the fourth, that state is indeed the state of being beyond the mind.

analyzed: āśrayam devadevasya aghorasya mahā tape
translated: The abode of the God of gods, Aghora, in the great heat,

original: nirvāṇaṃ tu paraṃ vindyāt sa kubjīśaḥ prakīrtitaḥ // / //
analyzed: nirvāṇam tu param vindyāt sa kubjīśaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: One should know the supreme nirvana, he is declared to be Kubjish.

original: sa dhruvo vāsudevaś ca ajātaḥ parikīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: sa dhruvaḥ vāsudevaḥ ca ajātaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: He is Dhruva, Vasudeva, and is declared to be unborn.

original: tatra śaktiṃ sadā kuryāt tatrāsaktaḥ sadā bhavet // / //
analyzed: tatra śaktim sadā kuryāt tatra asaktaḥ sadā bhavet
translated: One should always exert one's power there, and always be attached to it.

original: na pāpair lipyate devi mahāpāpaiḥ sudāruṇaiḥ /
analyzed: na pāpaiḥ lipyate devi mahā pāpaiḥ su dāruṇaiḥ
translated: O Goddess, one is not tainted by sins, even by terrible great sins.

original: na kālasya vaśaṃ gacchen na jarā na ca duḥkhitaḥ // / //
analyzed: na kālasya vaśam gacchet na jarā na ca duḥkhitaḥ
translated: One does not come under the sway of time, nor does one suffer from old age or sorrow.

original: sarvatīrthaphalaṃ caiva sarvayajñeṣu dīkṣitaḥ /🔽hṛnnādaṃ manasotthāpya vrajen nirvāṇajaṃ padam // / //
analyzed: sarva tīrtha phalam ca eva sarva yajñeṣu dīkṣitaḥ  hṛd nādam manasā utthāpya vrajet nirvāṇa jam padam
translated: One obtains the fruits of all pilgrimages and is initiated in all sacrifices.🔽Having aroused the heart's sound from the mind, one should go to the state born of liberation.

original: cetasā tv amṛtaṃ gṛhya āgacched ghaṇṭikāśrayam /🔽tadutthaṃ bhāratīmūle kṛtvāsau 'mṛtam aśnute // / //🔽āpūrya vadanaṃ tena svacchandena kujeśvari /
analyzed: cetasā tu amṛtam gṛhya āgacchet ghaṇṭikā āśrayam  tad uttham bhāratī mūle kṛtvā asau mṛtam aśnute  āpūrya vadanam tena svacchandena kujeśvari
translated: Having grasped the nectar with the mind, one should return to the abode of the throat.🔽Having arisen from that, at the root of the Ganges, one enjoys that nectar.

original: anangadhenavīṃ dugdh v ā tattvaṃ vyāpyeśvareṇa tu // / //
analyzed: tattvam vyāpya īśvareṇa tu
translated: Having filled the mouth with that, O Goddess of the planet Mars,🔽the milk of the cow of passion is milked, and the principle is pervaded by the Lord.

analyzed: aghoram pañca madhye tu ātma tattvam vicintayet
translated: One should contemplate the principle of the self, the terrible one, in the middle of the five.

original: yo 'gnir jvalati cāpena ekas tiṣṭhati pañcadhā // / //
analyzed: yaḥ agniḥ jvalati cāpena ekaḥ tiṣṭhati pañcadhā
translated: The fire that burns in the bow, though one, abides in five ways.

analyzed: trailokyam vyāpitam tena yajante brahma vādinaḥ
translated: The three worlds are pervaded by it; those who speak about Brahman worship it.

original: tasyaiva yaḥ śikhāṃ vetti āhitāgniḥ sa ucyate // / //
analyzed: tasya eva yaḥ śikhām vetti āhitāgniḥ saḥ ucyate
translated: One who knows its flame is said to be one who has established the sacred fire.

original: so' gnir devamukhaṃ vindyād aghoraḥ sarvatomukhaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ agniḥ deva mukham vindyāt aghoraḥ sarvatomukhaḥ
translated: One should know that fire to be the face of the god, the terrible one facing all directions.

original: mukheṣu ca mukhaṃ devi trailokye 'pi pragīyate // / //
analyzed: mukheṣu ca mukham devi trailokye pragīyate
translated: And the face in the faces, O Goddess, is sung about in the three worlds.

original: vinā tena varārohe na homo na ca bhojanam /
analyzed: vinā tena varārohe na homaḥ na ca bhojanam
translated: Without it, O beautiful lady, there is no oblation nor eating.

original: śucir agnir bhaved devo bahurūpaḥ kujeśvari // / //
analyzed: śuciḥ agniḥ bhavet devaḥ bahu rūpaḥ kujeśvari
translated: The pure fire would be the god, the multi-formed one, O Mistress of the Planet Mars.

original: tadantaṃ tu japaṃ kuryāt kṛtvā hṛtsthaṃ tu keśavam /
analyzed: tad antam tu japam kuryāt kṛtvā hṛd stham tu keśavam
translated: One should perform the japa up to its end, having made Keshava in the heart.

analyzed: adhastāt setu mārgasya tiṣṭhate tu kujeśvaraḥ
translated: Below the path of the dam, the Lord of the Planet Mars stands.

original: sa cāsanaṃ paraṃ tasya sevyate kiṃ na mantrarāṭ /
analyzed: sa ca āsanam param tasya sevyate kim na mantra rāj
translated: And that is his supreme seat, is it not served by the King of Mantras?
He is known as the King of Vidyas, is called the King of Mantras.

analyzed: mudrārājā iti mahatām maṇḍala adhipatiḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: He is known as the King of Mudras, the Lord of the Great Mandala.

analyzed: brahma viṣṇu īśvara ādyeṣu patiḥ devi pracakṣyate
translated: He is declared as the Lord among Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva, and others, O Goddess.

analyzed: na anena sadṛśaḥ devi mantra koṭi śataiḥ api
translated: There is none equal to this, O Goddess, even with hundreds of millions of mantras.

analyzed: hṛdayam sarva mantrāṇām paramam parikīrtitam
translated: The heart of all mantras is declared to be supreme.

original: anena hīnā deveśi mahān api na sidhyati /
analyzed: anena hīnā deveśi mahān api na sidhyati
translated: Without this, O Mistress of the God, even a great one does not succeed.

analyzed: graha yantreṣu sarveṣu vyādhiteṣu kuleśvari
translated: In all the planetary instruments, in the sick ones, O Mistress of the Kula.

analyzed: ripu nāśe ca balavān dāridra bhaya nāśanam
translated: It is powerful in destroying enemies and removing the fear of poverty.

analyzed: tasmāt ārādhya yatnena duḥkhasiṃhaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: Therefore, the Lion of Sorrow is praised after diligently propitiating it.

analyzed: na anena sadṛśaḥ kaścid na anyaḥ sti sacarācare
translated: There is no one like it, there is no other in the moving and unmoving world.

analyzed: deva asura manuṣyānām tattva rūpaḥ maheśvari
translated: It is the true form of gods, demons, and humans, O Great Goddess.

original: mūrdhnaḥ pādatalaṃ yāvat tattvaṃ carati dehinām /
analyzed: mūrdhnaḥ pāda talam yāvat tattvam carati dehinām
translated: From the head to the soles of the feet, the truth moves within embodied beings.

original: niṣkalāt sakalaṃ yāti sakalān niṣkalaṃ padam // / //
analyzed: niṣkalāt sakalam yāti sakalāt niṣkalam padam
translated: It goes from the formless to the formed, and from the formed to the formless state.

original: ekenāṃśena vīrāṇāṃ sarveṣāṃ kim api stutam /
analyzed: ekena aṃśena vīrāṇām sarveṣām kim api stutam
translated: By one part, something is praised of all the heroes.

original: sa bhairavaḥ śivo bhāti sarvajñaḥ sarvajantuṣu // / //
analyzed: sa bhairavaḥ śivaḥ bhāti sarvajñaḥ sarva jantuṣu
translated: That Bhairava Shiva shines as the Omniscient One among all living beings.

original: yāvat tiṣṭhaty asau gātre tāvaj jīvanti jantavaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat tiṣṭhati asau gātre tāvat jīvanti jantavaḥ
translated: As long as He remains in the body, living beings live.

original: vinā tena varārohe nāsti nāstīti kathyate // / //
analyzed: vinā tena varārohe na asti na asti iti kathyate
translated: Without Him, O beautiful lady, it is said that there is nothing, there is nothing.

analyzed: tasya deva adhidevasya sarva vyāpi mayasya ca
translated: Of that God of gods, who is all-pervading,

original: sarvadevamayo devi kathaṃ bhaktyā na sidhyati // / //
analyzed: sarva deva mayaḥ devi katham bhaktyā na sidhyati
translated: How can one not be successful by devotion to Him, O Goddess, who is the essence of all gods?

analyzed: yena vijñāna mātreṇa smṛtena eva tu sundari
translated: By merely knowing Him, O beautiful lady, by merely remembering Him,

analyzed: akṣayān labhate lokān mukti sthānam gamiṣyati
translated: One obtains imperishable worlds and will go to the abode of liberation.

analyzed: sarva lakṣaṇa hīnaḥ pi smaraṇāt kalmaṣa apahaḥ
translated: Even if devoid of all characteristics, by remembering it, it removes sins.

analyzed: aho mantrasya māhātmyam japyamānasya nityaśas
translated: Oh, the greatness of the mantra, which is being recited daily,

analyzed: vinā api laya yogena yoginī sama tām vrajet
translated: Even without the yoga of merger, one would attain equality with the yoginis.

analyzed: sādhakāya prayacchanti trailokya jñānam uttamam
translated: They grant the practitioner the supreme knowledge of the three worlds,

analyzed: ākāśa ādi prayacchanti divya dṛṣṭi śruta āgamam
translated: They grant the divine vision, hearing, and scriptures from the sky and so on.

original: sarvabhūtā vaśaṃ yānti grahāś caiva viśeṣataḥ // / //
analyzed: sarva bhūtāḥ vaśam yānti grahāḥ ca eva viśeṣataḥ
translated: All beings come under control, and especially the planets,

original: viṣaṃ ca nirviṣaṃ kuryād darśanād eva sarvataḥ /🔽na tasya tiṣṭhate gātre viṣaṃ sthāvarajaṅgamam // / //
analyzed: viṣam ca nirviṣam kuryāt darśanāt eva sarvatas  na tasya tiṣṭhate gātre viṣam sthāvara jaṅgamam
translated: And even from just seeing it, they would make poison become non-poisonous in every way.🔽Poison, whether moving or unmoving, does not remain in his body,

original: kīṭalūtās tu bhūtāś ca apamṛtyur na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: kīṭa lūtāḥ tu bhūtāḥ ca apamṛtyuḥ na tiṣṭhati
translated: And insects, worms, spirits, and untimely death do not remain.

original: garajaṃ yogajaṃ doṣaṃ pralayaṃ yānti dūrataḥ // / //
analyzed: gara jam yoga jam doṣam pralayam yānti dūratas
translated: Thunderbolt and yoga-born faults go away far away,

analyzed: cūrṇa lepa añjana ādīni kuhakāni tu yāni vai
translated: And whatever powders, ointments, collyrium, and other tricks

original: ye kariṣyanti ripavaḥ striyo vā puruṣasya vā // / //
analyzed: ye kariṣyanti ripavaḥ striyaḥ vā puruṣasya vā
translated: That enemies, whether women or men, would do to a man,

original: tatkṣaṇāt pralayaṃ yānti teṣāṃ pratyaṅgirā bhavet /
analyzed: tad kṣaṇāt pralayam yānti teṣām pratyaṅgirāḥ bhavet
translated: They would instantly perish, and Pratyangira would be their enemy.

analyzed: smaraṇāt devadevasya indram yāti narottamaḥ
translated: By remembering the god of gods, the best of men goes to Indra,

analyzed: jvalantaḥ dṛśyate bhūtaiḥ hṛd cakre vidhi saṃsthitaḥ
translated: He is seen blazing by the beings, situated in the heart cakra, according to the ritual.

original: duṣṭāś ca pralayaṃ yānti siṃhasyaiva yathā mṛgāḥ // / //
analyzed: duṣṭāḥ ca pralayam yānti siṃhasya eva yathā mṛgāḥ
translated: And the wicked ones perish, like deer by a lion.

original: eko doṣo hi mantrasya japyamānasya jāyate /
analyzed: ekaḥ doṣaḥ hi mantrasya japyamānasya jāyate
translated: O dear one, there is only one fault of the mantra being recited,

original: jarā mṛtyuś ca dāridryaṃ vyādhayo vividhāḥ priye // / //
analyzed: jarā mṛtyuḥ ca dāridryam vyādhayaḥ vividhāḥ priye
translated: which is old age, death, poverty, and various diseases.

original: smaraṇāt pralayaṃ yānti tuhinaṃ tu raver iva /
analyzed: smaraṇāt pralayam yānti tuhinam tu raveḥ iva
translated: By remembering it, they perish, like snow by the sun.

original: japyate yeṣu rāṣṭreṣu deśe vā surasundari // / //
analyzed: japyate yeṣu rāṣṭreṣu deśe vā surasundari
translated: O beautiful goddess, in those countries or regions where it is recited,

original: na rujā jāyate tatra svāmī tatra vivardhate /
analyzed: na rujā jāyate tatra svāmī tatra vivardhate
translated: there is no injury there, and the lord prospers there.

analyzed: ekena api su putreṇa ghora deva aṅga pūjanāt
translated: By worshipping the terrible deity with even one good son,

original: ghorīśaṃ tu yadā jñātaṃ sa kulaṃ tārayiṣyati /
analyzed: ghorīśam tu yadā jñātam sa kulam tārayiṣyati
translated: when the terrible lord is known, that family will be liberated.

original: paśavaś ca na naśyanti sadā vardhati gokulam // / //
analyzed: paśavaḥ ca na naśyanti sadā vardhati go kulam
translated: And the cattle do not perish, the cowherd always prospers,

original: vandhyā na jāyate nārī na mriyante ca bālakāḥ /
analyzed: vandhyā na jāyate nārī na mriyante ca bālakāḥ
translated: the barren woman does not give birth, and the children do not die.

analyzed: jvara roga ādibhiḥ tasya kuṭumbam nā eva pīḍyate
translated: His family is not afflicted by fever, disease, and so on.

analyzed: sarva lokasya sampūjyaḥ jāyate rāja vallabhaḥ
translated: He becomes worshiped by all people, and is loved by the king.

original: dhāraṇīyaṃ sadā gātre yathāvat pravadāmy aham // / //
analyzed: dhāraṇīyam sadā gātre yathāvat pravadāmi aham
translated: I shall properly tell you how it should always be worn on the body.

original: puṣpeṇa guḍikāṃ kṛtvā mantraṃ bhūrje samālikhet /
analyzed: puṣpeṇa guḍikām kṛtvā mantram bhūrje samālikhet
translated: Having made a pill with flowers, one should write the mantra on birch bark.

analyzed: kuṅkumena likhet devi rocanāya athavā punar
translated: One should write with saffron, O Goddess, or again with roचना.

original: akāracaturo madhye ātmanāma samālikhet /🔽mantreṇa chāditaṃ nāma aṅkusena tu rakṣitam // / //
analyzed: akāra caturaḥ madhye ātma nāma samālikhet  mantreṇa chāditam nāma aṅkusena tu rakṣitam
translated: In the middle, one should write the four A's and one's own name.🔽The name, covered with the mantra, is protected by the goad.

original: māyayācchādayitvā tu śivaṃ mūrdhni gataṃ likhet /
analyzed: māyayā ācchādayitvā tu śivam mūrdhni gatam likhet
translated: Having covered with the illusion, one should write the auspicious gone to the head.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭha samāyuktam bindu nāda aṅkitam priye
translated: O Beloved, the eight with the sixth combined, marked with the dot and sound.

analyzed: tat śivam tu varārohe catur āśrama pūjitam
translated: That auspicious one, O beautiful lady, worshipped in the four ashramas,

original: sarvaṃ kṣasthaṃ paraṃ mantraṃ sarvarakṣākaraṃ param // / //
analyzed: sarvam kṣa stham param mantram sarva rakṣā karam param
translated: The supreme mantra located in all, the supreme protector from all.

original: nāmnā tu guḍikā hy eṣā sarvarogavimardanī /
analyzed: nāmnā tu guḍikā hi eṣā sarva roga vimardanī
translated: This pill is indeed by name, the destroyer of all diseases.

original: sāntā pūrvaṃ tu kartavyā tataḥ kṣasthāṃ tu kārayet // / //
analyzed: sā antā pūrvam tu kartavyā tatas kṣasthām tu kārayet
translated: It should be made peaceful first, then one should make it located in the ks.

analyzed: kṣakāram kālam ārūḍham okāra upari dīpitam
translated: The letter ks, mounted on time, illuminated above the letter o,

analyzed: ṣaṣṭha svara yutam devi amara tvam prayacchati
translated: Combined with the sixth vowel, O Goddess, grants immortality.

original: yas tu dhārayate divyāṃ guḍikāṃ śivapūjitām /
analyzed: yaḥ tu dhārayate divyām guḍikām śiva pūjitām
translated: He who wears the divine pill, worshipped by Shiva,

original: tasya vakṣyāmi suśroṇi guṇān nānāvidhān śṛṇu // / //
analyzed: tasya vakṣyāmi suśroṇi guṇān nānāvidhān śṛṇu
translated: I will tell you, O beautiful lady, the various qualities, listen.

analyzed: sarva tīrtheṣu yaḥ snātaḥ sarva yajñeṣu dīkṣitaḥ
translated: He who has bathed in all the holy places, who has been initiated in all the sacrifices,

original: na bhayaṃ vidyate tasya dharaṇad ajarāmaraḥ // / //
analyzed: na bhayam vidyate tasya ajara amaraḥ
translated: For him there is no fear, he is free from old age and death on earth.

analyzed: sarva vratāni cīrṇāni sarva tīrtha namaskṛtaḥ
translated: All the vows have been observed, all the holy places have been bowed to,

original: avaniṃ vicaret sarvāṃ bhairavas tu yathā hi saḥ // / //
analyzed: avanim vicaret sarvām bhairavaḥ tu yathā hi saḥ
translated: He should roam the entire earth like Bhairava.

original: sarve te darśanāt tasya sādhakasya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: sarve te darśanāt tasya sādhakasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: All those, by the sight of that great practitioner,

original: duṣṭāś ca pralayaṃ yānti vyādhayo vidravanti ca // / //
analyzed: duṣṭāḥ ca pralayam yānti vyādhayaḥ vidravanti ca
translated: The wicked ones perish and the diseases flee.

original: abrahmacārī cārī syād asnātaḥ snānam āpnuyāt /
analyzed: a brahmacārī cārī syāt a snātaḥ snānam āpnuyāt
translated: An unchaste person becomes chaste, an unbathed person attains a bath,

original: na bhayaṃ vidyate tasya saṅgrāme ca sadā jayaḥ // / //
analyzed: na bhayam vidyate tasya saṅgrāme ca sadā jayaḥ
translated: For him there is no fear, and he always wins in battle.

analyzed: abhakṣya bhakṣaṇam kṛtvā agamyā gamanam tathā
translated: Having eaten what should not be eaten, and having had intercourse with what should not be approached,

original: nāsau lipyati pāpena paṅkasthaṃ kamalaṃ yathā // / //
analyzed: na asau lipyati pāpena paṅka stham kamalam yathā
translated: He is not tainted by sin, like a lotus in the mud.

analyzed: guḍikā tu sadā siddhā mahābhairava dhāritā
translated: The pill is always accomplished, held by the great Bhairava,

analyzed: yoga īśvara ādi munibhiḥ sarva devaiḥ namaskṛtā
translated: Bowed to by the sages beginning with the lord of yoga, and by all the gods.

original: bahunāpi kim uktena satyaṃ satyaṃ yaśasvini /
analyzed: bahunā api kim uktena satyam satyam yaśasvini
translated: What is the use of speaking much? It is true, O glorious one, it is true.

original: jvalanto dṛśyate bhūtair yathā rudro makhāntakṛt // / //
analyzed: jvalantaḥ dṛśyate bhūtaiḥ yathā rudraḥ makha anta kṛt
translated: Rudra, the destroyer of sacrifices, is seen blazing by the spirits.

original: supto bhuktaḥ prabuddhaś ca atha maithunam āgate /
analyzed: suptaḥ bhuktaḥ prabuddhaḥ ca atha maithunam āgate
translated: When sleeping, eating, waking up, and when engaging in sexual intercourse,

original: mahāhave mahādevi duṣṭasiṃhagajeṣu ca // / //🔽vidyudvajrāśaniś caiva utpāteṣv aśanīṣu ca /
analyzed: mahā āhave mahādevi duṣṭa siṃha gajeṣu ca  vidyut vajra aśaniḥ ca eva utpāteṣu aśanīṣu ca
translated: In great battles, O great goddess, and when there are wicked lions and elephants,🔽And when there are portents of lightning, thunderbolts, and hail,

original: śatrunāśe ca gonāśe viṣaśaṅkāgataṃ ca yat // / //
analyzed: śatru nāśe ca go nāśe viṣa śaṅkā gatam ca yat
translated: And when there is destruction of enemies, loss of cows, and suspicion of poison,

original: ārṇaveṣu ca sarveṣu dhāraṇān na bhayaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: ārṇaveṣu ca sarveṣu dhāraṇāt na bhayam bhavet
translated: In all the oceans, there will be no fear from holding this.

analyzed: śākinyaḥ vaśa gāḥ tasya duṣṭa vetāla rākṣasāḥ
translated: The shakinis will be under his control, and wicked vetalas and rakshasas,

original: śucir vāpy aśucir vāpi vidravanti diśo daśa /
analyzed: śuciḥ vā api aśuciḥ vā api vidravanti diśaḥ daśa
translated: Whether he is pure or impure, they flee in the ten directions.

analyzed: guḍikā eṣā samākhyātā triloha pariveṣṭitā
translated: This gudika, which is covered with the three metals,

analyzed: dhāraṇīyā prayatnena śiva lokam avāpnuyāt
translated: Should be carefully worn, and one will attain Shiva's world.

analyzed: sarva avasthā gataḥ vā api muktim yāti surādhipe
translated: Even in all states, one attains liberation, O lord of gods,

original: matsamo dhāraṇād devi satyaṃ satyaṃ yaśasvini /
analyzed: mad samaḥ dhāraṇāt devi satyam satyam yaśasvini
translated: By holding this, O goddess, one becomes equal to me, it is true, it is true, O illustrious one.

original: mayāpi dhāritā hy eṣā brahmaṇāpi tataḥ punaḥ // / //
analyzed: mayā api dhāritā hi eṣā brahmaṇā api tatas punar
translated: This has been held by me, and then by Brahma,

original: viṣṇunā devarājena yuddhe daityās tu nirjitāḥ /
analyzed: viṣṇunā devarājena yuddhe daityāḥ tu nirjitāḥ
translated: By Vishnu, the king of gods, the demons were defeated in battle.

analyzed: agni vāyu kubereṇa yamena varuṇena ca
translated: By Agni, Vayu, Kubera, Yama, and Varuna,

original: mātṛbhir guhyakaiś caiva garuḍena ca dhīmatā /
analyzed: mātṛbhiḥ guhyakaiḥ ca eva garuḍena ca dhīmatā
translated: By the mothers, the guhyakas, and the wise Garuda,

analyzed: dadhīcinā ca śukreṇa durvāsena api dhīmatā
translated: and by Dadhichi, Shukra, and also by the wise Durvasa,

original: ṛṣibhiś ca tathā sarvair devadaityaiḥ kujeśvari /
analyzed: ṛṣibhiḥ ca tathā sarvaiḥ deva daityaiḥ kujeśvari
translated: and by all the sages, and by the gods and demons, O Goddess of the Kulas,

analyzed: tatas tu anyaiḥ ca rājānaiḥ balibhiḥ nahuṣa ādibhiḥ
translated: and then by other powerful kings like Bali and Nahusha,

analyzed: yuddhe jaya arthibhiḥ devi ugra vyādhi jaya arthibhiḥ
translated: desiring victory in battle, O Goddess, and desiring to conquer terrible diseases,

analyzed: prajā vaśyā arthibhiḥ ca eva guḍikā kaṇṭha dhāritā
translated: and desiring control over the people, the amulet is worn around the neck.

original: nānayā sadṛśī vidyā guḍikā bhuvi vidyate /
analyzed: na anayā sadṛśī vidyā guḍikā bhuvi vidyate
translated: There is no knowledge like this amulet found on earth.

original: piṇḍaṃ tu prathamaṃ mantryam aghoreṇa susaṃskṛtam // / //
