translated: By the piercing of which one who is pierced does not experience the taste of pleasure,

analyzed: sa katham sva artha nirmuktaḥ viṣayeṣu virajyate  śāmbhave na hi samprāpte darpeṇa ākulita īkṣaṇaḥ
translated: how is he detached from the objects of sense, being freed from his own purpose?🔽When Śiva has not been attained, with eyes agitated by pride,

analyzed: nāyakaiḥ saḥ abhibhūyeta na sidhyati adhikāra kṛt
translated: he is overcome by the leaders and does not succeed in performing his duties.

original: ājñānande samutpanne na gantavyaṃ guroḥ kulāt /
analyzed: ājñā ānande samutpanne na gantavyam guroḥ kulāt
translated: When the bliss of initiation has arisen, one should not leave the teacher's house.

analyzed: kasmāt sāmarthya hetu artham yāvat na utpādayet guṇān

analyzed: divā preṣaṇa tad niṣṭhaḥ rātrau jñāna parigrahaḥ
translated: During the day, devoted to being sent, at night, the acquisition of knowledge.

original: evaṃ sampādayet sarvaṃ sāmarthyaṃ tu guroḥ kule // / //
analyzed: evam sampādayet sarvam sāmarthyam tu guroḥ kule
translated: Thus, he should accomplish everything, but the ability is in the teacher's house.

original: apreṣite na gantavyaṃ na kuryāc colbaṇādikam /
analyzed: a preṣite na gantavyam na kuryāt ca ulbaṇa ādikam
translated: When not sent, one should not go, and one should not do anything out of arrogance.

original: ye na kopavaśād ājñāṃ dāsyanti gamanaṃ prati // / //
analyzed: ye na kopa vaśāt ājñām dāsyanti gamanam prati
translated: Those who, out of anger, will not give permission to go.

analyzed: śāmbhava ājñā samutpanne yaḥ evam kurute kudhīḥ
translated: If one who is of evil mind acts in this way when the command of Shambhu has arisen,

analyzed: tasya pīṭha adhipāḥ pālāḥ ca abhibhūyanti anekadhā  anuṣṭhāna tapaḥ upāyaiḥ yadā ānanda bhṛtaḥ tanuḥ  tadā adhikāraḥ kartavyaḥ yasya ājñā tasya tad pade

analyzed: anujñātaḥ bhiṣiktasya nāmamālām prakāśayet
translated: Having been permitted, he should proclaim the garland of names of the consecrated one.

analyzed: nava pañcavidham dravyam pūjā arthe sampradarśitam

analyzed: śubhe hani muhūrte ca caturdaśyā aṣṭamīṣu ca
translated: On an auspicious day, in an auspicious moment, on the fourteenth or eighth days,

analyzed: darpaṇa udara bhū bhāge vastre vā atha su śobhane
translated: on the surface of a mirror or on a very beautiful cloth.

analyzed: tatas upari yajet siddhān
translated: Above that, one should worship the accomplished ones endowed with omniscience and qualities,

analyzed: caturviṃśa ṣoḍaśa evam aṣṭau ca eva tri paṅktiṣu
translated: twenty-four, sixteen, and eight in the three rows,

original: dvau siddhau madhyadeśe tu kuṅkumena tu cākṣataiḥ /
analyzed: dvau siddhau madhyadeśe tu kuṅkumena tu ca akṣataiḥ

analyzed: tri hastam maṇḍalam kuryāt ūrdhva ādau pūrva paścimam

original: śṛṅgātakākṛti hy evaṃ tatra pūjāṃ samārabhet /

translated: in the shape of a peak, and begin the worship there.

analyzed: pūjayitvā vidhānena dravyaiḥ pañcanava ādibhiḥ
translated: Having worshipped according to the rules with the five or nine substances,

analyzed: pṛthak dīpaiḥ pūjayitvā phalguṣa ali sugandhibhiḥ
translated: having worshipped with individual lamps, fragrant with barley and rice,

analyzed: su praṇītam su bhaktam ca ājñā guṇa vidhāyinam
translated: well-ordered and well-served, the one who bestows the qualities of the command,

original: tataḥ praveśayec chiṣyaṃ puṣpaṃ mocāpayed iti /

analyzed: yasmin mārge patet puṣpam tat nāma tasya dāpayet

analyzed: prakaṭam śiva vijñeyam guptam ānandam ucyate

analyzed: akāra ādi kṣakāra antam pañcāśa guṇa lakṣitam
translated: From the letter a up to the letter kṣa, characterized by fifty qualities,

analyzed: akṣare akṣare siddham puṣpa pātāt vilakṣayet

Śrīkaṇṭha, Ananta, Sūkṣmeśa, Trimurti, Amara, Arghiṇa,

original: tithīśo bhārabhūtiś ca sthāṇunāmo haras tathā /

analyzed: kūrmaḥ ca eva eka netraḥ ca catur āsyaḥ vasā anugaḥ

analyzed: prathamā yā sthitā paṅktiḥ pīṭha traya vibhūṣitā

analyzed: ajeśaḥ śarma somaḥ ca dārukaḥ

analyzed: krama āmnāyam punar pātre kuryāt tena abhiṣecanam

analyzed: mukhena vā atha kartavyam yasya upari su bhāvanā

analyzed: adhikāra padam sarvam mokṣitam te prasādataḥ

analyzed: samudra vat kula ānandam yasmāt tat sarvatomukham

analyzed: kulam tat eva vijñeyam sarva anugraha kārakam

analyzed: mātaṅga mleccha jāti uttham bauddha sāṅkhya digambaram
translated: Born from the Mleccha caste, a Buddhist, a Samkhya, a Jain,
Endowed with the triple staff, shaven head, skull-cup, and other practices,

analyzed: yāsyanti paramam śaivam śaivaḥ yāti na kutracid
translated: They will go to the supreme state of Shiva, but a Shaiva goes nowhere.

analyzed: tat ca kaula bhṛta ānandam na itaram tu kriyākulam

analyzed: sarvajña mārga vihitam sarva ācāra prapālakam

analyzed: kaulika ācāra mārgeṇa bhāva advaitena sarvathā

analyzed: tattva advaitena mārgeṇa sarvathā yatra saṃsthitaḥ
translated: By the path of the non-duality of reality, in every way, where one is established,

analyzed: pālayet laukika ācāram advaitam samanuṣṭhayet
translated: One should maintain worldly conduct, practice non-duality,

analyzed: gopayet gupta liṅgāni tad praviṣṭāni sarvathā

analyzed: adhamāt uttamam jñānam yadi arthī uttamaḥ bhavet
translated: If the seeker is superior, he should be superior, with knowledge superior to the inferior,

analyzed: liṅginaḥ vā dvijanmā vā ājñā arthī tu na vañcayet

translated: One should do everything in a secluded place, not in a crowd,

analyzed: anyathā sthiti bhaṅgaḥ syāt naśyate śāsanam priye

analyzed: varjayet kaulikān bauddhān tathā mīmāṃsaka āsthitān

analyzed: jihvā upastha nimitta artham advaitam teṣu sarvathā

analyzed: kaulika ācāra nirmuktāḥ śvāna vat vicaranti te
translated: They wander like dogs, devoid of Kaula conduct.

analyzed: nirācāram prakurvanti nirācāra vivarjitāḥ

analyzed: viṣam bhakṣanti te mūḍhāḥ yathā ājñā mantra varjitāḥ

analyzed: yadi api te tri kāla jñāḥ trailokya ākarṣaṇa kṣamāḥ
translated: Even if they know the three times and are capable of attracting the three worlds,

translated: they still maintain the stability of the family by observing the conventional conduct.🔽By the yoga of non-conduct, they see, free from objects.

analyzed: viṣaya stha upahāsi tvam nirācāreṇa yāti asau
translated: By non-conduct, one who abides in objects attains the state of being free from contempt.

analyzed: bhraṣṭa naṣṭa kulam tyajya kula kaulam samāśrayet
translated: One should abandon the fallen and lost family and resort to the Kula and Kaula.

analyzed: tatra yogi gurūṇām ca pūjyate caraṇa ambujam
translated: There, the lotus feet of the yogi gurus are worshipped.

original: samayena vinā devi samartho bhavate katham /
analyzed: samayena vinā devi samarthaḥ bhavate katham
translated: O Goddess, without the convention, how can one become capable?

analyzed: sāmarthyena vinā caryā nirācāra ātmikā bhavet
translated: Without capability, conduct would be of the nature of non-conduct.

analyzed: jñātvā āmnāya padam sarvam yathāvastham kula īśvaram
translated: Having known all the stages of the tradition, as they are, the lord of the Kula,

analyzed: ṣaṣ prakāra vidhānena nirgata ācāra rūpiṇam
translated: who has emerged in the form of conduct by the arrangement of the six kinds,

analyzed: sāmarthya guṇa yukta ātmā viṣaya atītaḥ jita indriyaḥ
translated: one who has the quality of capability, who is beyond objects, who has conquered the senses,

translated: who has a mind free from passion, he would be one of non-conduct.

original: etat te kathitaṃ devi sarahasyaṃ sugopitam /

translated: This, O Goddess, has been told to you, along with the secret, well-concealed.

analyzed: śrī kubjikā uvāca
translated: Shri Kubjika said:

analyzed: mantra tantraiḥ tvayā deva bhrāmitā aham kriyā ādibhiḥ
translated: O Lord, I have been deluded by you with mantras, tantras, rituals, etc.

analyzed: dhyāna dhāraṇa yogaiḥ ca idānīm kathaya sphuṭam
translated: Now, please tell me clearly about meditation, retention, and yoga.

analyzed: pūrva tantre tvayā deva sūcitam na prakāśitam

analyzed: adhunā śrotum icchāmi ṣaṭpada artha vinirṇayam

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Bhairava said:

analyzed: mahā ānanda karam vākyam mahā āścarya karam param
translated: The statement that brings great bliss, the supreme wonder,

analyzed: gopitam sarva devānām tathā te kathayāmi aham

analyzed: an ādi nidhana īśānāt śivāt parama kāraṇāt
translated: From Shiva, the beginningless and endless Lord, the supreme cause,

analyzed: divya ājñāyāḥ kramaḥ jātaḥ pāramparya ogha santatiḥ
translated: The sequence of the divine command has arisen, the continuous flow of the lineage.

analyzed: akulam ca kulam ca eva kula akula vinirṇayam
translated: The unmanifest and the manifest, the determination of the manifest and unmanifest,

analyzed: adhunā kathayiṣyāmi navadhā nirṇayaḥ yathā
translated: Now I will explain how the determination is of nine kinds.

original: parasya paramāṃ viddhi yonim ādyāṃ mahāmbike /
analyzed: parasya paramām viddhi yonim ādyām mahā ambike
translated: Know the supreme womb of the supreme, the primordial one, O Great Mother.

analyzed: rūpa atīta ādi yogena parā icchā iyam caturvidhā
translated: This supreme will is fourfold by the yoga of transcending form, etc.

original: rūpātītaṃ tu kāmākhyaṃ rūpaṃ pūrṇagirir mahān /
analyzed: rūpātītam tu kāma ākhyam rūpam pūrṇagiriḥ mahān
translated: The form beyond form is called desire, the great form is Pūrṇagiri.

original: padaṃ jālandharākhyaṃ tu piṇḍam oḍraṃ prakīrtitam // / //
analyzed: padam jālandhara ākhyam tu piṇḍam oḍram prakīrtitam
translated: The stage is called Jālandhara, the aggregate is proclaimed to be Oḍra.

analyzed: sūkṣmā ca susūkṣma ādyam catuṣṭayam
translated: The last nectar, the subtle, the very subtle, and the first set of four,

analyzed: akula īśvara devasya sambandhaḥ prathamaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The connection with the Lord of the Akula is known as the first.

analyzed: rūpātītāt paraḥ hinduḥ bhāsvaraḥ
translated: Beyond the form beyond form is the Hindu, presided over by Śakti, radiant.

original: tato nādo nirodhaś ca ardhacandram anukramāt // / //
analyzed: tatas nādaḥ nirodhaḥ ca ardhacandram anukramāt
translated: Then the sound, the obstruction, and the half-moon in order,

analyzed: etat tat pañcakam proktam jñāna ratna mahodayam
translated: This is said to be the set of five, the great rise of the jewel of knowledge.

analyzed: sā yoniḥ paramā jñeyā kriyā adhvāna mahā udadhiḥ
translated: That womb should be known as supreme, the great ocean of the path of action.

analyzed: nadate daśadhā sā tu divya ānanda pradāyikā

analyzed: candra rūpam yadā paśyet tārā maṇḍala madhyatas
translated: When one sees the moon-like form in the midst of the circle of stars,

original: tārāvatī tu sā proktā avasthā siddhidāyikā // / //🔽abhyasyantaḥ svarūpeṇa samādhisthaḥ prapaśyati /
analyzed: tārāvatī tu sā proktā avasthā siddhi dāyikā  abhyasyantaḥ sva rūpeṇa samādhi sthaḥ prapaśyati
translated: That is called Tārāvatī, the state that bestows accomplishment.🔽Meditating in one's own form, one sees in samādhi,

analyzed: ātma bimba pura stham tu bimbā sā avaśya siddhi dā
translated: The image residing in the city of the image, that Bimba is the bestower of certain accomplishment.

analyzed: samādhi sthaḥ sva bimbam tu āsanena samanvitam
translated: One in samādhi, seeing one's own image endowed with a seat,

original: utpatantaṃ yadā paśyet tadā sā bimbakhecarī // / //
analyzed: utpatantam yadā paśyet tadā sā bimbakhecarī
translated: When one sees it flying up, then that is the image Khecarī.

original: dṛṣṭvaitāṃ tu mahāvasthāṃ siddher bhrāntiṃ na kārayet /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā etām tu mahā avasthām siddheḥ bhrāntim na kārayet
translated: Having seen this great state, one should not mistake it for accomplishment,

original: avaśyaṃ yāti khecakre hy uktakālaṃ kuleśvari // / //
analyzed: avaśyam yāti khecakre hi ukta kālam kuleśvari
translated: One certainly goes to the circle of sky-walkers, O Queen of Kula, in the prescribed time.

analyzed: eṣā avasthā samāsādya daśa avasthāḥ tyajet punar
translated: Having attained this state, one should again abandon the ten states.

analyzed: guṇān utpādayitvā tu anāhata padam vrajet
translated: Having produced the qualities, one should go to the stage of the unstruck sound.

original: athānyat paramaṃ vakṣYe maṇipūraṃ yathā sthitam /
analyzed: athā anyat paramam vakṣye maṇipūram yathā sthitam
translated: Now I will tell you about another supreme [state], as it is situated in the navel.

original: tathā tvaṃ śṛṇu kalyāṇi kalyāṇānandavardhanam // / //🔽sthitaṃ dvādaśabhedena someśādau śikhāntikam /
analyzed: tathā tvam śṛṇu kalyāṇi kalyāṇa ānanda vardhanam  sthitam dvādaśa bhedena soma īśa ādau śikhā antikam
translated: Listen, O auspicious one, to the enhancement of auspicious bliss.🔽Situated in twelve divisions, from the moon to the topknot,

analyzed: nābhi udara nitamba ūru jaṅghā aṅghrīm anukramāt
translated: In the navel, belly, buttocks, thighs, calves, and feet, in order.

analyzed: kula nātha maheśasya saṃsthitaḥ maṇipūrakaḥ
translated: The Manipura [cakra] is situated in the navel of Mahesha, the Lord of Kula.

analyzed: tanu cakre samāvṛtya yathāvastham tathā śṛṇu
translated: Surrounding the body cakra, listen to it as it is situated.

analyzed: soma īśa udara saṃstham tu dvādaśa arci samanvitam
translated: Situated in the belly of Somesha, endowed with twelve flames,

analyzed: dvīpa kṣetra samāyuktam tat eva anyān vilakṣayet
translated: United with the island and field, one should consider it as the others.

original: lāṅgalī dakṣiṇe kukṣau vāme dārukajaṃ vibhum /
analyzed: lāṅgalī dakṣiṇe kukṣau vāme dāruka jam vibhum
translated: Langali [is situated] in the right side of the belly, and the Lord born from Dāruka [is situated] in the left.

original: ardhanārīśvaraṃ nābhau svacakraparivāritam // / //🔽dakṣiṇena hy umākāntaṃ nitambe vāmato 'ṣaḍhim /
analyzed: ardhanārīśvaram nābhau sva cakra parivāritam  dakṣiṇena hi umā kāntam nitambe
translated: Ardhanārīśvara [is situated] in the navel, surrounded by one's own cakra.🔽To the right is Umākānta, and to the left is Aṣṭamūrti [is situated] in the buttocks.

analyzed: ḍiṇḍi tri yugala ūrubhyām jānubhyām mīna meṣakau
translated: The two Dindi [cakra] are in the two thighs, and Meṣa and Mina [are situated] in the two knees.

analyzed: lohita ākhyam śikhīnātham dakṣa ādau vāmam āśritau
translated: The Lord of the Crest named Lohita, resorting to the left in the east and other directions,

original: pīṭhanāthaṃ tathā kṣetraṃ dvīpaṃ dvīpādhipaiḥ saha // / //
analyzed: pīṭhanātham tathā kṣetram dvīpam dvīpa adhipaiḥ saha
translated: The Lord of the Sacred Seat, the sacred place, the island, along with the lords of the islands,

original: maṇivad dyotayantaṃ tu pūrayantaṃ diśo daśa /
analyzed: maṇi vat dyotayantam tu pūrayantam diśaḥ daśa
translated: Illuminating like a jewel, filling the ten directions,

original: sūryakāntimaṇiprakhyaṃ bhāskareva prapaśyate // / //🔽kālasaṅkhyākaraṃ devaṃ kalair dvādaśabhir yutam /
analyzed: sūrya kānti maṇi prakhyam bhāskarā iva prapaśyate  kāla saṅkhyā karam devam kalaiḥ dvādaśabhiḥ yutam
translated: Resembling the sun's radiant jewel, one sees like the sun,🔽The god who measures time, endowed with twelve parts,

analyzed: pīṭhanātham tu dvīpa stham māsam āsāditaḥ kramāt
translated: The Lord of the Sacred Seat residing in the island, from month to month, in due order,

analyzed: pūrayet varṣa santānam yuga manvantarāṇi ca
translated: One should fill the series of years, the yugas, and the Manvantaras,

analyzed: kalpam ca iti mahākalpam maṇi dvādaśabhiḥ khilam
translated: The kalpa, and the great kalpa, with the twelve jewels,

analyzed: yatas pūrayet viśvātmā tena idam maṇipūrakam
translated: Since the universal soul fills it, therefore this is Manipura,

analyzed: śakti mārga prapannānām bhukti mukti phala pradam
translated: Which bestows the fruits of enjoyment and liberation to those who have resorted to the path of Shakti,

original: ekaikaṃ cintayec cakraṃ nāthājñā hy upadeśataḥ /
analyzed: ekaikam cintayet cakram nātha ājñā hi upadeśataḥ
translated: One should contemplate each cakra, for the command of the Lord is through instruction.

analyzed: bhavanti sarva siddhīni uttama adhama madhyamāḥ
translated: All the accomplishments arise, the supreme, the middling, and the inferior,🔽Manipura, located in the feet, endowed with the Lord of the Sacred Seat,

analyzed: dvīpa dvīpa adhipaiḥ yuktam māsam ekam yadā abhyaset
translated: When one practices for one month, along with the islands and the lords of the islands,

analyzed: pāda cāri jagat sarvam kṣobhayet avicārataḥ
translated: The entire world, moving on foot, can be agitated without hesitation.

analyzed: pūjā dhyāna samādhi sthaḥ śakti mārgeṇa yoga vid
translated: The knower of yoga, abiding in worship, meditation, and samadhi, by the path of Shakti,

original: ṣaṇmāsena avaśyaṃ hi vatsarāntaṃ na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṣ māsena avaśyam hi vatsara antam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: within six months, certainly, up to a year, there is no doubt.

analyzed: anyat śīghra gatiḥ tasya ātmanaḥ sampravartate
translated: Another swift progress arises for him.

original: pāduke pādalepaṃ vā manovegaḥ prajāyate /🔽evaṃ jānuni abhyāsād bhūtavetālanayakaḥ // / //
analyzed: pāduke pāda lepam vā manaḥ vegaḥ prajāyate  evam jānuni abhyāsāt bhūta vetāla nayakaḥ
translated: By the sandals or foot ointment, the speed of mind arises.🔽Thus, by practice on the knees, he becomes the leader of ghosts and spirits.

original: kurute vividhāścaryaṃ kalpasthāyī bhavet tu saḥ /
analyzed: kurute vividha āścaryam kalpa sthāyī bhavet tu saḥ
translated: He performs various wonders and becomes one who lives for an aeon.

analyzed: ātmavantaḥ mahā utsāhaḥ ūrubhyām uraga īśvaraḥ
translated: The self-possessed, of great enthusiasm, by the thighs, the lord of serpents,

analyzed: kim tu tad dviguṇena eva kālena prathama āditaḥ
translated: but that, indeed, by twice that time alone, from the beginning,

original: krameṇa sidhyate sarvam ādyantena vilakṣayet // / //🔽nitambābhyāsayogena guhyakānāṃ patir bhavet /
analyzed: krameṇa sidhyate sarvam ādi antena vilakṣayet  nitamba abhyāsa yogena guhyakānām patiḥ bhavet
translated: everything is accomplished in order, one should mark the beginning and end.🔽By the yoga of practice on the buttocks, one becomes the lord of the Guhyakas.

analyzed: yakṣa vidyādharāṇam ca preta paiśāca rākṣasām
translated: And of the Yakshas, Vidyadharas, Pretas, Pisachas, and Rakshasas,

analyzed: krīḍate nāyakaḥ bhūtvā pūrva mārga vidhau sthitaḥ
translated: the leader, abiding in the method of the former path, plays.

analyzed: kukṣi mārga gate cakre abhyasantaḥ śriyam labhet
translated: And those practicing in the wheel located in the path of the abdomen, would obtain prosperity.

analyzed: kinnara indra sa gandharvaḥ loka alokeṣu pūjyate
translated: O king of Kinnaras, together with the Gandharvas, he is worshipped in the worlds within and beyond the universe.

original: vāyuvad bhramate so hi sarvatraivam aśaṅkitaḥ // / //
analyzed: vāyu vat bhramate saḥ hi sarvatra evam aśaṅkitaḥ
translated: Like the wind, he moves everywhere, free from doubt.

analyzed: madhya nābhi gate cakre mūlameḍhre yadā abhyaset
translated: When one practices at the navel in the middle and at the root of the genitals,
peace, nourishment, attraction, omniscience, great prosperity,

analyzed: sakṛt saṃsmaraṇāt evam abhyasantaḥ khageśvaraḥ
translated: merely by remembering this once, practicing thus, the lord of birds,

analyzed: brahmāṇḍa antara niḥśeṣam bhramate kāmarūpiṇaḥ
translated: roams everywhere within the universe, assuming any form at will.

analyzed: sāṅkhya jñāna vidaḥ bhūtvā vicaret sva puram punar
translated: Having become a knower of the Sāṃkhya knowledge, he moves again in his own city.

original: atha spaṣṭataraṃ devi śaktityāgaṃ śṛṇuṣva me // / //
analyzed: atha spaṣṭataram devi śakti tyāgam śṛṇuṣva me
translated: Now, O Goddess, listen to the renunciation of Śakti from me, which is clearer.

original: yad etat paramaṃ bījaṃ haṃsākhyaṃ hṛdi saṃsthitam /
analyzed: yat etat paramam bījam haṃsa ākhyam hṛdi saṃsthitam
translated: This supreme seed, called Hamsa, which resides in the heart,

original: vinā tenopalabdhiṃ ca na jānāti kadācana // / //
analyzed: vinā tena upalabdhim ca na jānāti kadācana
translated: without it, one never knows perception.

original: tasya rūpatrayaṃ bhadre nādaṃ saṃyogam eva ca /
analyzed: tasya rūpa trayam bhadre nādam saṃyogam eva ca
translated: O good lady, its three forms are sound, union,

analyzed: viyogam ca iti suśroṇi lakṣaṇīyam prayatnataḥ
translated: and separation. O beautiful-hipped one, they should be carefully observed.

analyzed: caitanya tritayam ca atra ātma śakti śiva ātmakam
translated: Here, the triad of consciousness is of the nature of the self, Śakti, and Śiva.

analyzed: avinābhāva yogena caitanya tritaya sthitam
translated: The triad of consciousness exists by the relation of invariable concomitance.

analyzed: tena upacaryate bhadre haṃsadevaḥ parāparaḥ
translated: O good lady, by that, the supreme and inferior Hamsadeva is worshipped.

original: saṅkoce tu parā śaktir vikāse bhairavaḥ smṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: saṅkoce tu parā śaktiḥ vikāse bhairavaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: In contraction, the supreme power is remembered, and in expansion, Bhairava.

analyzed: madhye ātmā sadā tiṣṭhet pūri aṣṭaka samanvitaḥ
translated: In the middle, the Self should always remain, endowed with the group of eight perfections.

analyzed: vikāsaḥ ca ūrdhvanāḍiḥ tu saṅkoca ūdhaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: Expansion is the upper channel, and contraction is declared to be the lower one.

original: madhye nābhir iti proktas trayam etat sudurlabham /
analyzed: madhye nābhiḥ iti proktaḥ trayam etat su durlabham
translated: The middle is said to be the navel - these three are very difficult to attain.

analyzed: ūrdhva nāḍī nirodhena adhas nāḍī nikuñcanāt
translated: By blocking the upper channel and constricting the lower channel,

original: madhye cittaṃ samādāya mathanaṃ tatra kārayet /
analyzed: madhye cittam samādāya mathanam tatra kārayet
translated: taking the mind to the middle, one should churn there.

analyzed: yoni madhya gatam liṅgam yonya udara puṭīkṛtam
translated: The Linga located in the middle of the Yoni, enclosed in the womb of the Yoni,

original: tanmadhye cātmano rūpaṃ lakṣayeta punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: tad madhye ca ātmanaḥ rūpam lakṣayeta punar punar
translated: in the middle of that, one should repeatedly observe one's own form.

original: mathanaṃ hy etad ākhyātam ajñānamalanāśanam // / //🔽madhyamanthānayogena jñānāgnir jvalate kila /
analyzed: mathanam hi etat ākhyātam ajñāna mala nāśanam  madhya manthāna yogena jñāna agniḥ jvalate kila
translated: This is declared to be the churning, which destroys the impurity of ignorance.🔽By the yoga of churning in the middle, the fire of knowledge indeed blazes.

original: jvalite tu tadā vahnau jyotir evaṃ pravardhate // / //
analyzed: jvalite tu tadā vahnau jyotiḥ evam pravardhate
translated: When the fire blazes, the light thus increases.

analyzed: pravardhanāt mahā jyoteḥ ānandam upajāyate
translated: From the increase of the great light, bliss arises.

analyzed: mathanāt bhaga liṅgābhyām yathā ānandaḥ prajāyate
translated: As bliss arises from churning the Yoni and Linga,

analyzed: mathanāt śiva śaktyoḥ tu tathā ānandaḥ prajāyate
translated: And from the churning of Shiva and Shakti, bliss is born.

analyzed: niścaya tvam bhavet devi śiva śaktyoḥ abhedataḥ
translated: O Goddess, certainty arises from the non-duality of Shiva and Shakti.

original: mathanaṃ hy etad evoktam amṛtotpādakaṃ priye /
analyzed: mathanam hi etat eva uktam amṛta utpādakam priye
translated: O Beloved, this churning is said to be the producer of nectar.

analyzed: tena amṛtena ca ātmānam plāvyamānam vicintayet
translated: One should contemplate oneself being bathed with that nectar.

original: eṣā sā paramā vṛttiḥ paratattvam idaṃ smṛtam /
analyzed: eṣā sā paramā vṛttiḥ para tattvam idam smṛtam
translated: This is that supreme state, remembered as the supreme truth.

analyzed: etat tat paramam brahma parama ānanda lakṣaṇam
translated: This is that supreme Brahman, characterized by supreme bliss.

analyzed: tat ānanda para ānandam śakti tyāgam iti smṛtam
translated: That bliss, the supreme bliss, is remembered as the renunciation of Shakti.

original: eṣa te maṇipūras tu sarahasyaṃ prakāśitam // / //
analyzed: eṣa te maṇipūraḥ tu sa rahasyam prakāśitam
translated: This is the secret of your Manipura, revealed to you.

analyzed: gopitam pūrva tantreṣu kubji tubhyam prakāśitam
translated: Concealed in the previous Tantras, it is revealed to you, O Kubji.

analyzed: dvīpa mārga vibhāgena pīṭhanātha krameṇa tu
translated: By the division of the island path and the sequence of the lords of the sacred seats,

original: durlabhaṃ siddhamārgasya kiṃ punas tv itareṣu ca /
analyzed: durlabham siddha mārgasya kim punar tu itareṣu ca
translated: It is difficult to attain even for the accomplished path, let alone others.

analyzed: ukta kālena sidhyanti avaśyam na anṛtam vacaḥ
translated: They will certainly be accomplished in the stated time, the words are not false.

original: śṛṇu devi yathāvasthaṃ svādhiṣṭhānaṃ vadāmi te /
analyzed: śṛṇu devi yathāvastham svādhiṣṭhānam vadāmi te
translated: Listen, O Goddess, I will tell you the state of the svadhisthana as it is.

analyzed: kalā kalita dehasya yathāsthānam nigadyate
translated: The body endowed with the kalas is described according to its location.

analyzed: pūrvam ekārṇave ghore tamaḥ bhūte jagattraye
translated: In the past, in a terrible ocean of water, when the three worlds were enveloped in darkness,

analyzed: liṅga rūpa dharaḥ ca aham para icchā vaśa vartinaḥ
translated: I, in the form of a Linga, abiding by the will of the Supreme,

analyzed: ṣaṇmukhaḥ kāla rūpaḥ ham liṅga ākāraḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: I am the six-faced one, in the form of time, established in the form of a Linga.

original: ṣaṭkalābhir vṛto nityaṃ viśvamadhye ramāmy aham // / //
analyzed: ṣaṣ kalābhiḥ vṛtaḥ nityam viśva madhye ramāmi aham
translated: Surrounded by the six Kalas (parts), I always rejoice in the midst of the universe.

analyzed: ṣaṣ kauṣikena yuktaḥ ham piṇḍaḥ ham naṅga varcasaḥ
translated: I am united with the six Kausikas, I am the lump, I am of the splendor of Ananga (Cupid).

original: tataḥ pravartitā sṛṣṭir mamecchā tu punaḥ priye // / //
analyzed: tatas pravartitā sṛṣṭiḥ mama icchā tu punar priye
translated: Then creation was set in motion, but again, O beloved, it is by my will.

analyzed: brahma viṣṇu ādibhiḥ siddhaiḥ pūjita ārādhitaḥ stutaḥ
translated: I am worshipped, propitiated, and praised by Brahma, Vishnu, and other Siddhas.

analyzed: tatas ham varam āpannaḥ teṣu bhāva anuvartinām
translated: Then I received a boon from them, following their sentiments.

original: ṣaḍasraṃ caturasraṃ tu ātmānaṃ ca samarpitam /
analyzed: ṣaṣ asram catur asram tu ātmānam ca samarpitam
translated: The six-sided and four-sided self was offered to me.

analyzed: tena te kāraṇa tvena sṛṣṭi kṛt kāraṇa īśvarāḥ
translated: Therefore, they are the creators of creation, the lords of causes, as the cause.

analyzed: hartā kartā svatantrāḥ te mad rūpa guṇa cetasaḥ
translated: They are the destroyer, the creator, independent, having my form, qualities, and mind.

original: punaḥ stotraṃ samārabdhaṃ tais tu nāthaiḥ punar hy ah am // / //
analyzed: punar stotram samārabdham taiḥ tu nāthaiḥ punar hi ah am
translated: Again, the lords began to praise me.

analyzed: yāvat na eka vidhānena tāvat teṣām vara pradaḥ
translated: As long as they praised in various ways, I granted them boons.

analyzed: punar tīva varam prārthaya puṣkalam
translated: Again, they were greatly satisfied and requested an excellent boon.

analyzed: taiḥ uktam devadeveśa liṅga idam sarvatomukham
translated: They said, O Lord of the gods of gods, this Linga is all-pervading.

original: yena pūjyo bhavāmīha tad varaṃ dada me prabho // / //
analyzed: yena pūjyaḥ bhavāmi iha tat varam dada me prabho
translated: By which I can be worshipped here, O Lord, please grant me that boon.

analyzed: asya liṅgasya māhātmyam vyāpti bhūtam yathā sthitam
translated: The greatness of this Linga is all-pervading as it is.

original: tathā kuru maheśāna jānīmo niścayaṃ yathā // / //
analyzed: tathā kuru maheśāna jānīmaḥ niścayam yathā
translated: O Mahesha, do it in such a way that we may know the truth.

analyzed: tatas teṣām mahādevi vyāpti mārgaḥ pradarśitaḥ
translated: Then, O great goddess, the path of pervasion was shown to them.

analyzed: vyakta liṅgam kṛtam paścāt ṣaḍadhva guṇa gocaram
translated: Later, the manifest Linga was made, the sphere of the qualities of the six paths.

analyzed: ṣaḍadhvara upadeśena tanuḥ teṣām pradarśitā
translated: By the teaching of the six paths, their body was shown.

original: dviraṇḍena kṛtaṃ dehaṃ śeṣā vaktrāṇi cordhvataḥ // / //
analyzed: dvis aṇḍena kṛtam deham śeṣāḥ vaktrāṇi ca ūrdhvatas
translated: The body was made by Dviranda, and the other faces are above.

analyzed: vāma ādi krama yogena sañjātāni viduḥ budhāḥ
translated: The wise know them to have arisen through the union of Vama and others.

analyzed: chagalaṇḍa uttaram vaktram mahākāla ūrdhvatas sthitaḥ
translated: The face to the north of Chagalanda is Mahakalasthita.

analyzed: vāli vaktram bhavet pūrvam puruṣam jīva rūpiṇam
translated: The eastern face would be Vali, the Purusha in the form of the living being.

analyzed: bhujaṅgam krūram nāga rūpam mahat bhutam
translated: The cruel one on the right is Bhujangam, the form of a great serpent.

analyzed: paścimam tu pināka ākhyam nivṛtti stham niyāmakam
translated: The western one is called Pinaka, the regulator located in Nivritti.

analyzed: avidyā ākhyam purā proktam kṣaṇa dhvaṃsī vināśakam
translated: It was previously called Avidya, the destroyer of the momentary destroyer.

analyzed: atra madhye trayam śreṣṭham a vināśa akṣaya avyayam
translated: In the middle of this, the triad is supreme, imperishable, indestructible, and immutable.

original: māyā śambhuś ca puruṣaṃ kṣīYate na kadācana // / //
analyzed: māyā śambhuḥ ca puruṣam kṣīyate na kadācana
translated: Maya, Shambhu, and Purusha - they never perish.
Arisen from the body with five faces, born from the six Kaula clans,

analyzed: teṣām pradarśitam rūpam kalādhvam kula nāyakam
translated: Their form is displayed, the path of energies, the leader of the Kula.

analyzed: sādhitaḥ ham tvayā viṣṇo niścalena antarātmanā
translated: O Vishnu, I have been accomplished by you with an unwavering inner self,

analyzed: bhāva adhiṣṭhāna yogena tena idam darśitam mayā
translated: By the yoga of the foundation of existence, therefore this has been shown by me.

original: svādhiṣṭhānaṃ paraṃ yogaṃ praviśya mama sarvathā /
analyzed: svādhiṣṭhānam param yogam praviśya mama sarvathā
translated: Having entered my supreme yoga in the foundation, in every way,

original: liṅgaṃ praviśya medhāvī yena pūjyo bhaviṣyasi // / //
analyzed: liṅgam praviśya medhāvī yena pūjyaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: Having entered the linga, the wise one by whom you will be worthy of worship.

original: iti kulālikāmnāye śrīkubjikāmate ṣaṭprakārādhikārārṇavo nāma dvādaśamaḥ paṭalaḥ
analyzed: iti kulālikāmnāye śrī kubjikāmate ṣaṭprakārādhikārārṇavaḥ nāma dvādaśamaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twelfth chapter named The Ocean of the Sixfold Authority in the venerable Kubjikamata in the tradition of the Kula of Kubjika.

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Sri Bhairava said:

original: evaṃ devi mayāsau tu pūrvaṃ cakradharaḥ sudhīḥ /
analyzed: evam devi mayā asau tu pūrvam cakradharaḥ sudhīḥ
translated: Thus, O Goddess, that very wise Cakradhara was by me in the past,

original: liṅge svādhiṣṭhito yena svādhiṣṭhānaṃ tu tena vai // / //
analyzed: liṅge sva dhiṣṭhitaḥ yena svādhiṣṭhānam tu tena vai
translated: By whom he was established in the linga, therefore it is the foundation of self.
The abode of Maya and Shambhu, the teaching of the foundation of energies,

analyzed: puruṣa aṇu samāyuktam svādhiṣṭhānam atas rthataḥ
translated: United with the Purusha and the atom, the foundation of self is thus in meaning.

original: rāgeṇa rañjitātmā vai niyatyā yo niyāmitaḥ /
analyzed: rāgeṇa rañjita ātmā vai niyatyā yaḥ niyāmitaḥ
translated: One whose self is colored by passion, who is restrained by destiny,

original: avidyāprerito gacchet svargaṃ vā svabhram eva vā // / //
analyzed: avidyā preritaḥ gacchet svargam vā svabhram eva vā
translated: Impelled by ignorance, would go to heaven or to one's own fall.

original: tritayaṃ śubham uddiṣṭam aśubhaṃ tu tathā trikam /
analyzed: tritayam śubham uddiṣṭam aśubham tu tathā trikam
translated: The triad is declared to be auspicious, and the inauspicious is also a triad.

original: ṣaṭkauṣikam idaṃ sthānaṃ vyāptibhūtaṃ mayā tava // / //
analyzed: ṣaṣ kauṣikam idam sthānam vyāpti bhūtam mayā tava
translated: This is the sixfold Kaula place, pervaded by me for you.

original: śakte yaṃ tu samākhyātaṃ śāmbhavaṃ paratottare /
analyzed: śakte yam tu samākhyātam śāmbhavam paratottare
translated: The power that has been explained to you, the Śaiva (reality) that is superior to the supreme,

analyzed: kathayiṣyāmi suśroṇi idānīm pratyayam śṛṇu
translated: O lady of beautiful hips, I will now tell you. Listen to this proof.

analyzed: sādhanam loka vikhyātam ṣaṣ siddha adhiṣṭhitam tu tat
translated: The means is well-known in the world, and that is presided over by the six accomplished ones.

original: svādhiṣṭhānaṃ tu liṅgasthaṃ yathā sthānagataṃ śṛṇu // / //
analyzed: svādhiṣṭhānam tu liṅga stham yathā sthāna gatam śṛṇu
translated: The foundation of one's own (spiritual power) is located in the Linga. Listen to how it is located in the places.

analyzed: dvis aṇḍena tanuḥ tasya chagalaṇḍa āditaḥ kramāt
translated: The body of that (Lord) is two-headed, beginning with Chagalāṇḍa in due order.

original: yatra sthāne sthitā māyā mahākāla mukhāgrataḥ // / //
analyzed: yatra sthāne sthitā māyā mahākāla mukha agratas
translated: In which place Māyā is located in front of Mahākāla,

analyzed: vālīśvaram tu randhra stham bhujaṅga maṇimastake
translated: Vālīśvara is located in the cavity, on the crest-jewel of the serpent.

original: pinākinaṃ tu sīmanyāṃ saṃsthitaṃ tu niyāmakam // / //
analyzed: pinākinam tu sīmanyām saṃsthitam tu niyāmakam
translated: The wielder of the Pināka bow is located in the seam, the controller.

analyzed: atra yogam pravakṣyāmi yoginām śubha dāyakam
translated: Here I will explain the yoga that bestows auspiciousness to the yogis.

original: yena paśyanti taṃ liṅgaṃ pūrvoktaṃ guṇaśālinam // / //
analyzed: yena paśyanti tam liṅgam pūrva uktam guṇa śālinam
translated: By that, they see the Linga, endowed with the qualities mentioned before.

analyzed: dvīpa dvīpa īśvaram nātham dvādaśa arci samanvitam
translated: The Lord of the islands and the islands, accompanied by twelve flames,

analyzed: māsa māsa avadhī kaikam abhyasantaḥ guṇān labhet
translated: Practicing one by one, from month to month, they would attain the qualities.

analyzed: yuñjantaḥ śriyam āpnoti ṣaṣ rasa āsvādanam kramāt
translated: By practicing, one attains prosperity, the experience of the six tastes in order,
Bitter, astringent, sour, alkaline, and sweet to the end.

analyzed: nātham dvīpaḥ tu dvīpa arci dvīpa ādi krama saṃyutam
translated: The Lord, the island, the island flame, accompanied by the sequence beginning with the island,

original: dhyānasthānasamāyogāt tan nāsti yan na sādhayet // / //
analyzed: dhyāna sthāna samāyogāt tat na asti yat na sādhayet
translated: By the union with the place of meditation, there is nothing that one cannot accomplish.

original: ṣaḍvaktraṃ cintyam ātmānaṃ devīṃ ca guṇalālasām /
analyzed: ṣaḍvaktram cintyam ātmānam devīm ca guṇa lālasām
translated: The six-faced self should be contemplated, and the Goddess, desirous of qualities,

analyzed: mukhena mukham ālagnam hi ātma liṅga upari sthitam
translated: With the face attached to the face, situated above the Linga of the self.
Filled with the essence of the bliss of existence, situated by the swings of play,

original: liṅgarandhraṃ tu randhrasthaṃ tena mārgeṇa cābhyaset // / //
analyzed: liṅga randhram tu randhra stham tena mārgeṇa ca abhyaset
translated: The cavity of the Linga is in the cavity, one should practice by that path.

analyzed: vidyut jyotiḥ latā ākāram vaktra maṇḍala niḥsṛtam
translated: Having the form of lightning, the light of a flame, emanating from the circle of faces,

original: tasya vai hy ātmanaḥ paścāt nit yam eva samabhyaset // / //
analyzed: tasya vai hi ātmanaḥ paścāt nid yam eva samabhyaset
translated: After that, one should practice the self-control of that very self.

analyzed: ṣaṣ māsena varārohe sphoṭayet parvatān api
translated: O beautiful lady, in six months, one can shatter even mountains.

analyzed: dvitīye kṣobhayeta vara aṅganām
translated: In the second, he, of formlessness, would agitate the excellent woman.

original: tatsthāne tiryagālokāt kiṃ tu raktāruṇena tu /
analyzed: tad sthāne tiryak ālokāt kim tu rakta aruṇena tu
translated: But by looking obliquely in that place, with red and reddish [eyes],
He would agitate the mortals, sky-walkers, Yakshas, Rakshasas, and those who move in the realm of ghosts.

analyzed: kṣobhayet dhāṭakīśasya puram sādhaka puṅgavaḥ
translated: The best of adepts would agitate the city of the Lord of Dhaki.

analyzed: tatra eva brahma yogena cakra āvartena cakṣuṣā
translated: There itself, by the yoga of Brahman, with eyes like a whirling wheel,

analyzed: karṣayet nikhilān sarvān phala puṣpa āditas kramāt
translated: He would draw in all, starting with fruits, flowers, and so on, in order.

analyzed: martya lokāt itas kṛtvā pātāla svarga saṃsthitān
translated: Starting from the mortal world, up to those dwelling in the netherworld and heaven,

original: tṛtīyena tu yogena caturthaṃ stambhane kṣamaḥ /
analyzed: tṛtīyena tu yogena caturtham stambhane kṣamaḥ
translated: By the third yoga, he is capable of paralyzing the fourth.

original: kiṃ tu pītena tattvākṣaś cakṣuṣā paripūrṇadhīḥ // / //🔽stambhayed gaganāmbhobhir vimānapavanau mahān /
analyzed: kim tu pītena tattva akṣaḥ cakṣuṣā paripūrṇa dhīḥ  stambhayet gagana ambhobhiḥ vimāna pavanau mahān
translated: But with yellow eyes, with the essence of reality, of perfect wisdom,🔽He would paralyze the great celestial chariots and winds with the waters of the sky.

analyzed: gajānām ca vāji caura ari pannagān
translated: He would paralyze the movements of elephants, horses, thieves, enemies, and snakes.

analyzed: pañcamena tu yogena tatrasthaḥ kṛṣṇa maṇḍale
translated: By the fifth yoga, dwelling there in the black circle,

original: mārayed yasya kruddho 'sau yaḥ kruddho mriyate tu saḥ // / //
analyzed: mārayet yasya kruddhaḥ sau yaḥ kruddhaḥ mriyate tu saḥ
translated: The angry one would kill whomever, and he who is angry would die.

analyzed: sa deva asura trailokyam dvipadam vā catuṣpadam
translated: He would paralyze the three worlds with gods and demons, the two-legged and the four-legged,

analyzed: caturdaśavidhasya api kruddhaḥ saṃharaṇe kṣamaḥ
translated: And is capable of destroying the fourteen kinds of anger.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭham ūrdhva param sthānam brahmadvāra iti kīrtitam
translated: The sixth upward supreme place is known as the Brahma aperture.

analyzed: aprasiddhena mārgeṇa helā dolā eka tatparaḥ
translated: Devoted solely to the swinging play through the unknown path.

analyzed: vidyut latā chaṭā āṭopam vāram vāram muhur muhur
translated: Again and again, repeatedly, with the flickering of lightning,

original: abhyased yāva yogeśi tāvad ānandatāṃ vrajet // / //
analyzed: abhyaset yogeśi tāvat ānanda tām vrajet
translated: One should practice as long as one attains the state of bliss, O Queen of Yoga.

analyzed: tyajet svābhāvikam sarvam saṃsāra patha gocaram
translated: One should abandon everything natural that is within the range of the worldly path.

analyzed: niḥsaṃjñaḥ mṛta vat yogī kāṣṭha vat upalakṣyate
translated: The yogi, unconscious like a dead person, is seen to be like a piece of wood.

original: sāttvikaṃ rājasaṃ bhāvaṃ tāmasaṃ tu yadā bhavet /
analyzed: sāttvikam rājasam bhāvam tāmasam tu yadā bhavet
translated: When the sattvika, rajasika, and tamasika states occur,

analyzed: traya avasthā gataḥ yogī pūrva liṅga samaḥ bhavet
translated: The yogi who is in the three states becomes equal to the previous signs.

original: pūjyate sa suraiḥ sarvaiḥ khecarasthair na cāparaiḥ /
analyzed: pūjyate sa suraiḥ sarvaiḥ khecara sthaiḥ na ca aparaiḥ
translated: He is worshipped by all the gods who move in the sky, not by others.

original: ṣaṭprakāram idaṃ liṅgaṃ yo jānāti sa tattvavit // / //
analyzed: ṣaṣ prakāram idam liṅgam yaḥ jānāti sa tattva vid
translated: One who knows this six-fold sign is the knower of reality.

original: etat te kathitaṃ sarvaṃ sarahasyaṃ sugopitam /
analyzed: etat te kathitam sarvam sa rahasyam su gopitam
translated: All this has been told to you, along with the secret and well-hidden.

analyzed: na deyam duṣṭa buddhīnām jñāna caureṣu śāsanam
translated: This teaching should not be given to those with evil minds, to the thieves of knowledge.

analyzed: yāvat na sarva bhāvena kāya kleśa sahāḥ narāḥ
translated: As long as men are not able to endure the hardships of the body with all their being,

original: tataś cedaṃ pradātavyam anyāyān narakaṃ vrajet // / //
analyzed: tatas ca idam pradātavyam anyāyāt narakam vrajet
translated: And then this should be given, otherwise one would go to hell.
This is the Kuleshvara Linga, the cause of creation and dissolution.

original: yo jānāti varārohe sa siddho hy atra śāsane // / //
analyzed: yaḥ jānāti varārohe sa siddhaḥ hi atra śāsane
translated: O beautiful lady, he who knows this is indeed a Siddha in this Shaiva doctrine.

original: tasmālliṅgaṃ na nindeta yāvat tāvat tanau sthitam /
analyzed: tasmāt liṅgam na nindeta yāvat tāvat tanau sthitam
translated: Therefore, one should not criticize the Linga as long as it remains in the body.

original: sarveṣāṃ vidyate hy etat kalpanā hy atra kāraṇam // / //
analyzed: sarveṣām vidyate hi etat kalpanā hi atra kāraṇam
translated: This is present in all, imagination is the cause here.

analyzed: dvipadam martya jam liṅgam raupya hema maṇi rmayam
translated: The two-footed mortal Linga is made of silver, gold, or gems.

analyzed: mantra mūrti kula īśānam āvāhya api atra ropitam
translated: Having invoked the Lord of the Kula, the embodiment of Mantra, it is installed here.

original: svādhiṣṭhānaṃ tu tat tasya pūjanāt tat padaṃ labhet /
analyzed: svādhiṣṭhānam tu tat tasya pūjanāt tat padam labhet
translated: That is its foundation, by worshipping it one would attain that state.

original: prathamaṃ na hi sarvasya sarvajñatvaṃ prapadyate // / //
analyzed: prathamam na hi sarvasya sarvajña tvam prapadyate
translated: At first, not everyone attains omniscience.

analyzed: tasmāt na nindayet liṅgam tad mūrti guṇa śālinam
translated: Therefore, one should not criticize the Linga endowed with the qualities of its form.

analyzed: sarvajña tve pi samprāpte samayān samprapālayet
translated: Even when omniscience is attained, one should observe the rules.

analyzed: tamaḥ rajaḥ praviṣṭānām ahaṅkāra vaśa anugām
translated: For those who are immersed in darkness and passion, following the influence of ego,

original: na teṣāṃ sādhanaṃ siddhir jāyate patanaṃ punaḥ // / //
analyzed: na teṣām sādhanam siddhiḥ jāyate patanam punar
translated: their means of attainment does not succeed, but rather leads to downfall.

analyzed: śrī kuleśvara devasya liṅga ādhāram śṛṇu priye
translated: O beloved, listen to the foundation of the Linga of the glorious Lord of Kula.

analyzed: vṛtta ākāram sa randhram tu caturasram prakīrtitam
translated: Round in shape with a hole, it is declared to be a square.

analyzed: tri randhra valaya ākāram śṛṅgāṭa ākṛti varcasam
translated: Having three holes and a circular shape, with the splendor of a pot,

analyzed: piṇḍikā upari liṅgasya jagadyoniḥ mahā ambike  catuṣkala samopetam catuṣpīṭha samanvitam
translated: The source of the universe, O Great Mother, above the pedestal of the linga.🔽Endowed with four parts, accompanied by four seats,

original: catuḥsiddhasamāyuktaṃ jñātvā siddhiphalapradam // / //🔽khaḍgīśaḥ prathame vṛtte jalapaṭṭe niveśitaḥ /
analyzed: catur siddha samāyuktam jñātvā siddhi phala pradam  khaḍgīśaḥ prathame vṛtte jala paṭṭe niveśitaḥ
translated: United with four accomplished ones, known to bestow the fruits of accomplishment.🔽The Lord of the Sword is placed in the first circle, on the water-cloth.

analyzed: bakaḥ ca aṅkura rūpeṇa randhra sandhau vyavasthitaḥ
translated: And the crane, in the form of a sprout, is situated in the junction of the hole.

analyzed: śvetaḥ praṇālake dvi sthaḥ pravāhe saṃvyavasthitaḥ
translated: The white one is situated in the two places in the channel, established in the flow.

analyzed: bhṛguḥ mekhala rūpeṇa samantāt parimaṇḍalam
translated: Bhrigu, in the form of the girdle, is all around, in a circular form.

analyzed: śṛṅgāṭake tu pīṭhāni khātasya agre vilakṣayet
translated: In the pot, one should observe the seats at the tip of the pit.

original: ojāpūkāmatatvaṃ tu madhyadakṣiṇavāmataḥ // / //🔽agradeśe tu koṭisthaṃ śṛṅgāṭaṃ caturasrakam /
analyzed: ojāpūka amata tvam tu madhya dakṣiṇa vāmataḥ  agra deśe tu koṭi stham śṛṅgāṭam caturasrakam
translated: The essence of Oja, Pukka, and Kama, to the right and left of the center.🔽In the front region, the pot, which is angular, is situated at the tip.

analyzed: evam ādhāram catur aṅgulam
translated: Thus, the base is four fingers, in the order of the Krittika constellation.

analyzed: tatra abhyāsam prakurvīta abhiṣeka guṇa anvitaḥ
translated: There, one should practice, endowed with the qualities of consecration.

analyzed: ājñā labdha paraḥ bhaktaḥ catur māsāt phalam labhet
translated: The devotee who has attained the highest through the command, would obtain the fruit in four months.

analyzed: jala paṭṭa gatam devam ādi pīṭha samanvitam
translated: The god residing in the water-soaked cloth, along with the primordial seat,

analyzed: śukla varṇam yadā dhyāyet śānti puṣṭi param vrajet
translated: when meditated upon as having a white color, one would go to the highest state of peace and nourishment.

analyzed: tam tyajya bakanātha ākhyam dakṣa pīṭha gatam yadā
translated: Abandoning that, when the one called the Lord of Herons resides in the right seat,

analyzed: tadā puṣṭi śriyā ārogyam pūrva abhyāsa phalam labhet
translated: then one would obtain the fruit of nourishment, prosperity, and health, as a result of previous practice.

original: śvetaṃ praṇālarandhrasthaṃ vāmapīṭhagataṃ yadā /🔽abhyaset kramayogena vaśyākarṣaṇamāraṇam // / //
analyzed: śvetam praṇāla randhra stham vāma pīṭha gatam yadā  abhyaset krama yogena vaśyā ākarṣaṇa māraṇam
translated: When the white one resides in the left seat, in the hole of the water channel,🔽one should practice the yoga of sequence for subjugation, attraction, and killing.

analyzed: roga vyādhi jayaḥ puṣṭiḥ kramāt khecara tām vrajet
translated: One would conquer diseases and ailments, be nourished, and gradually attain the state of moving in the sky.

analyzed: bhṛgum kāma samāyogāt abhyasantaḥ guṇān labhet
translated: Those who practice Bhṛgu in union with Kāma would obtain the qualities.

analyzed: śānti puṣṭi vaśa ākarṣam pura kṣobham pṛthu śriyam
translated: Peace, nourishment, subjugation, agitation of the city, great prosperity,
the destruction of wrinkles and gray hair, and the state of being the lord of speech commence.

original: sañjīvanaṃ mṛtānāṃ ca drumākṛṣṭi jalaplavam /🔽vātameghanadīnāṃ ca stambhakṛd vācahāriṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: sañjīvanam mṛtānām ca druma ākṛṣṭi jala plavam  vāta megha nadīnām ca stambha kṛt vāca hāriṇaḥ
translated: The reviving of the dead, the attraction of trees, floating on water,🔽the immobilization of wind, clouds, and rivers, and the removal of speech -

analyzed: vācā siddhiḥ prabhu tvam ca stobha kṛt parvata ādiṣu
translated: the accomplishment of speech, lordship, and the immobilization of mountains and so on,

analyzed: stambhayet sarva sainyāni ādhāra gata cetasaḥ
translated: Can paralyze all armies with a mind focused on the foundation.

original: ādhāraṃ kramam ity uktaṃ tad vinā sādhanaṃ na hi /
analyzed: ādhāram kramam iti uktam tat vinā sādhanam na hi
translated: The foundation is said to be the sequence, without which there is no means.

original: na mokṣo na ca bhuktiś ca yāvāmnāyo na veditaḥ // / //
analyzed: na mokṣaḥ na ca bhuktiḥ ca yau āmnāyaḥ na veditaḥ
translated: There is neither liberation nor enjoyment as long as the teaching is not known.

original: etad ādhāram ity uktam ājñābhedam ataḥ śṛṇu /
analyzed: etat ādhāram iti uktam ājñā bhedam atas śṛṇu
translated: This is said to be the foundation, so listen to the division of the command.

analyzed: yena vijñāta mātreṇa sarvajña tvam prapadyate
translated: By merely knowing which one attains omniscience.

original: kramaṃ śāmbhavam ity āhur yasmāt sambhavate 'khilam /
analyzed: kramam śāmbhavam iti āhuḥ yasmāt sambhavate khilam
translated: They call the sequence the Sambhava, from which everything originates.

analyzed: vācā siddheḥ tu ādhāram vācayā ājñā pravartate
translated: But the foundation is due to the ineffability of speech, the command proceeds by speech.

analyzed: śāmbhava abhyāsa mātram tu yat kramāt sampravartate
translated: But that which proceeds from the sequence merely by the practice of the Sambhava,

analyzed: atha aṇu rudra śakti sthā bhāva bhūteṣu śāmbhavā
translated: Then the Sambhava, which is in the power of the subtle Rudra, in the elements that are the abode of existence.

analyzed: adhikāra ātmikā hi eṣā viśuddhi guṇa dāyikā
translated: For it has the nature of authority, and it bestows the quality of purification.

original: na mokṣo vidyate teṣāṃ prasādājñā vivarjitā // / //
analyzed: na mokṣaḥ vidyate teṣām prasāda ājñā vivarjitā
translated: Those who are devoid of the command of grace have no liberation.

original: prasādaṃ kramam ity uktaṃ kramāj jñānaṃ tu śāmbhavam /
analyzed: prasādam kramam iti uktam kramāt jñānam tu śāmbhavam
translated: Grace is said to be the sequence, from the sequence comes the Sambhava knowledge.

analyzed: śāmbhavena samasta arthān vetti paśyati ca agratas
translated: By the Sambhava one knows and sees all things in front.

original: yadā dṛṣṭaḥ samastārtho gurutaḥ śāstrataḥ svataḥ /
analyzed: yadā dṛṣṭaḥ samasta arthaḥ gurutaḥ śāstrataḥ svatas
translated: When all things are seen from the teacher, from the scriptures, and from oneself,

original: tadāsau kramikaḥ proktaḥ kramatulyo 'thavā hi saḥ // / //
analyzed: tadā asau kramikaḥ proktaḥ krama tulyaḥ hi saḥ
translated: That is said to be sequential, or else it is equal to the sequence.

original: ājñābhyāse na muktis tu yāvāmnayo na veditaḥ /
analyzed: ājñā abhyāse na muktiḥ tu yāvān nayaḥ na veditaḥ
translated: Liberation is not attained through the practice of the Command as long as the scripture is not known.

analyzed: sa bāhya abhyantaram bhadre atas ṛtham toṣayet gurum
translated: Therefore, O auspicious one, one should please the guru for this purpose.

analyzed: sarva aṅga bhakti yuktaḥ tu tri śuddhena antarātmanā
translated: Endowed with devotion to all the limbs, with a pure inner self,

original: bhaktyā cārādhayen nāthaṃ tasya sarvaṃ prapadyate // / //
analyzed: bhaktyā ca ārādhayet nātham tasya sarvam prapadyate
translated: and with devotion, one should worship the Lord. Everything is attained by him.

original: yā bhaktiḥ sā bhavec chaktiḥ śaktyā sambhavate kramaḥ /
analyzed: yā bhaktiḥ sā bhavet śaktiḥ śaktyā sambhavate kramaḥ

analyzed: kramāt sambhavate vācā vācayā ājñā pravartate  yādṛśena tu bhāvena guru devam upāsayet

analyzed: tādṛgbhāvena tasya ājñā kiñcid ca aṃśena saṅkramet
translated: to that extent, with a part of that devotion, the Command will enter him.

analyzed: uparodha prasaṅgena ukta kālāt avāntare
translated: Due to the occurrence of obstruction, in the interval from the stated time,

analyzed: kiñcid ca ājñā bhavet tasya bhūta ūrmi guṇa saṅkulā

analyzed: paripakva phalam yadvat su svāda guṇa saṃyutam
translated: Just as a ripe fruit is endowed with the quality of good taste,

analyzed: tadvat śiṣyaḥ kālena samasta artha vidaḥ bhavet
translated: in the same way, the disciple will become one who knows everything in time.

analyzed: rasa ujjhitam na su svādam yathā amla phala bhakṣaṇam
translated: Just as eating a sour fruit devoid of juice is not very tasty,

analyzed: tathā hi apakva śiṣyāṇām vṛthā jñāna pariśramaḥ
translated: For thus, for disciples who are not ripe, there is vain toil in knowledge.

analyzed: sāmarthyena api dattā ājñā bhūta aṃśena samāviśet

analyzed: ūrmi grastaḥ hi ahaṅkārī ahaṅkārāt vinaśyati
translated: For one seized by the wave, the egoist, perishes from egoism.

analyzed: eka pakṣaḥ samākhyātaḥ sāmpratam vai dhikam śṛṇu
translated: One side has been declared. Now listen to the additional.

analyzed: sthūla mārgeṇa sūkṣma tvam kramāt evam prajāyate
translated: Coarseness gradually becomes subtlety in this way by the gross path.

original: bhedo randhraṃ tathā chidram ekā saṃjñā yaśasvini /
analyzed: bhedaḥ randhram tathā chidram ekā saṃjñā yaśasvini
translated: O illustrious lady, fissure, hole, and chidra are one name.

original: sabījāś ceti nirbījāḥ sthitibhedo dvidhā sthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa bījāḥ ca iti nirbījāḥ sthiti bhedaḥ dvidhā sthitaḥ

analyzed: kūrmānandam ca painākam mahākālam tṛtīyakam
translated: The pleasure of the tortoise, the Pinaka, and the third Mahakalam,

analyzed: krodhīśam arghiṇā yuktam vidyā ca eva dvitīyakam            praṇavam kaulikam gṛhya lakulīśāt anantaram
translated: The angry lord united with the argha, and the second is the knowledge.🔽Recollected as the Kula Vagisvari, united with the lord of the jhantis.🔽Taking the Kaulika Pranava, after Lakulesa,

analyzed: śrīkaṇṭham ca ūṣmaṇā yuktam lakulīśāt imam punar
translated: And Srikantha united with the heat, again beginning with Lakulesa,

analyzed: upadeśa samāyuktam sarva dam bhṛgura avadhim
translated: United with the teaching, the all-giving, up to Bhrigurva.
One should place it in the hole of the vajra, and contemplate up to the end of the bow.

analyzed: śloka dvādaśaka upetam cakra dvādaśaka anvitam
translated: Endowed with twelve verses and accompanied by twelve wheels,

analyzed: guru vaktra samopetam dhyātvā vācām prasādhayet
translated: Having contemplated it as united with the teacher's face, one should purify speech.

analyzed: smaraṇa mātra yogena kālakṣepaḥ na ca atra vai
translated: By the mere yoga of recollection, there should be no delay here.

original: atha ced abhyased evaṃ vajrakodaṇḍakāntaram /🔽sarvajñatvaṃ bhavet tasya kriyākhyaṃ yāva sundari // / //🔽kriyāto ' ghaṃ pravarteta vācājñāmoghaśālinī /
analyzed: atha ced abhyaset evam vajra kodaṇḍaka antaram  sarvajña tvam bhavet tasya kriyā ākhyam sundari  kriyātaḥ pravarteta vācā ājñā mogha śālinī
translated: If one practices thus, O beautiful one, between the vajra and the bow,🔽He will attain omniscience, up to the state called action.🔽From action, the syllable a should be produced, with speech possessing inexhaustible power.

original: vāgīśatvaṃ punaḥ paścād vāgīśaḥ sṛjate 'khilam // / //🔽jvalantaṃ svena tejena lakulī vāmamārgataḥ /

analyzed: sa jyeṣṭhaḥ kula santāne raudra śaktibhiḥ āvṛtaḥ
translated: He is the eldest in the Kula lineage, surrounded by fierce powers.

original: trayastriṃśatime tattve hy adhikāro layaḥ pare /
analyzed: trayastriṃśatime tattve hi adhikāraḥ layaḥ pare
translated: In the thirty-third principle, he has authority, and in the supreme (state), he dissolves.
Samvarta (is attained) alone, the lord, with seed, and seedless.

analyzed: asya randhra antara sthānam ājñādhyānam tu śāmbhavam
translated: The meditation on the command, which is the abode within the cavities of this (body), belongs to Shambhu.

original: na mantroccāraṇaṃ jñānaṃ na mudrā dhyāna cintanam // / //
analyzed: na mantra uccāraṇam jñānam na mudrā dhyāna cintanam
translated: There is no utterance of mantra, no knowledge, no meditation on mudras or thoughts,

analyzed: na āyāmaḥ na nirodhaḥ ca granthi bhedaḥ na dhāraṇā
translated: No breath control, no restraint, no breaking of knots, no retention.

analyzed: sarva upāya vihīnaḥ sau kim tu sthāna vikalpanā
translated: He is devoid of all means, but there is the option of the location.

analyzed: adhas ūrdhva roma saṃsthāne tatra bhāvam vinikṣipet

original: ūrdhvagranthir adhaḥkando madhye kiñcin na vidyate // / //
analyzed: ūrdhva granthiḥ adhas kandaḥ madhye kiñcid na vidyate
translated: The knot is above, the bulb is below, and in the middle there is nothing at all.

analyzed: tat sthānam śāmbhavam viddhi śambhu randhra upalakṣitam
translated: Know that place to be Śambhu's, characterized by Śambhu's hole.

original: na kiñcic cintayet tatra īṣadāropaṇaṃ citau // / //
analyzed: na kiñcid cintayet tatra īṣat āropaṇam citau
translated: One should not think of anything there, just a slight superimposition on the mind.

analyzed: evam saṃsmaraṇāt eva jñāna ānandam pravartate
translated: By merely remembering in this way, the bliss of knowledge arises.

analyzed: vācā mātreṇa ca anyeṣām kurute pratyayān bahūn
translated: And by mere words, he creates many convictions in others.

analyzed: sakṛt saṃsmaraṇāt evam abhyasantaḥ śriyam labhet
translated: By merely remembering once in this way, practicing, one would attain prosperity.

analyzed: vijñānāni ca sarvāṇi ṣaṣ māsa abhyāsa yogataḥ
translated: And all the cognitions, by the yoga of practice for six months.

analyzed: catustriṃśa padā īśānam vindate vatsara aṣṭakān
translated: He obtains the thirty-four places in eight years.

original: tat sthānaṃ sahajaṃ tasya saṃyogaṃ yadi tasya vai // / //🔽bhujaṅgānugrahīśena mantrayuktena tat priye /

analyzed: uccarantaḥ hanet sṛṣṭim lakulīśa anta kārakaḥ
translated: Uttering, he destroys creation, causing the cessation of Lakulīśa.

original: bhogaś cāsya hi nādānte layaḥ syād vyāpinīpade /
analyzed: bhogaḥ ca asya hi nāda ante layaḥ syāt vyāpinī pade
translated: And his enjoyment is at the end of sound, the dissolution is in the state of the all-pervading.

analyzed: ājñā bheda dvayam nāthe hi etat tat paramārthataḥ

analyzed: śakti mārga gatam viddhi śeṣaḥ nyat ca ud tare punar

analyzed: tvayā mahyam mayā tubhyam tvayā aham tvam mayā punar

analyzed: paśu pakṣi tathā vṛkṣāḥ tṛṇa gulma sarīsṛpam
translated: The animal, bird, tree, grass, bush, and reptile,

analyzed: yena varṣa sahasrāṇi bhaktyā ārādhitaḥ hi aham
translated: By whom for thousands of years I have been worshipped with devotion,

analyzed: janmani apaścime puṃsām jāyate su durlabham
translated: in the last birth of men, this is born, which is very difficult to obtain.

analyzed: cetaḥ citta vihīnānām prasaṅgāt mukti dam priye

analyzed: kim punar citta yuktānām saṅgāt eva na mukti dam  atas ṛtham saha saṃyogam khāna pānam saha āsanam
translated: how much more so for those endowed with thought, it does not give liberation through mere association.🔽For this purpose, one should not give association, eating, drinking, sitting together,

translated: clothes, garlands, and offerings that are enjoyed by oneself.

analyzed: asat saṅgam na kartavyam sat saṅgam na vivarjayet
translated: One should not associate with the wicked, but should not avoid associating with the good.

analyzed: śuddha āśaya samācāram jñāna ādhāram prapūjayet
translated: One should worship the one with pure intention and conduct, the support of knowledge.

analyzed: viśuddham kāñcanam yadvat nāga saṅgāt vinaśyati
translated: Just as pure gold is destroyed by contact with a snake,

analyzed: evam asat saṅgāt vinaśyati
translated: so too is the pure truth destroyed by association with the wicked.
Abiding in the womb of the Yoginī Kula, born from the limbs of the Kula Vīra,

analyzed: siddhaḥ sau siddha santāne ṣaṣ pāda artham sa vindati
translated: he is accomplished in the lineage of the accomplished ones and obtains the meaning of the six-footed [Vidyā].

analyzed: etat te kathitam sarvam dakṣiṇā idam sa lakṣaṇam

analyzed: śrī kubjikā uvāca
translated: The venerable Kubjikā said:

analyzed: dayā ca paramā mahyam maṇḍalīśa kulākulam
translated: I have great compassion for the Maṇḍaleśa family, which is full of Kula.

analyzed: ṣaṣ padārthaḥ mayā jñātaḥ ṣaḍ yoginyaḥ vada prabho

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: The venerable Bhairava said:

analyzed: uvāca bhagavān nāthaḥ kubjīśāni vadāmi aham
translated: The Lord, the Lord of Kubjikā, said: I will tell you, O Kubjikā.
The giver of immediate confidence, the giver of immediate union,
The goddesses Kamba, Mala, and Vika, in order, are the six in the Kulakula.

original: mokṣabhuktipradātāraḥ ṣaḍ etāḥ ṣaṭkanāyikāḥ // / //🔽ḍaralakasahajotthāḥ saṃsthitāḥ kulagocare /
analyzed: mokṣa bhukti pradātāraḥ ṣaṭ etāḥ ṣaṭka nāyikāḥ  ḍaralaka sahaja utthāḥ saṃsthitāḥ kula gocare
translated: These six are the six leaders, bestowers of liberation and enjoyment.🔽Arisen from D, Ra, La, Ka, and Sa, they abide in the domain of Kula.

analyzed: kula ṣaṭka nivāsinyaḥ nigraha anugrahe vā
translated: Dwelling in the six families, they are also in control of grace and punishment.

analyzed: ekaikā anugrahantī etāḥ nigrahanti anuloma kṛt
translated: Each of them bestows grace, and the one in the reverse order bestows punishment.
When worshipped in the six-petaled (lotus), they bestow the fruit of the six topics.

analyzed: śrī kubjikā uvāca
translated: The venerable Kubjika said:

analyzed: puratas pṛcchayiṣyāmi prārabdham kathayasva me
translated: I will ask in front. Tell me what has been begun.

analyzed: catuṣka pañcakānām ca caturṇām ca phala udayam
translated: The arising of the fruit of the four and the five.

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: The venerable Bhairava said:

translated: By the teaching of the six topics, I have told everything.

analyzed: tathā api kathayiṣyāmi adhikāraḥ yathā sthitaḥ

original: ojāpūkāmuko bhedo dṛṣṭvākṣaraviniścitam /🔽mudrācatuṣṭayopetaṃ saṅketāt kathitaṃ priye // / //
analyzed: ojāpū kāmukaḥ bhedaḥ dṛṣṭvā akṣara viniścitam  mudrā catuṣṭaya upetam saṅketāt kathitam priye
translated: The distinction of Oja, Apa, Puka, and Mukha, having seen it determined by the syllable,🔽Endowed with the four mudras, it is told by convention, O beloved.

original: caturyugaṃ catuṣpīṭhaṃ yonyaś catvāri yāḥ priye /
analyzed: catur yugam catuṣpīṭham yonyaḥ catvāri yāḥ priye
translated: The four yugas, the four seats, and the four vaginas, O beloved,

analyzed: sa bāhya abhyantare sarvam kathayāmi yathārthataḥ  nābhi adhas udara hṛd kaṇṭhe anukramāt

analyzed: ojāpū kāmarūpiṇyaḥ catvāri evam vyavasthitāḥ
translated: Below the navel, in the stomach, heart, throat, and head, the four - Oja, Pukka, Amararupa, and Kshanti - are thus arranged in order.

analyzed: catuṣkam parikīrtitam
translated: The group of four is proclaimed to be both externally and internally.

analyzed: guru upadeśa saṃyuktam pañcakam kathayāmi te
translated: I shall tell you the group of five, which is connected with the instruction of the guru.

original: devyo dūtyas tathā mātryo yoginyaḥ khecarīgaṇaḥ /
analyzed: devyaḥ dūtyaḥ tathā mātryaḥ yoginyaḥ khecarī gaṇaḥ
translated: The goddesses, messengers, mothers, yoginis, and the group of sky-wanderers -

analyzed: pañcadhā hi adhikāraḥ yam kurvanti etāḥ kulākule
translated: this authority is indeed of five kinds. They perform in the Kula and Kulakula.
The foundation of the four goddesses, the foundation of self, the abode of the six,
the hole, the flame of desire, the sphere, up to the tip of the penis and the root of the penis -

original: saptamaṃ tattvam uddiṣṭaṃ brahmaṇaḥ padam uttamam /
analyzed: saptamam tattvam uddiṣṭam brahmaṇaḥ padam uttamam
translated: the seventh principle is declared, the supreme abode of Brahman.

analyzed: atra sṛṣṭiḥ samutpannā ṣaṣ kauṣa kula sambhavā
translated: Here, creation has arisen, born from the six families.

analyzed: devyā adhiṣṭhitam īsānam sva adhiṣṭhāna guṇa āśrayam
translated: The northeast, presided over by the goddess, the abode of the qualities of the foundation of self,🔽endowed with the twelve holes, accompanied by the twelve desires -

analyzed: vahnīśvare tathā api evam dvādaśam dhvaja kandayoḥ
translated: in the same way, the twelfth is in the penis and the root of the penis.

analyzed: piṇḍa dvādaśaka upetam anekaśas
translated: along with the twelve groups, and in many ways, eighty-four.

analyzed: śāmbhava dhiṣṭhite yoge svādhiṣṭhāne nirāmaye
translated: In the yoga presided over by Shambhu, in one's own abode, free from disease,

analyzed: catura aśīti guṇānām vijñāna padavīm labhet
translated: one would attain the path of knowledge of the eighty-four qualities.

analyzed: atra madhye maheśāni sarva kāraṇa kāraṇam
translated: Here in the middle, O Mahesani, the cause of all causes,

analyzed: yathā niṣpadyate piṇḍam tat tathā ca avadhārayet
translated: one should understand how the body is formed.

analyzed: ādhāra śaktim ādau tu brahma śaktim atas ūrdhvatas
translated: First, the foundation power, and above that, the power of Brahman,

analyzed: etat brahmāṇḍam iti uktam sapta loka samanvitam
translated: this is said to be the universe, endowed with the seven worlds.

original: ādhāraṃ caiva bhūrlokaṃ bhuvarlokaṃ tu kāmagam /
analyzed: ādhāram ca eva bhūrlokam bhuvarlokam tu kāmagam
translated: The foundation is the world of earth, the world of desire is the world of Bhuvar,

original: svarlokaṃ śikhim ity uktaṃ maharlokaṃ tu golakam // / //
analyzed: svar lokam śikhim iti uktam mahar lokam tu golakam
translated: the world of heaven is said to be the flame, the world of Mahar is the sphere,

original: dhvajasthaṃ janam ity uktaṃ tapolokaṃ tu kandagam /
analyzed: dhvaja stham janam iti uktam tapolokam tu kanda gam
translated: the world of Jana is said to be on the flag, the world of Tapas is in the bulb,

analyzed: satya lokam tu tattva stham brahmagranthya avadhi sthitam
translated: the world of Satya is in the tattva, located up to the knot of Brahman.
Below the world of Satya, creation arises from the body, beginning with Kala.

analyzed: ājñātaḥ sampravartante traya antam mānasī
translated: They originate from the Ajna up to the end of the three mental worlds.

original: caturṇāṃ tu punaḥ sṛṣṭir adhastād yonisambhavā /
analyzed: caturṇām tu punar sṛṣṭiḥ adhastāt yoni sambhavā
translated: Again, the creation of the four is below, born from the womb.

analyzed: madhya manthāna yogena śubha aśubha nibandhanam
translated: The bondage of good and bad is by the yoga of the middle churning.

analyzed: bhuvarlokāt adhas loke vividhā sṛṣṭiḥ pravartate
translated: From the world of Bhuvar, below, various creation proceeds in the world.

analyzed: jarāyu jā ca sā jñeyā bahu duḥkha samākulā
translated: And that should be known as born from the womb, full of much suffering.

original: kandāt sañjāyate sṛṣṭiḥ kandaṃ vai saptalaukikam /
analyzed: kandāt sañjāyate sṛṣṭiḥ kandam vai sapta laukikam
translated: Creation arises from the bulb, and the bulb is the sevenfold world.

original: randhrādau granthiparyantaṃ vijñeyaṃ saptadhātukam // / //🔽kandāt sañjāyate 'ṅkuraḥ aṅkurān mūlasambhavaḥ /
analyzed: randhra ādau granthi paryantam vijñeyam sapta dhātukam  kandāt sañjāyate ṅkuraḥ aṅkurāt mūla sambhavaḥ

analyzed: mūlāt parṇa latā śākhāḥ tatas puṣpa phala ādikam
translated: From the root, leaves, creepers, branches, and then flowers, fruits, etc.

analyzed: pasyate rūpabhṛt sarvam sūkṣma sūkṣma aṇavaḥ hradam
translated: The bearer of form sees the entire subtle, subtle lake,

analyzed: rūpam anyat varārohe śṛṇuṣva karaṇa ātmakam
translated: Another form, O beautiful lady, listen to the one consisting of the instruments,

analyzed: yena sādhayate rūpam khecara ādim anukramāt
translated: By which one accomplishes form, the sky-wanderers and so on, in due order.

analyzed: sarva sādhāraṇam devi na bhavati a phala pradam
translated: O Goddess, it is not common to all, and does not give fruitless results.

analyzed: yāvat na tad prasādena guru ajñātaḥ pravartate
translated: Until one does not engage in it by the Guru's command through his grace.

original: śubhe 'hani muhūrte vā śiṣyam ekāntato nayet /
analyzed: śubhe hani muhūrte vā śiṣyam ekāntataḥ nayet
translated: On an auspicious day or at an auspicious moment, one should lead the disciple to a secluded place.

analyzed: ājñām dattvā prapūjitvā kṛtvā maṇḍalaka ādikam
translated: Having given the command, having worshipped, having made the maṇḍala and so on,

analyzed: tatas upari ca saṃsthāpya nirmale gagana antare
translated: Then, having placed it above, in the clear sky,

analyzed: chāyām nirīkṣayitvā tu kaṇṭhakūpa upadeśataḥ
translated: Having examined the shadow according to the instruction of the throat cavity,

analyzed: tatas nirīkṣayet vyomam sa ākāram rūpa darśanam
translated: Then one should observe the sky, with a visible form.

analyzed: paśyate bhāskaram bimbam śiva rūpam sadāśivam
translated: One sees the orb of the sun, the form of Śiva, the auspicious Śiva.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā pātakānāṃ ca avasānaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā pātakānām ca avasānam bhaviṣyati
translated: Having seen that, the end of all sins will come.

analyzed: ṣaṣ māsa abhyāsa yogena bhūcarīṇām patiḥ bhavet
translated: By the practice of yoga for six months, one will become the lord of the earth-wanderers.

original: trirabdena tu bhūnātho hartā kartā svayaṃ prabhuḥ /
analyzed: tris abdena tu bhūnāthaḥ hartā kartā svayam prabhuḥ
translated: But by three years, one becomes the lord of the earth, the destroyer, the creator, the master oneself.

analyzed: avasthām tyajate sarvām pañca avasthā param vrajet
translated: One abandons all states and goes beyond the five states.

original: nirācāreṇa yogena tan nāsti yan na sādhayet /
analyzed: nirācāreṇa yogena tat nā asti yat na sādhayet
translated: By the yoga of non-practice, there is nothing that one cannot accomplish.

original: uktānuktaṃ tu deveśi sarvam asmāt prasādhayet // / //
analyzed: ukta anuktam tu deveśi sarvam asmāt prasādhayet
translated: O Goddess of the gods, one should accomplish everything, spoken or unspoken, from this.

original: sakṛdabhyāsayogena māse vā tv ayane 'pi vā /
analyzed: sakṛt abhyāsa yogena māse vā tu ayane vā
translated: By the yoga of practice once, in a month or even in a year,

original: vindate hy āgataṃ kālam āpado vātmanaḥ pare // / //
analyzed: vindate hi āgatam kālam āpadaḥ vā ātmanaḥ pare
translated: One finds the time that has come and the dangers for oneself and others.

original: kṛṣṇavarṇena devena ṣaṇmāsān mriyate dhruvam /🔽vaktramūrdhni bhayaṃ vindyān mūrdhni pātān mriyed dhruvam // / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇa varṇena devena ṣaṣ māsāt mriyate dhruvam  vaktra mūrdhni bhayam vindyāt mūrdhni pātāt mriyet dhruvam
translated: By the black-colored god, one certainly dies in six months.🔽One should know danger in the face and head; if there is a fall on the head, one certainly dies.

original: lohite brahmahatyā tu pīte vyādhibhayaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: lohite brahma hatyā tu pīte vyādhi bhayam bhavet
translated: In red, there is the sin of Brahmanicide; in yellow, there is the danger of disease.

analyzed: pādau yatra na dṛśyete videśa gamanam bhavet  ūru mārge bhavet rogam guhye vai naśyate priyā
translated: Where the feet are not seen, there will be going to a foreign land.🔽In the path of the thighs, there is a disease; in the genitals, the beloved perishes.

original: udare arthanāśaṃ tu hṛdaye mṛtyubhāg bhavet // / //
analyzed: udare artha nāśam tu hṛdaye mṛtyu bhāj bhavet
translated: In the belly, there is loss of wealth; in the heart, one will certainly die.

original: bhujahīne pated bandhur vāme bhāryābhayaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: bhuja hīne patet bandhuḥ vāme bhāryā bhayam bhavet
translated: In the absence of arms, a relative will fall; on the left, there is danger to the wife.

original: ṣaṇmāsāllakṣayet sarvam ātmanaś ca parasya vā // / //
analyzed: ṣaṣ māsāt lakṣayet sarvam ātmanaḥ ca parasya vā
translated: One should observe all, of oneself or of another, in six months.

original: upadeśena deveśi śeṣaṃ ca guravānanāt /🔽rūpapūrṇahradāntastho rūpastho nirapekṣadhīḥ // / //
analyzed: upadeśena deveśi śeṣam ca gurave ānanāt  rūpa pūrṇa hrada anta sthaḥ rūpa sthaḥ nirapekṣa dhīḥ

analyzed: sūkṣma sūkṣmānta rūpeṇa rūpa atīta padam vrajet
translated: By the form of the subtlest of the subtle, one goes to the state beyond form.

analyzed: yoga siddhāḥ mahādevi dṛśyante vyomagā gaṇāḥ
translated: O Great Goddess, the groups of yogis who have attained perfection are seen moving through the sky.

original: bindurūpās tu te sarve kvacid dṛśyanti na kvacit /
analyzed: bindu rūpāḥ tu te sarve kvacid dṛśyanti na kvacid
translated: All of them are in the form of the bindu, sometimes visible, sometimes not.

analyzed: ghaṭa ādhāra gatam prāṇam kūrmayantreṇa pīḍayet
translated: One should press the prana located in the base of the vessel with the tortoise lock.

original: nocchvasen māsam ekaṃ tu tathyaṃ bhairavamabravīt /
analyzed: na ucchvaset māsam ekam tu tathyam bhairavam abravīt
translated: One should not breathe for one month. This is the truth Bhairava has said.

analyzed: bhairavā uvāca kalyāṇi kula rūpam prakāśitam

analyzed: akulam vyāpakam rūpam su sūkṣmam śṛṇu sāmpratam

analyzed: eka aneka vibhāgena saṃsthitā vyoma mālinī
translated: The garland of the sky abides in the form of one and many.
Residing in the middle of the ocean of nectar, moving in the sky, the carrier of the sky,

analyzed: icchā rūpa dharā devī kubjinī iti kujā ambikā
translated: The goddess who assumes the form of desire, Kubjini, the mother of Kaja,

analyzed: dvi bhujā eka mukhī devī atha aneka bhuja ānanā
translated: The goddess with two arms and one face, and then with many arms and faces,🔽Residing in the sky, in the middle of the sky, with a body of the sky, the goddess of motion,

analyzed: candragarbhasya caryā iyam cāravī caṇḍacaṇḍikā
translated: This is the conduct of the one with the moon in the womb, the moving one, the fierce and fierce goddess.

analyzed: pīṭha madhya gatā pūjyā candra garbha samanvitā

analyzed: ṣoḍaśa araka madhya sthā caturvarga phala udayā
translated: Residing in the middle of the sixteen-petaled lotus, the source of the fruits of the four goals,
Along with the seats and seat-lords, all-knowing, all-giving.

analyzed: ājñā avabodha jananī divya rūpa prakāśinī
translated: The mother of the understanding of the Command, revealing the divine form,

analyzed: asyāḥ pragopitam rūpam yoginībhiḥ varānane
translated: The concealed form of this, O excellent-faced one, by the Yoginis,

analyzed: tena rūpavatānām tu rūpa vyāptiḥ na sidhyati

analyzed: dedīpyantī mahā ānandā sahasra āditya varcasā
translated: Shining with great bliss, with the radiance of a thousand suns,

analyzed: sphurantī mālikā divyā ājñātaḥ sampravartate

Always rising, always blissful, bestowing supreme bliss,

analyzed: kalā atītam tu kāla antam ājñā rūpa ujjvalam param
translated: Beyond the energies, beyond time, the supreme brilliant form of the Command,

analyzed: anantam sakalam jñānam divya ājñā parama ujjvalam
translated: Infinite, complete knowledge, supremely brilliant with the divine Command,

analyzed: uttarasya ca ṣaṭkasya rūpa idam para sambhavam
translated: This is the supreme form of the northern group of six.

analyzed: dakṣiṇasya api ṣaṭkasya śakti yuktasya varṇitam
translated: It is described as endowed with power of the southern group of six as well,

analyzed: sthūla rūpam varārohe sarvatra eva prakāśitam
translated: The gross form, O beautiful lady, is revealed everywhere.

analyzed: uttaram gopitam rūpam devatābhiḥ su siddhi dam
translated: The concealed form of the north, which bestows excellent success by the deities,

analyzed: kasmāt sidhyati śīghra idam anyatra kṣapaṇa ākulam

analyzed: bhairaveṇa tu rūpeṇa bhairava tvam prasādhayet
translated: One should accomplish the state of Bhairava with the form of Bhairava.

analyzed: vighna jāla ujjhitam hi etat tena idam śīghra siddhi dam
translated: This is free from the net of obstacles, therefore it grants quick accomplishment.

analyzed: atra rūpa samālabdhaḥ pūrva uktam labhate phalam
translated: One who is anointed with this form obtains the previously mentioned result.

analyzed: akula krama mārgeṇa ājñā yogena sarvathā
translated: By the path of the Akula Krama and the yoga of the Command in every way,

analyzed: akulīna krama anta sthaḥ kubjīśa padam āśritaḥ
translated: Dwelling in the end of the Akula Kula Krama, resorting to the state of Kubjisa,

analyzed: prāpyate bhairava ānandam samasta ānanda pūrvakam

analyzed: mauktika āvali sādṛśyam sita raktam tu pīta gam
translated: Resembling a pearl necklace, white, red, and yellow,

analyzed: sarvam eva na paśyeta sadyam eva vinaśyati
translated: If one does not see everything at all, one perishes immediately.

analyzed: bhrū madhya gatam ātmānam ṣaḍaṅgena mahāmate
translated: The Self located between the eyebrows, O greatly wise one, with the six limbs,

translated: The image is seen like the sun, directly in front,🔽In a short blue one, one should know fear, in a long thick one, good health,

analyzed: dhūmre uccāṭanam proktam rakte rogam varānane
translated: In a smoky one, uprooting is said, in a red one, disease, O beautiful-faced one.

analyzed: kṛṣṇe brahma vināśam vā mṛtyuḥ eva abhijāyate
translated: In a black one, destruction of the Vedas or death itself is born,

original: samale tu tathā hānir nīlamāle tathāpadaḥ /
analyzed: sa male tu tathā hāniḥ nīla māle tathā āpadaḥ
translated: In a mixed one, likewise loss, in a blue garland, likewise misfortune.

analyzed: vāyavyām tu yadā dhūmrām mālām pasyati yoga vid
translated: When the knower of yoga sees a smoky garland in the northwest,

analyzed: tadā uccāṭanam devi nairṛtyām daṃṣṭriṇaḥ bhayam
translated: Then, O Goddess, uprooting, in the southwest, danger from fanged creatures.

analyzed: āgneyyām tu yadā bhinnām mālām paśyati yoga vid
translated: When the knower of yoga sees a broken garland in the southeast,

analyzed: deśa bhraṃśaḥ gni dāhaḥ ca rājā ca eva vinaśyati
translated: Loss of country, burning by fire, and the king is destroyed.

analyzed: madhye tasya yadā chidram paśyate yoga cintakaḥ
translated: When the meditator on yoga sees a hole in the middle of it,

analyzed: mṛtyuḥ tasya varārohe divasaiḥ daśabhiḥ bhavet
translated: O beautiful lady, death will come to him in ten days.

analyzed: īśāne sthāvara bhayam kauberyām artha siddhi dam
