analyzed: aindryām vai sthāna lābham ca vāruṇyām sukham edhate
translated: In the east, one attains a place; in the west, happiness increases.

analyzed: yāmyāyām mriyate devi na atra kārya vicāraṇāt
translated: In the south, one dies, O Goddess, there is no doubt about this.

analyzed: sampūrṇam su samam pītam snigdham rūkṣa tva varjitam
translated: Complete, well-proportioned, yellow, glossy, free from roughness,

analyzed: sāmalam siddhi dam proktam jīvādityam varānane
translated: Possessing nectar, it is said to bestow accomplishments, O beautiful-faced one.

analyzed: śrīmat kubjimate sarvam saṃsphuṭam kathitam tava
translated: In the venerable Kubjikamata, everything is clearly stated to you.

original: mālinī vyomasaṃsthā ca bindur vyome tathaiva ca // / //
analyzed: mālinī vyoma saṃsthā ca binduḥ vyome tathā eva ca
translated: Mālinī is situated in the sky, and the Point is also in the sky.

original: kulākhyaṃ puruṣaṃ vyome rūpātītam ataḥ śṛṇu // / //
analyzed: kula ākhyam puruṣam vyome rūpa atītam atas śṛṇu
translated: Listen to the Kula-named Puruṣa beyond form, situated in the sky.

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Śrī Bhairava said:

analyzed: ūcuḥ tu evam punar bhadre rūpa atītasya nirṇayam
translated: They spoke thus again, O good one, about the determination of what is beyond form.

analyzed: śṛṇuṣva sarva bhāvena avajñā rahitā satī
translated: Listen with all your being, O faithful one, free from contempt.

analyzed: amanaskam manaḥ tītam bhāva abhāva vivarjitam  laya uccāra vinirmuktam hetu tarka vivarjitam
translated: Beyond the mind, free from existence and non-existence,🔽Free from dissolution and utterance, devoid of reasoning and cause.

analyzed: heya upāya vinirmuktam śruti dṛṣṭānta varjitam
translated: Free from what is to be abandoned and the means, devoid of scriptural examples,

analyzed: nāstikya bhāva sampannam śūnya bhūtam anāmayam
translated: Endowed with the state of non-existence, empty, free from disease.
Beyond the yoga of the garland of objects of knowledge, the transcendent Lord.

original: atīndriyam anābhāṣaṃ parākāśaṃ tu tad viduḥ // / //
analyzed: atīndriyam an ābhāṣam para ākāśam tu tat viduḥ
translated: That which is beyond the senses, inexpressible, and the supreme space, they know it.

original: tasyopāyam idaṃ sarvaṃ yogamārgakriyādhvaram /🔽sādhyate yena mārgeṇa rūpātītaṃ tu tac chṛṇu // / //
analyzed: tasya upāyam idam sarvam yoga mārga kriyā adhvaram  sādhyate yena mārgeṇa rūpātītam tu tat śṛṇu
translated: This entire path of yoga, the sacrifice of action, is the means to that.🔽By which path the form-transcending is accomplished, listen to that...

original: vyomaṃ kṛtvā samākāśe sa saṃsmṛtya vilāpayet /
analyzed: vyomam kṛtvā sama ākāśe sa saṃsmṛtya vilāpayet
translated: Having made the sky in the space of the mind, he should recollect and dissolve it.

original: asmin taṃ tu cidākāśe bāhyākāśe sa eva hi // / //🔽parākāśe pare sthāne yānākāśam atordhvataḥ /
analyzed: asmin tam tu cit ākāśe bāhya ākāśe saḥ eva hi  para ākāśe pare sthāne yāna ākāśam atas ūrdhvatas
translated: In this sky of consciousness, in the external sky, he alone...🔽In the supreme space, in the supreme place, the space of the vehicle is above that.

original: rūpātītaṃ tataś cordhve niḥsandigdhaṃ padaṃ pare // / //
analyzed: rūpātītam tatas ca ūrdhve niḥsandigdham padam pare
translated: Above that, beyond form, is the supreme state, free from doubt...

analyzed: bahunā uktena kim devi pūrvam vyāvarṇitam maya
translated: O Goddess, what is the use of speaking much? It has been described by me before.

original: guror asya prasādena labhyate paramaṃ padam // / //
analyzed: guroḥ asya prasādena labhyate paramam padam
translated: The supreme state is attained by the grace of this Guru...

analyzed: pūrvam vyāvarṇitam tubhyam adṛṣṭa guṇa lakṣaṇam
translated: The unseen qualities and characteristics have been described to you before.

analyzed: etat sarvam samākhyātam śāmbhavasya guṇa āspadam
translated: All this has been explained, the abode of the qualities of Shambhu...

analyzed: nirācāreṇa mārgeṇa śāmbhavam tu samabhyaset
translated: One should practice Shambhu through the path of non-action.

original: kim abhyāsaḥ punas tasya yasya sarvaṃ puraḥsaram // / //
analyzed: kim abhyāsaḥ punar tasya yasya sarvam puraḥsaram
translated: What is the practice again of him who has everything in front of him?

analyzed: yasya sambhavitam śambhum ananta guṇa dāyakam
translated: Of him who has attained Shambhu, the giver of infinite qualities...

analyzed: yoga ātmā vai sa sarvatra pūjyate yoginī kule
translated: The one with the soul of yoga is worshipped everywhere in the family of yoginis.

analyzed: yadi śambhu vidheḥ bhaktaḥ saṃsāre virata ātmanaḥ
translated: If one is a devotee of Shambhu, detached from the world,

analyzed: sa sādhayati sarvajñaḥ dehena anena sarva gaḥ
translated: that omniscient one, all-pervading, accomplishes (everything) with this body.

original: na dhyānaṃ na japaḥ pūjā maṇḍalādiprapūjanam /
analyzed: na dhyānam na japaḥ pūjā maṇḍala ādi prapūjanam
translated: There is no meditation, no japa, no worship, no worship of the mandala and other things,

analyzed: nirācāra vidhānena dehena anena bhairavi
translated: O Bhairavi, by this body according to the injunction of non-conduct.

analyzed: ātmānam pūjayet nityam yathālabdha upajīvakaḥ
translated: One should always worship the Self, living on whatever is obtained,

original: agnivat sarvavarṇeṣu sa śīghraṃ phalabhāg bhavet // / //
analyzed: agni vat sarva varṇeṣu sa śīghram phala bhāj bhavet
translated: like fire among all the castes, he would quickly attain the fruits.

original: prākṛtām adhamāṃ siddhiṃ madhyamāṃ cottamāṃ ca yām /
analyzed: prākṛtām adhamām siddhim madhyamām ca uttamām ca yām
translated: The inferior, middling, and excellent accomplishments,

original: uttamottamatāṃ yānti ṣaḍbhir māsaiḥ kramāt kramāt // / //
analyzed: uttama uttama tām yānti ṣaḍbhiḥ māsaiḥ kramāt kramāt

It gives everything, exists at all times, and has the nature of immortality.

analyzed: gopitam sarva tantreṣu dvīpa āmnāyena gopitam
translated: It is concealed in all tantras, concealed by the Dvipa tradition.

analyzed: dvīpa akṣaram tathā vāram tithi nakṣatra saṃyutam
translated: The Dvipa syllable, the number of times, along with the lunar date and constellation,

analyzed: sādhaka akṣara saṃyuktam mantram etat sura arcitam
translated: The mantra, worshipped by the gods, is endowed with the syllables of the practitioner.

analyzed: pīṭha yuktam prameyena bhidya pīṭhena ca itaram
translated: Endowed with the sacred seat, it is divided by the knowable, and the other by the sacred seat.

original: daśamekādaśenaiva kūṭasthaṃ vā samekataḥ /🔽purasyādyakṣaraṃ vāpi svasthāne kṣobhakṛd bhavet // / //
analyzed: daśam ekādaśena eva kūṭastham vā sam ekataḥ                bhavet
translated: By the tenth and eleventh, it is either fixed or equal.🔽Or the first syllable of the city, in its own place, will cause agitation.

original: sarvasyāpi hi kṣetrasya praveśe japam ārabhet /
analyzed: sarvasya api hi kṣetrasya praveśe japam ārabhet
translated: One should begin the recitation upon entering any sacred place.

analyzed: sva sthāna ātmaka mantreṇa sva sthānena puram viśet
translated: One should enter the city with one's own mantra and one's own place.

analyzed: diśām ālokya japtavyam sapta vāra avadhi priye
translated: O beloved, one should recite the mantra while looking at the directions, up to seven times.

original: tāvat kṣubhyati tat kṣetraṃ bālavṛddhayuvān api // / //🔽sthitir vai yatra mantavyā tatraiva vidhim ācaret /
analyzed: tāvat kṣubhyati tat kṣetram bāla vṛddha yuvān api  sthitiḥ vai yatra mantavyā tatra eva vidhim ācaret
translated: To that extent, that sacred place becomes agitated, even the children, the old, and the young.🔽One should perform the ritual only where one intends to stay.

original: sakṛd anyatra coccāraṃ japamānaṃ puraṃ viśet // / //
analyzed: sakṛt anyatra ca uccāram japamānam puram viśet
translated: Reciting the mantra once elsewhere, one should enter the city while reciting.

analyzed: tatra anna pāna śayanam kiñcid duḥkham na jāyate
translated: There, food, drink, and bedding - any suffering does not arise.

analyzed: yaḥ punar sarva bhāvena bhakti yuktaḥ samabhyaset
translated: He who again practices with all his being, endowed with devotion,

analyzed: dvīpa sthānam samāsthāya sva iṣṭa mantrasya sādhayet
translated: Having resorted to the island place, he should accomplish his desired mantra.

original: tatrāpi tasya siddhīni bhavanty aṣṭavidhā priye // / //
analyzed: tatra api tasya siddhīni bhavanti aṣṭavidhā priye
translated: Even there, O beloved, his accomplishments become of eight kinds.

analyzed: dvīpa adhipam a jānantaḥ varṣa pūrṇa śatena vā
translated: Not knowing the lord of the island, even after a full hundred years,

original: tathāpi na hi sidhyanti yogād dhyānāc ca mantriṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: tathā api na hi sidhyanti yogāt dhyānāt ca mantriṇaḥ
translated: Still the mantra-reciters do not attain success through yoga and meditation.

analyzed: pīṭha adhipatayaḥ proktāḥ ṣoḍaśa eva varānane
translated: The lords of the sacred seats are said to be only sixteen, O beautiful-faced one.

original: tais tu vyāptam idaṃ sarvaṃ catustriṃśāntagocaram // / //
analyzed: taiḥ tu vyāptam idam sarvam catustriṃśa anta gocaram
translated: By them, this entire range up to thirty-four is pervaded.

analyzed: dvīpa adhipatayaḥ proktāḥ catustriṃśati kevalāḥ
translated: The lords of the islands are said to be only thirty-four.

original: pīṭhādhipatibhir yuktāḥ pañcāśa patayas tu te // / //🔽ādyantasaṃsthitaṃ bhadre madhye liṅgasya lakṣayet /
analyzed: pīṭha adhipatibhiḥ yuktāḥ pañcāśa patayaḥ tu te  ādi anta saṃsthitam bhadre madhye liṅgasya lakṣayet
translated: When united with the lords of the sacred seats, they are fifty lords.🔽O good one, one should observe what is at the beginning and end, in the middle of the linga.

analyzed: pīṭha grāma purasya api lakṣayitvā nirākulam
translated: Having observed the sacred seat, village, and city without confusion,

original: pālakasyākṣaraṃ yatra yad idaṃ na tad ādimam /
analyzed: pālakasya akṣaram yatra yat idam na tat ādimam
translated: Wherever there is the syllable of the protector, this is not the beginning.

original: kasmāt pīṭheṣu adhipāḥ pīṭhabhinnaṃ na pūjayet // / //
analyzed: kasmāt pīṭheṣu adhipāḥ pīṭha bhinnam na pūjayet
translated: Why do the lords of the sacred seats not worship what is different from the sacred seats?

original: na guruṃ nādimaṃ cāntaṃ na madhyaṃ pīṭhasaṃyutam /
analyzed: na gurum na ādimam ca antam na madhyam pīṭha saṃyutam
translated: Not the beginning, not the end, not the middle, not the seat-associated,

original: kevalaṃ yadi labhyeta tadādyaṃ tu surārcite // / //
analyzed: kevalam yadi labhyeta tat ādyam tu sura arcite
translated: If only that can be obtained, then that is the beginning, O Goddess worshipped by the gods.

analyzed: liṅga saṃjñā tu nāmasya sarvatas adhipāvṛtam
translated: The name of the Linga is completely surrounded by all.

original: tasmād ekatamaṃ gṛhya liṅgamūlaṃ yad akṣaram // / //
analyzed: tasmāt ekatamam gṛhya liṅga mūlam yat akṣaram
translated: Therefore, taking one of them, the syllable at the root of the Linga,

original: taṃ tu gṛhya vikalpena madhyāntaṃ varjayet priye /
analyzed: tam tu gṛhya vikalpena madhya antam varjayet priye
translated: Taking that, one should avoid the middle and end through option, O beloved.

original: evaṃ jñātvā tataḥ siddhir jāyate nirvikalpataḥ // / //
analyzed: evam jñātvā tatas siddhiḥ jāyate nirvikalpataḥ
translated: Having known thus, success arises without doubt.

original: avijñāya na pūjyetāṃ yas tu kurvīta sādhanam /
analyzed: a vijñāya na pūjyetām yaḥ tu kurvīta sādhanam
translated: One who does not know should not worship, but should perform the means.

original: mama tulyās tu kurvanti vighnaṃ vai pālakāḥ priye // / //
analyzed: mama tulyāḥ tu kurvanti vighnam vai pālakāḥ priye
translated: O beloved, the guardians create obstacles, as if equal to me.

original: atra sārataraṃ proktaṃ niścayam adhipān prati /
analyzed: atra sārataram proktam niścayam adhipān prati
translated: Here, the essence is said to be the certainty regarding the overlords.

analyzed: śrutam devi tvayā sarvam nāma pañcāśakeṣu api
translated: O Goddess, you have heard everything, even in the fifty names.

analyzed: tantre sūcitaḥ pi asya nirṇayaḥ
translated: The determination of this is indicated in the Aghoryaḍamara Tantra.

analyzed: saṃsphuṭam sarva bhāvena nirṇītam kubjinīmate
translated: It is determined in the Kubjīmatī view, with all things clearly manifested.

analyzed: śrī kubjikā uvāca
translated: Śrī Kubjikā said:

analyzed: kva sthāne saṃsthitāḥ devaḥ etat ācakṣva niścayam
translated: In which place are you situated, O God? Please tell this with certainty.

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Bhairava said:

analyzed: śṛṇu devi yathā dehe pīṭhaiḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ śiraḥ

analyzed: grīvā adhas vā aṃśa mārgeṇa kanda ūrdhvam saṃsthitam

analyzed: pañca dvīpāni deveśi brahmaṇya dhiṣṭhitāni tu

analyzed: pañca na abhigatāḥ bhadre māheśya alaṅkṛtāḥ tu te  jaṭhare pañca vaiṣṇavyā kaumārī eva hṛdi sthitā

analyzed: catur dvīpa samāyuktā cāmuṇḍā tu bhruvā uttare
translated: Chamunda, along with the four islands, is above the eyebrows.

analyzed: mahākālī tu kopa sthā saṃhāra patha vartiṇī
translated: Mahakali, in a wrathful state, is on the path of destruction.

analyzed: devyā adhiṣṭhāna dvīpeṣu yaḥ yatra anta vyavasthitaḥ
translated: In the sacred seats of the Goddess, he who is situated at the end of each,
Dandadhari, Prachanda, Dantali, and Vajratu

original: trijaṭī śaṅkhatuṇḍaś ca kapālī triśiras tathā /
analyzed: trijaṭī śaṅkhatuṇḍaḥ ca kapālī triśiraḥ tathā
translated: Trijat, Shankhatunda, Kapali, and Trishira -

analyzed: ete varga adhipāḥ proktāḥ aṣṭau vasu mahā balāḥ

analyzed: sa bāhya abhyantaram matvā sau siddhi bhājanaḥ
translated: Considering it to be with the external and internal, then he becomes a vessel of accomplishments.

analyzed: eṣa devi samāsena dvīpa āmnāyaḥ prakāśitaḥ
translated: O Goddess, this is the concise revelation of the islands.

original: śeṣo 'nyo vistaro 'py asya kulasāre vadāmy aham // / //
analyzed: śeṣaḥ asya kula sāre vadāmi aham
translated: The rest and the details of this, I will speak in the Kula essence.

analyzed: vijñāne ṛddhi sampannam jñāna maṇḍala pūritam
translated: Endowed with knowledge and spiritual power, filled with the orb of knowledge,

analyzed: tena idam śrī matam proktam bhukti mukti pradāyakam

analyzed: jñātena tantrasāreṇa anuṣṭhānam vinā priye
translated: O Beloved, without the practice of the essence of Tantra known by the wise one,

analyzed: bhājanaḥ bhukti muktīnām yadi evam gopayet sudhīḥ
translated: If the wise one thus conceals, he is a vessel of enjoyment and liberation.

analyzed: śrī matena vinā yuktāḥ khaṇḍa jñāna vimohitāḥ
translated: Those who are not endowed with the Shrimata, deluded by fragmentary knowledge,

original: hastyandhavad vibhajyante dṛṣtihīnā yatas tu te // / //
analyzed: hasti andha vat vibhajyante dṛṣti hīnāḥ yatas tu te
translated: They are like blind men dividing an elephant, because they lack vision.

original: āgataṃ tu gajaṃ śrutvā andhavṛndena sau vṛtaḥ /
analyzed: āgatam tu gajam śrutvā andha vṛndena sau vṛtaḥ
translated: Having heard the elephant that has come, he is surrounded by the multitude of blind men.

analyzed: puccha karṇa aṅghri hastābhyām pṛṣṭha kukṣa udareṣu ca
translated: By the tail, ears, feet, hands, back, belly, and chest.

original: yena yatra gajaḥ spṛṣṭas tadbhāvas tena mantritaḥ /
analyzed: yena yatra gajaḥ spṛṣṭaḥ tad bhāvaḥ tena mantritaḥ
translated: By whom and where the elephant was touched, that state was thought by him.

original: pucchahastā vadanty evaṃ gajo 'yaṃ cāmarākṛtiḥ // / //🔽karṇalagnās tu sūrpeva pādalagnokhalaṃ yathā /🔽bhittirūpaṃ tu kukṣisthā pṛṣṭhasthā gṛharūpiṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: puccha hastāḥ vadanti evam gajaḥ yam cāmara ākṛtiḥ  karṇa lagnāḥ tu sūrpā iva pāda lagna ukhalam yathā  bhitti rūpam tu kukṣi sthā pṛṣṭha sthāḥ gṛha rūpiṇaḥ
translated: The tail-holders and hand-holders spoke thus: This elephant has the form of a yak-tail.🔽Those attached to the ears are like a winnowing basket, those attached to the feet are like a threshing floor.🔽Those in the belly are of the form of a wall, those on the back are of the form of a house.

analyzed: stambha ubhau hasta lagnau tu muṣalau danti danta gau
translated: The two at the trunk are like pillars, those on the tusks of the elephant are like pestles.

original: evam andhaganā mūḍhā anyonyaṃ spardhayanti te // / //
analyzed: evam andhaganāḥ mūḍhāḥ anyonyam spardhayanti te
translated: Thus the blind people, being deluded, compete with each other.

original: anyaiś cakṣuryutais tv evaṃ yudhyamānāḥ parasparam /
analyzed: anyaiḥ cakṣuḥ yutaiḥ tu evam yudhyamānāḥ parasparam
translated: And others, endowed with eyes, thus fight with each other.

analyzed: tān dṛṣṭvā hāsyam ārabdham tam śrutvā vismitāḥ tu te

analyzed: atha śrutvā mahā hāsyam kimartham hasitāḥ vayam

analyzed: ūcuḥ tu eva akṣi yuktena mā yudhya evam vimohitāḥ

analyzed: hastinaḥ u ṅgāni sarvāṇi yāni spṛṣṭāni tad paraiḥ
translated: All the parts of the elephant that were touched by others

analyzed: paṭala antaritā dṛṣṭiḥ gatvā vaidyam upāśrayet
translated: The sight obstructed by the intervening skin should go and resort to a physician.

analyzed: yena paśyasi sarva aṅgam śrī kubja ogha mahā gajam

analyzed: gajaḥ yathā andha vṛndasya tathā jñānam pravartate

analyzed: ājñā kramam vinā lokaḥ tad kramam kubjinīmate

analyzed: kathitam niravadyam te gajasya avayavaḥ yathā
translated: The faultless has been told to you, like the parts of an elephant.

analyzed: gaja aṅga nyāyataḥ yatra dakṣa vāma ūrdhva kaulike
translated: Where, by the logic of the elephant's parts, in the Kaula of the right, left, and above,

analyzed: sarvam sampāditam tubhyam ājñā ānanda kula arṇavam
translated: The ocean of the bliss of the Command has been accomplished for you.

analyzed: idānīm śṛṇu kalyāṇi kālacakram yathā sthitam
translated: Now listen, O fortunate one, to the wheel of time as it is situated.

original: iti kulālikāmnāye śrīkubjikāmate candradvīpāvatāro nāma viṃśatimaḥ paṭalaḥ
analyzed: iti kulālikāmnāye śrī kubjikāmate candradvīpāvatāraḥ nāma viṃśatimaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twentieth chapter named the Descent to the Island of the Moon in the venerable Kubjikāmata of the Tradition of the Mother.

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Sri Bhairava said:

analyzed: lakṣa ācāra manaḥ rūpāḥ śaktayaḥ vīrya saṃsthitāḥ

analyzed: rudra śakti samāveśāḥ tābhiḥ ātma nibṛṃhaṇam
translated: They are pervaded by the power of Rudra, and by them, the self is nourished.🔽By the union with the consciousness of Shiva, the consciousness of Shakti is nourished.
By the union with the consciousness of Shakti, the consciousness of the individual soul is nourished.
By the union with the consciousness of the individual soul, the consciousness of the mantra is nourished.
By the union of the consciousness of mantra, the consciousness of the body is enhanced.
By the union of the consciousness of the body, the external conduct is enhanced.

analyzed: caitanyena vinā sarvam asvatantram śilā ādi vat
translated: Without consciousness, everything is not independent, like a stone, etc.

analyzed: niṣkriyam cetanā hīnam mṛta deha upamam priye
translated: O Beloved, it is inactive and devoid of consciousness, like a dead body.
By the union of the consciousness of fire, even water is burning here.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena vidyā vīrya cit ātmakam
translated: Therefore, by all means, one should worship the Vidyā, the essence of the power of consciousness,

analyzed: dharā maṇḍala garbhe tu dvīpa deśa antaram yajet
translated: In the womb of the circle of the earth, one should worship the other countries of the islands.

analyzed: dvādaśa eva atra yoginyaḥ dvādaśāre prapūjayet
translated: Here, one should worship the twelve Yoginīs in the twelve-spoked (wheel).

analyzed: karṇikāyām yajet devam śabdarāśim sa lakṣaṇam
translated: In the pericarp, one should worship the god, the aggregate of sound, along with the characteristics.

analyzed: kumārī siṃhala dvīpam suvarṇam ca tṛtīyakam
translated: Kumārī, Siṃhala-dvīpa, Suvarṇa as the third,

analyzed: karṇaprāvaraṇam ca anyam svāmukham deśam uttamam
translated: Karṇa-prāvaraṇa, and another, one's own face, the excellent country,

analyzed: rasadvīpam ca gomedam garbhodam sūryadvīpakam

analyzed: āsavadvīpam vikhyātam maru deśa samanvitam
translated: The famous Asavadvipa, along with the desert country,

analyzed: vasantam mahā sara dvīpam amṛtadvīpam eva ca  dvīpam ānanda gandharvau agnidvīpam mahā vanam

translated: Up to Angaradvipa, ending with Nagnadvipa,

translated: I will tell you the names of the lords of these islands, listen to that.

translated: The field guardians, very fierce, provide protection for the practitioner,

analyzed: vidrumaḥ gastinaḥ caṇḍaḥ tathā yakṣaḥ gaṇādhipaḥ
translated: Vidruma, Gastin, Chandas, and the Yaksha lord of the Ganas,

translated: Mahabhrigu, Jaya by name, Mahajihva, and Vikrama,

analyzed: yasya madhye sthitaḥ meruḥ granthayaḥ ca na tatra vai
translated: In which Meru is situated in the middle, and there are no knots,

analyzed: pañcāśat akṣamayā tantuḥ yasmāt sarvam carācaram

analyzed: chinna bhinneṣu mantreṣu lubdha kruddheṣu suptake
translated: In the case of broken or interrupted mantras, in the greedy, angry, or sleeping state,

original: japtānena tu sūtreṇa asiddhaṃ sādhayed dhruvam // / //
analyzed: japtā anena tu sūtreṇa asiddham sādhayet dhruvam

analyzed: akṣasūtram idam siddham sarva mārga prabodhakam
translated: This accomplished rosary awakens all paths,

analyzed: sarva mārgeṣu guptā idam parameśvari
translated: This should be practiced in all paths, O Supreme Goddess.

analyzed: prastuta āyāta mārgeṇa varṇitam sūtra nirṇayam
translated: The determination of the thread has been described by the path that has been presented.

analyzed: śrī kubjikā uvāca
translated: The venerable Kubjikā said:

original: ḍākinī rākṣasī lāmā kākinī śākinī tathā /
analyzed: ḍākinī rākṣasī lāmā kākinī śākinī tathā
translated: The Dākinī, the Rākṣasī, the Lāmā, the Kākinī, and the Śākinī,

analyzed: yakṣiṇī bhrāmaṇī ca eva vada mantram surādhipa
translated: Dakini, Rakshasi, Lama, Kakini, Shakini, Yakshini, and Bhramani - tell me the mantra, O Lord of the Gods.

analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Sri Bhairava said:

analyzed: ūḍha madhya gatam gṛhya ṇaṭa madhya gatam tathā
translated: Taking that which is in the middle of Udha, and that which is in the middle of Na,

analyzed: va kha pūrva dvayā uddhṛtya dha ha madhya gatam punar
translated: Having extracted the two preceded by Va, and again that which is in the middle of Dha,

analyzed: yasa madhya gatam gṛhye etat ṣaṭkam samuddhṛtam
translated: Taking that which is in the middle of Ya, this set of six is extracted.

analyzed: ña paścimam samuddhṛtya dīrgha svara yutam kuru
translated: Having extracted the one at the end of ña, make it conjoined with the long vowel,

analyzed: ṣaṣ prakāra vidhānena ṣaṭkam ṣaṭkam niyojayet
translated: By the method of the six types, one should employ the set of six for each set of six.

original: prabhur vai bhrāmaṇī proktā ṣaṭsvarādhiṣṭhitā tu sā // / //
analyzed: prabhuḥ vai bhrāmaṇī proktā ṣaṣ svara adhiṣṭhitā tu sā
translated: Bhramani is said to be the mistress, and she is presided over by the six vowels.

analyzed: sarva kārye niyoktavyāḥ nigraha anugraham prati
translated: She should be employed in all actions, for the purpose of restraining and favoring.

original: anyad vai hṛdayaṃ vakṣye śākinīnāṃ yaśasvini // / //
analyzed: anyat vai hṛdayam vakṣye śākinīnām yaśasvini
translated: I will tell you another heart, O illustrious one, of the Shakini (goddesses).

analyzed: ūpaścimam samuddhṛtya hapūrvam āsane sthitam
translated: Having extracted the one at the end of Ū, located in the seat preceded by Ha,

original: rephākrāntaṃ tu kartavyaṃ dauttarayutaṃ tathā // / //🔽jhapūrveṇa samāyuktaṃ kūṭaṃ bindusamanvitam /
analyzed: repha ākrāntam tu kartavyam tathā  jha pūrveṇa samāyuktam kūṭam bindu samanvitam
translated: It should be made to be pervaded by Ra, and also conjoined with the one after that.🔽Conjoined with the one preceded by Jha, the peak is endowed with the Bindu.

analyzed: prastāra āyāta mārgeṇa uddhṛtam ṣaṭka nirṇayam
translated: The determination of the set of six is extracted by the path of the extended line.

analyzed: prastutam śṛṇu kalyāṇi ucyamānam nigadyate
translated: Listen to the present, O auspicious one, as it is being told.

analyzed: ariṣṭa darśana ādi evam abhyasyantaḥ nyathā yadi
translated: If, having practiced thus from the very sight of misfortune, one should do otherwise...

analyzed: śuṣyate ghaṇṭikā sthānam tadā dhyānam parityajet
translated: If the place of the bell dries up, then one should abandon meditation.

analyzed: japa dhyāna arcanāt eva sañjāta upaśamam na hi
translated: If there is no peace born from japa, meditation, and worship...

analyzed: tadā atra niścitam jātam pañca ahāt mṛtyu lakṣaṇam
translated: Then it is certain that the sign of death will occur in five days.

analyzed: niścayena tadā kāle guru devam samāśrayet
translated: At that time, one should definitely rely on the guru and deity...

analyzed: putra dāra ādi bandhūnām vyāharitvā vadet idam
translated: Having spoken to one's sons, wife, and other relatives, one should say this:

analyzed: pañca aha avāntare kāle kuryāt utkrānti kāraṇam
translated: Within five days, one should perform the cause of liberation...

original: anyathā kurute yas tu sa pāpī hy ātmabhedakaḥ /
analyzed: anyathā kurute yaḥ tu sa pāpī hi ātma bhedakaḥ
translated: But one who does otherwise is a sinner who splits the self.

original: na duḥkhito na kopena kuryād utkrāntikāraṇam // / //
analyzed: na duḥkhitaḥ na kopena kuryāt utkrānti kāraṇam
translated: One should not perform the cause of liberation out of sorrow or anger...

original: kīrtihetoḥ śarīrasya yadi śakto na rakṣaṇe /
analyzed: kīrti hetoḥ śarīrasya yadi śaktaḥ na rakṣaṇe
translated: If one is unable to protect the body for the sake of fame,

original: guruṇāpi hi dātavyaṃ jñātvā śiṣyaṃ salakṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: guruṇā api hi dātavyam jñātvā śiṣyam sa lakṣaṇam

analyzed: anyathā dadate yaḥ tu liṅga bhedī guruḥ tu saḥ
translated: But one who gives otherwise is a guru who splits the linga.

original: pañcaprakārako hy ātmā yena jñātaḥ svadehataḥ // / //
analyzed: pañca prakārakaḥ hi ātmā yena jñātaḥ sva dehataḥ

original: sarvatīrthamayaḥ so hi tīrthāni kṛtakāny api /
analyzed: sarva tīrtha mayaḥ saḥ hi tīrthāni kṛtakāni api

analyzed: su siddha pumbhiḥ sarvaiḥ tu yatra baddha āspadam kvacid
translated: Where the very accomplished men have established themselves somewhere,

analyzed: jñāna avabodha sampannāḥ jñāna sampādane kṣamāḥ
translated: Endowed with the knowledge and understanding, capable of bestowing knowledge,

original: yatra tiṣṭhanti te sthāne tat tīrthaṃ paramārthataḥ /
analyzed: yatra tiṣṭhanti te sthāne tat tīrtham paramārthataḥ
translated: wherever they reside, that place is truly a holy place.

analyzed: vārāṇasī kurukṣetram naimiṣam bhairavam tathā
translated: Varanasi, Kurukshetra, Naimisha, and Bhairva,

original: sannidhāno gurur yatra sarvatīrthāni tatra vai /
analyzed: sannidhānaḥ guruḥ yatra sarva tīrthāni tatra vai
translated: wherever the teacher is present, there all the holy places are.

analyzed: tīrthāni toya pūrṇāni devāḥ pāṣāṇa mṛṇmayāḥ
translated: The holy places are filled with water, the gods are made of stone and clay,

original: ātmavido na manyante tat tīrtham itare janāḥ /
analyzed: ātma vidaḥ na manyante tat tīrtham itare janāḥ

analyzed: balinā upadrute sthāne guroḥ mānam upāgate
translated: In a place afflicted by the powerful, when the teacher has been honored,

analyzed: jñāninaḥ pi na doṣaḥ asti ātmanaḥ hanane kṛte
translated: even the wise are not at fault if they kill themselves.

analyzed: tīrthaṅkaraḥ guruḥ yasmāt tad kārya ujjhita jīvite
translated: Since the teacher is the maker of holy places, when life is abandoned for that purpose,

original: tiryagyoniṃ hy asau yāti duḥkhāntaṃ phalam aśnute /
analyzed: tiryagyonim hi asau yāti duḥkha antam phalam aśnute
translated: he goes to the animal realm and experiences the result of suffering.

analyzed: anyat kāle na kartavyam utkrānti utkramaṇam priye
translated: Another rite should not be performed at that time, O beloved, the rite of departure and entry,

original: kīrtihetoḥ prakartavyā sā yathā kathyate ' dhunā /
analyzed: kīrti hetoḥ prakartavyā sā yathā kathyate dhunā

analyzed: dvāreṣu argala saṃyogam kuryāt ca udghāṭanam kvacid

analyzed: jīvādhāram chinet granthim etat utkrānti lakṣaṇam
translated: One should cut the knot of the support of the individual soul - this is the characteristic of the ascent.

original: gudaṃ liṅgaṃ tathā nābhir mukhaṃ nāsā śrutīkṣaṇau // / //
analyzed: gudam liṅgam tathā nābhiḥ mukham nāsā śruti īkṣaṇau

analyzed: eṣu sthāne rgalam yojya kuñcikā ūrdhvam niyojayet

analyzed: argalāni upadeśena śṛṇu tvam karaṇam yathā

analyzed: guda ādhāra upari sthitvā kṛtvā vai kukkuṭāsanam

analyzed: sama pāda ūru jaṅghaḥ tu kurparau tu tad ūrdhva gau
translated: with the legs, thighs, and shanks equal, the elbows above that,

analyzed: bhagna pṛṣṭha śiraḥ skandhaḥ hi uttāna ūrdhva mukhaḥ sthitaḥ  muṣṭibhyām pīḍayet skandhau kaṇṭha sthau ca anunāsikau

analyzed: uccaret kṣurikā mūle granthi chedam bhavet kṣaṇāt

analyzed: ghaṇṭikāyām tu deveśi ṣaṣ māsa avadhi pūrvakam

analyzed: nityam eva abhyasantasya pratyayāni bhavanti hi

analyzed: ghaṭa ādhāra gatam prāṇam kūrmayantreṇa pīḍayet
translated: One should press the prana located in the base of the abdomen with the tortoise lock.

analyzed: abhyasan māsam ekam tu sadyam utkrānti lakṣaṇam

analyzed: brahmarandhram sphurantī iva nirjīvam kaṇṭhaka avadhim
translated: The brahmarandhra (the aperture at the crown of the head) seems to throb, up to the throat, as if lifeless.

analyzed: evam abhyāsayet nityam yatra bandha tanuḥ sthitaḥ

analyzed: guda ādhāre mṛdum dattvā pṛṣṭha ādhāram su śobhanam

analyzed: jānu ūrubhyām tu pārśve tu kīlakau dvau nidhāpayet

analyzed: should read bhūmau

analyzed: evam saṃśodhayitvā tu pūrva siddhiḥ yathā yathā

analyzed: satata abhyāsa yogena sadyam utkramaṇe kṣamaḥ

analyzed: kruddhaḥ saṃharate kṣipram ghaṭikā abhyantareṇa vai

analyzed: tṛṇa vṛkṣa latā ādīnām ṣaṭpada ākāśa gāminām

analyzed: phala puṣpa prapātena tadā siddhim vilakṣayet  akālena api kālaḥ tu ṣaṣ ghaṭikā abhyantareṇa vai

analyzed: ṣaṣ māsa abhyāsa yogena ātmanaḥ kurute dhruvam

analyzed: evam te kathitam sarvam sa rahasyam mahāmatam

analyzed: kṣurikā ādi argala abhyāsam kathayāmi upadeśataḥ
translated: I will teach the practice of the door-bolt beginning with the razor, according to the instruction.

analyzed: etat vijñāna sāraḥ yam vijñāna aneka saṅkulam

analyzed: lubdha kruddheṣu duṣṭeṣu gopaya idam su rakṣitam

analyzed: param ca ājñā apahāraḥ sti yasya hāniḥ na vidyate

analyzed: evam su rakṣitā devi vāritā asi punar punar

analyzed: an ādiṣṭasya śiṣya idam dāsyase naraka arthinī

original: pañcātmānaṃ yadā jñātaṃ yadā jñātaṃ ṣaḍadhvaram // / //
analyzed: pañcātmānam yadā jñātam yadā jñātam ṣaḍadhvaram

analyzed: anyat vā paścimam vakṣye duḥkha ākrāntasya yoginaḥ

analyzed: sarvajña vihite mārge na doṣaḥ tad prasādhane
translated: There is no fault in establishing that on the path laid down by the omniscient one.

analyzed: ātmanaḥ ca parasya eva kruddha cetaḥ vadhāraṇam

analyzed: kartavyam bhī vane gatvā rakta maṇḍalakam subham

analyzed: kusuminyā saha ekatvam ātmānam madhyatas nyaset

analyzed: māṃsa khaṇḍaiḥ prapūjyeta raktena argham pradāpayet
translated: One should worship with pieces of meat and offer libation with blood.

analyzed: bhedayitvā tu aṣṭāṅgam viṣṭha mūtra samekataḥ
translated: Having divided the eight limbs into one place with feces and urine...

analyzed: kiñcid ali samāyuktam arghapātram niyojayet
translated: One should employ the libation vessel mixed with a little powder.

original: kṣmāpalenātha nāreṇa kṛṣṇavastrodbhavena ca // / //🔽pūjayed vātha naivedyair dhātuṃ dattvā svakāṃ svakām /
analyzed: kṣmāpalena atha nāreṇa kṛṣṇa vastra udbhavena ca  pūjayet vā atha naivedyaiḥ dhātum dattvā svakām svakām
translated: With the flesh of a pig, a dog, and a human, and with black cloth...🔽One should worship with food offerings, having given one's own essence.

analyzed: rakta pātram pṛthakkuryāt naivedyāni pṛthak pṛthak

Everything from the vessel up to the incense, with pieces of the skull,

analyzed: sānnidhya karaṇa artham tu dhūpa anyam sanniyojayet

analyzed: yena ākṛṣṭāḥ prayānti āśu sannidhānāḥ bhavanti hi  kṣmāpalam hi ca kṣmāpittam nara asthi śailamadrajam
translated: By which, being attracted, they quickly go and become present.🔽The earth is the earth's bile, human bone is the mountain's dust...

analyzed: kiñcid ali samāyuktam dhūpaḥ yam paramārthataḥ
translated: This incense, which is truly endowed with a little camphor,

analyzed: eva upacāra yogena dhūpayitvā samuccaret
translated: Having fumigated with this method of worship, one should recite...

translated: The Vidyā endowed with one's own element, one should repeat it a hundred times for whom...🔽Aim Shrim Ham Him Hūm, O Kusumamālinī, accept this principal element, accept, O Devadatta, who is in the belly, O annihilator of enemies, O captor, all enemies, svāhā!🔽Aim Shrim Yām Yīm Yūm, O Yakṣiṇī, stupefy, stupefy all enemies, Devadatta's bones, break, break, O annihilator of enemies, captivate, captivate, svāhā!

original: aiṃ śrīṃ śāṃ śīṃ śūṃ śaṅkhinī śaṅkhagrahena sarvaśatrūṇāṃ devadattānāṃ āṇimāri vaśīkuru kuru majjaṃ gṛhṇa gṛhṇa svāhā // / / //

analyzed: pinākī sthitaḥ māṃse sṛj āsthitaḥ
translated: L is Pināka, established in the flesh. R is Bhujaṅga, established in blood.

original: ya vālīśas tvacāmadhye kathitaṃ tava suvrate /
analyzed: ya vālīśaḥ tvacā madhye kathitam tava suvrate
translated: Y is Vālīśa, in the middle of the skin. This has been told to you, O one of good vows.

analyzed: mahākālaḥ makāraḥ tu hṛdaye sarva jantuṣu
translated: M is Mahākāla, in the heart of all living beings.

original: dviraṇḍas tu bha nābhyāṃ tu ba vaṃśe chagalaṇḍinaḥ /
analyzed: dvis aṇḍaḥ tu bha nābhyām tu ba vaṃśe chagalaṇḍinaḥ
translated: B is Dviranda, in the navel. V is in the bamboo, of Chagalandin.

original: pha śikhī vāmapārśve tu kathitaṃ tu varānane // / //
analyzed: śikhī vāma pārśve tu kathitam tu varānane
translated: P is Śikhin, on the left side. This has been told, O beautiful-faced one.

original: pakāro lohito rudro dakṣiṇe kukṣim āśritaḥ /🔽na meṣo vāmapāde tu dha mīno jaṅgham āśritaḥ // / //
analyzed: pakāraḥ lohitaḥ rudraḥ dakṣiṇe kukṣim āśritaḥ  na meṣaḥ vāma pāde tu mīnaḥ jaṅgham āśritaḥ
translated: The letter Pa is red Rudra, residing in the right side of the belly.🔽The letter Na is not Aries, but Pisces, residing in the shank.

original: da dhātṛ jānumadhye tu saṃsthito varavarṇini /
analyzed: jānu madhye tu saṃsthitaḥ varavarṇini
translated: The letter Dha is the Creator, O fair-complexioned one, situated in the middle of the knee.

original: tha diṇḍī ūrudeśe tu ta āṣāḍhī tatordhvataḥ // / //
analyzed: diṇḍī ūru deśe tu te āṣāḍhī tatas ūrdhvatas
translated: The letter Tha is Dindi, residing in the thigh region, and the letter Ta is Ashadha above that.

original: loṇa umākānta pāde tu dakṣiṇe ca mahābalaḥ
analyzed: loṇa umākānta pāde tu dakṣiṇe ca mahā balaḥ
translated: The letter La is the consort of Uma, the greatly powerful one, residing in the right foot.

analyzed: ḍha ardha nārī sthitaḥ devi jaṅghikāyām varānane
translated: The letter Dha is Ardhanari, O Goddess, situated in the ankle, O beautiful-faced one.
The letter Da is Daruka Rudra, proclaimed to be in the middle of the knee.

original: ṭha lāṅgaly ūrudeśe tu nātra kāryavicāraṇāt // / //🔽someśvaras ṭakāre tu jaṅghāmūle sthitas tu saḥ /
analyzed: ūru deśe tu na atra kārya vicāraṇāt  someśvaraḥ ṭakāre tu jaṅghā mūle sthitaḥ tu saḥ
translated: The letter Tha is Langali, residing in the thigh region, no doubt should be entertained in this matter.🔽The letter Ta is Somesha, situated at the base of the shank.

original: ña haste saṃsthitaḥ śarmā jhājeśo vāmabāhugaḥ // / //🔽ja caturmukha madhye tu cha ekākṣas tu kakṣagaḥ /
analyzed: haste saṃsthitaḥ śarmā jhājeśaḥ vāma bāhu gaḥ  ja caturmukha madhye tu cha eka akṣaḥ tu kakṣa gaḥ
translated: The letter ña is the blissful one, residing in the right hand, and the letter  Jha is Ajakesha, residing in the left arm.🔽The letter Ja is the four-faced one, and the letter Cha is Ekaksha, residing in the armpit.

original: cakāraḥ kūrma evātra śikhare vāmake sthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: cakāraḥ kūrmaḥ eva atra śikhare vāmake sthitaḥ
translated: The letter Cha is indeed the tortoise, situated on the left peak.

original: atordhve dakṣiṇe haste ṅādikāntam ataḥ śṛṇu /
analyzed: atas ūrdhve dakṣiṇe haste ṅādika antam atas śṛṇu
translated: Above that, in the right hand, listen to the one beginning with ña.

analyzed: ṅakāraḥ kara agre tu ekarudraḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: The letter ña is at the tip of the hand, where Ekavishvarudra is situated.

original: gha śiveśaḥ karasyordhve ga pracaṇḍaś ca kurpare /
analyzed: śiveśaḥ karasya ūrdhve ga pracaṇḍaḥ ca kurpare
translated: G is Shiva, above the hand, and G is Prachanda, in the ankle.

original: kha caṇḍo bāhumadhye tu ka krodhaḥ śikhare sthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: caṇḍaḥ bāhu madhye tu ka krodhaḥ śikhare sthitaḥ
translated: K is Chanda, in the middle of the arm, and K is Krodha, situated at the tip.
A is Mahasena Rudra, in the aperture of Brahma above the emission.

analyzed: aṃ krūraḥ madhya ghaṇṭā ante au
translated: A is Krura, in the middle of the bell, and AU is Anugrahi, on the upper lip.

original: o oṣṭhe sadyadevas tu ai bhauktī dvijamūrdhvagaḥ /
analyzed: o oṣṭhe sadyadevaḥ tu bhauktī dvija mūrdhva gaḥ
translated: O is Sadyadeva, on the lip, and AI is Bhoukti, above the head of the twice-born.

original: e jhaṇṭīśo ' dhapaṅktis tu dvijabhūto vyavasthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: tu dvija bhūtaḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: E is Jhantiesh, and AI is the row of teeth, situated as the twice-born.

original: ḹ haro vāmagaṇḍe tu ḷ sthāṇur dakṣagaṇḍagaḥ /
analyzed: haraḥ vāma gaṇḍe tu sthāṇuḥ dakṣa gaṇḍa gaḥ
translated: U is Hara, on the left cheek, and U is Sthanu, on the right cheek.

original: ṝ tithīśa iḍāyāṃ tu ṛ bhārabhūti piṅgalā // / //
analyzed: tithi īśe iḍāyām tu ṛ bhārabhūti piṅgalā
translated: R is Tithish, in the Ida, and R is Bharabhu, in the Pingala.

original: ū arghīśo vāmakarṇe u amarīśas tu dakṣiṇe /
analyzed: arghīśaḥ vāma karṇe u amarīśaḥ tu dakṣiṇe
translated: U is Arghesh, in the left ear, and U is Amresh, in the right.

original: ī trimūrtir vāmacakṣuṣi i sūkṣma dakṣacakṣugaḥ // / //
analyzed: trimūrtiḥ vāma cakṣuṣi dakṣa cakṣu gaḥ
translated: I is Trimurti, in the left eye, and I is Sukshma, in the right eye.

original: ā ananto maṇḍale vaktre a śrīkaṇṭho lalāṭagaḥ /
analyzed: ā anantaḥ maṇḍale vaktre a śrīkaṇṭhaḥ lalāṭa gaḥ
translated: A is Ananta, in the face circle, and A is Shrikanthesh, on the forehead.

analyzed: tad grahe rudram ākhyātā mālinyām śṛṇu sāmpratam
translated: The Rudras are said to be in those planets. Now listen to the Malini.

analyzed: vāme phetkārikā ca eva dahanī dakṣa pāda gā
translated: On the left is Phetkarika, and the ladle is on the right foot.

original: sāvitrī caiva gāyatrī au o jaṅghau prakīrtitau // / //
analyzed: sāvitrī ca eva gāyatrī au o jaṅghau prakīrtitau
translated: Savitri and Gayatri are proclaimed as AU and O on the shanks.

original: e ai jānū kriyā jñānī tārā takāram ūrugā /
analyzed: e ai jānū kriyā jñānī tārā takāram ūrugā
translated: E and AI are the knees, the knower of action, Tara, the letter TA, and the thighs.

original: śukradevīty anusvāraṃ śukraṃ devyās tu bhairavi // / //
analyzed: śukra devi iti anusvāram śukram devyāḥ tu bhairavi
translated: The nasal sound of the goddess Shukra is the semen of the goddess Bhairavi.

original: śa guhyaṃ kusumākhyā ca mahākālī nitambagā /
analyzed: guhyam kusuma ākhyā ca mahākālī nitamba gā
translated: The letter SHA is the secret part, called Kusuma, and Mahakalika is on the buttocks.

original: kṣa saṃhārī sthitā nābhau ṣodaraṃ lambanodarā // / //
analyzed: saṃhārī sthitā nābhau ṣa udaram lambana udarā
translated: The letter KSHA is the destroyer, located in the navel, and the letter SA is the stomach, hanging stomach.

original: ha prāṇe ambikā devī sakāre ca parāparā /
analyzed: ha prāṇe ambikā devī sakāre ca parāparā
translated: The letter HA is the life force, the goddess Ambika, and the letter SA is the supreme and the inferior.

original: āmoṭī tadgataṃ kṣīram ā varṇaṃ parikīrtitam // / //🔽pūtanā chagalaṇḍā ca lachau stanau prakīrtitau /
analyzed: āmoṭī tad gatam kṣīram varṇam parikīrtitam  pūtanā chagalaṇḍā ca lachau stanau prakīrtitau
translated: The letter A is the milking, the milk contained in that, and the letter A is declared.🔽P happens to be Putana, and CHAGALANDA is declared to be the two breasts.

original: pāvanī tu pa hṛllagnā jayantyā śūlajā smṛtā // / //
analyzed: pāvanī tu hṛllagnā jayantyā śūlajā smṛtā
translated: The letter PA is attached to the heart, and Jayanti is remembered as born from the trident.

original: dīpanī śūladaṇḍā tu rephaṃ dakṣakare sthitam /
analyzed: dīpanī śūla daṇḍā tu repham dakṣa kare sthitam
translated: The letter RE is located in the right hand, and DIPA is the staff of the trident.

analyzed: kapālinī vāma kare ṭa varṇaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter TA is declared to be in the left hand, and KAPALINI is the skull.

original: icchāśaktir visargākhyā karapṛṣṭhāv ubhāv api /🔽kurdanī jhaṅkarī caiva ñajhāv aṅgulayaḥ kramāt // / //🔽sampūrṇapūrṇimā caiva ṭhavarṇas talahastayoḥ /
analyzed: icchā śaktiḥ visarga ākhyā kara pṛṣṭhau ubhau api  kurdanī jhaṅkarī ca eva ñajhau aṅgulayaḥ kramāt  sampūrṇa pūrṇimā ca eva ṭha varṇaḥ tala hastayoḥ
translated: Both the back of the hands are called the will power and the emission.🔽The fingers are in order KUDRANI, JHANKARI, and the letters NA and JA.🔽The letter THA is on the palms and hands, and the full moon is complete.

original: vināyakī ca lāmā ca ḍaḍhau bāhudvayaṃ priye // / //
analyzed: vināyakī ca lāmā ca ḍaḍhau bāhu dvayam priye
translated: The two arms are VINAYAKI and LAMBA, and the letters DA and DHA are the two arms, O beloved.

original: vāyuvegā ca bhīṣaṇyā skandhayor ubhayor api /
analyzed: vāyu vegā ca bhīṣaṇyā skandhayoḥ ubhayoḥ api
translated: Vayuvega and Bhisanyā are on both shoulders.

original: va kaṇṭhe śikhivāhinyā a vāg vāgeśvarī matā // / //
analyzed: va kaṇṭhe śikhivāhinyāḥ a vāc vāgeśvarī matā
translated: A on the throat is considered Vāgīśvarī, the goddess of speech.

original: māyā devī i jihvā tu jihvā devyā virājate /
analyzed: māyā devī i jihvā tu jihvā devyā virājate
translated: The goddess Māyā is the tongue, and the tongue shines with the goddess.

original: khirvirā ghoraghoṣā ca śivā kālī ca kaṅkaṭā // / //
analyzed: khirvirā ghoraghoṣā ca śivā kālī ca kaṅkaṭā
translated: Khirvirā and Ghoraghoṣā, Śivā, Kālī, and Kaṅkaṭā,

original: kavarge daśanās tīkṣṇā evaṃ devyā virājate /
analyzed: kavarge daśanāḥ tīkṣṇāḥ evam devyā virājate
translated: The ka group of letters are sharp teeth, thus the goddess shines.

original: bakāraṃ vadanaṃ tasyā vajriṇī śaktir avyayā // / //
analyzed: bakāram vadanam tasyāḥ vajriṇī śaktiḥ avyayā
translated: The letter ba is her face, Vajriṇī is the imperishable power.

analyzed: nāda sthā nāsāyām netra madhyataḥ
translated: The letter ī is the secret power in the sound, in the nose, in the middle of the eyes.

original: prajñā ca mohanī caiva ū u bhūṣaṇamīkṣagau // / //
analyzed: prajñā ca mohanī ca eva u bhūṣaṇam īkṣagau
translated: Prajñā and Mohinī are the letters ū and u, and the ornaments are seen.

original: nārāyaṇī ṇa karṇau tu vāmadakṣiṇayor ubhau /
analyzed: nārāyaṇī karṇau tu vāma dakṣiṇayoḥ ubhau
translated: The letter ṇa is Nārāyaṇī, the two ears on the left and right.

original: priyadarśanā dha netrasthā ubhau netrau virājate // / //🔽cāmuṇḍā ca lalāṭasthā tha vaktraṃ grasanī smṛtā /
analyzed: priyadarśanā dha netra sthā ubhau netrau virājate  cāmuṇḍā ca vaktram grasanī smṛtā
translated: Priyadarśanā is in the eyes, and the two eyes shine.🔽Cāmuṇḍā is on the forehead, and the letter tha is known as the mouth that devours.

original: ḹ ḷ ṛ ṝ tu śāntyādyāḥ śiromālā tu mālinī // / //
analyzed: tu śānti ādyāḥ śiromālā tu mālinī
translated: The letters ॡ, ऌ, ṛ, and ṝ are the beginning of peace, and the garland of the head is Mālinī.

analyzed: nādinī tu śikhā anta sthā nakāra akṣara sambhavā
translated: Nādini is at the end of the tuft, born from the letter na.

original: mālinyās tadgraho hy eṣa śaktitrayam ataḥ śṛṇu // / //
analyzed: mālinyāḥ tad grahaḥ hi eṣa śakti trayam atas śṛṇu
translated: This is the seizure of Mālinī, therefore listen to the triad of powers.

original: kriyā ca śukrasahitā binduardhendusaṃyutā /🔽nādaśaktiśikhākrāntā prathamaṃ bījam uttamam // / //
analyzed: kriyā ca śukra sahitā bindu ardhendu saṃyutā  nāda śakti śikhā ākrāntā prathamam bījam uttamam
translated: The action along with the semen, united with the drop and the half-moon,🔽Pervaded by the sound, power, and flame, is the first, excellent seed.

analyzed: ambikā śūla daṇḍa sthā guhya śaktyā tu alaṅkṛtā
translated: Ambika, dwelling in the shaft of the trident, adorned with the secret power,

original: binduyuktaṃ dvitīyaṃ tu tṛtīyaṃ śṛṇu sāmpratam // / //
analyzed: bindu yuktam dvitīyam tu tṛtīyam śṛṇu sāmpratam
translated: United with the drop, is the second. Now listen to the third.

original: vāktattvaṃ kevalaṃ śuddhaṃ ghoraghoṣā tathāparā /🔽dakṣajaṅghāsamāyuktā dīpanī dakṣajānugā // / //
analyzed: vāc tattvam kevalam śuddham ghoraghoṣā tathā aparā  dakṣa jaṅghā samāyuktā dīpanī dakṣa jānu gā
translated: The pure principle of speech alone, and also the terrible sound,🔽United with the right shank, the illuminator following the right knee,
Ambika, dwelling in the illuminator, endowed with the desire of the secret power,

original: ambikā ca parārūḍhā icchāyuktaṃ padaṃ bhavet // / //
analyzed: ambikā ca parārūḍhā icchā yuktam padam bhavet
translated: And Ambika mounted on the supreme, becomes the state united with desire.

original: abhinnā pāvanī tadvac chūladaṇḍaṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: abhinnā pāvanī tadvat śūla daṇḍam tathā eva ca
translated: The indivisible, the purifier, likewise the shaft of the trident,

analyzed: mahākālī svarūpeṇa daśanam tu caturthakam
translated: The fourth is the biting in the form of Mahakali.

original: gāyatryā bheditaṃ kāryaṃ jñānabhinnā ca dīpanī /
analyzed: gāyatryā bheditam kāryam jñāna bhinnā ca dīpanī
translated: It should be divided by Gayatri, and the illuminator is differentiated by knowledge.

analyzed: mohanyā bheditam prāṇam mahākālyā samāhitam
translated: The life force is divided by Mohani, concentrated with Mahakali.

original: ṣaḍakṣaraṃ dvitīyaṃ tu padaṃ devyāḥ samuddhṛtam /
analyzed: ṣaṣ akṣaram dvitīyam tu padam devyāḥ samuddhṛtam
translated: The second part of the goddess's six-syllable mantra is extracted.

analyzed: gāyatryā bheditam kṛtvā ghora ghoṣā mahā balā
translated: Having divided it with Gayatri, the terrible sound is greatly powerful,

analyzed: dīpanīm kevalām dadyāt prajñayā śūladaṇḍakam
translated: One should offer the sole Dipani, with wisdom, the trident staff.

analyzed: jñāna bhinnam tu hṛdayam prāṇam jīva samanvitam
translated: The heart, which is different from knowledge, along with the life force and the individual soul,

analyzed: sāvitrī sahitam kāryam padam vidyāt tṛtīyakam
translated: The third pada should be known as Savitri, along with the fourth pada.

analyzed: dakṣa jaṅghā samāyuktā ghora ghoṣā kula īśvarī
translated: The Kula goddess Ghoraghoṣā, along with the right shank,

analyzed: dīpanī kevalā ca atra nitambam mohana anvitam
translated: Here, the sole Dipani, along with the buttocks and Mohana,

original: kālikā jihvayā yuktā caturthaṃ caturakṣaram // / //🔽bhīṣaṇānāsamāyuktā mahākālī tu kevalā /
analyzed: kālikā jihvayā yuktā caturtham catur akṣaram  bhīṣaṇa anāsamāyuktā mahākālī tu kevalā
translated: Kālikā, along with the tongue, the fourth pada with four syllables,🔽Mahākālī, along with the nose of Bhīṣaṇā, alone,

analyzed: bhīṣaṇā guhya śakti sthā lambikā kevalā api atas
translated: Bhīṣaṇā, residing in the secret power, and then the sole Laṃbikā,

original: nārāyaṇī jñānaśaktyā yuktā syāt pañcamaṃ padam /
analyzed: nārāyaṇī jñānaśaktyā yuktā syāt pañcamam padam
translated: The fifth pada should be Nārāyaṇī, along with the power of knowledge,

original: vajriṇī tu mahākālī dvir abhyāsaṃ tu kārayet // / //
analyzed: vajriṇī tu mahākālī dvis abhyāsam tu kārayet
translated: Mahākālī, along with Vajriṇī, one should repeat twice,

analyzed: pāvanī māyayā bhinnā abhinnā śikhi vāhinī
translated: Pāvanī, divided by Māyā, undivided, moving like a flame,

original: dvir abhyāsam idaṃ kāryaṃ prāṇam icchāsamanvitaṃ // / //
analyzed: dvis abhyāsam idam kāryam prāṇam icchā samanvitam
translated: This should be repeated twice, along with the life force and desire,

original: ṣaṣṭhamaṃ tu padaṃ devyā uddhṛtaṃ tu navākṣaram /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭhamam tu padam devyāḥ uddhṛtam tu nava akṣaram
translated: The sixth pada of the goddess, extracted, with nine syllables,

original: ambikā jñānabhinnā vai dīpanyā ca catuṣṭayam // / //
analyzed: ambikā jñāna bhinnā vai dīpanyā ca catuṣṭayam
translated: Aṃbikā, divided by knowledge, along with the group of four Dipanyāsas,

analyzed: bhūṣitam bhūṣaṇena eva vāma karṇasya suvrate
translated: Adorned with the ornament itself on the left ear, O one of good vows.

original: dīpanyā kevalā caiva caturdhā tu prakalpayet // / //
analyzed: dīpanyā kevalā ca eva caturdhā tu prakalpayet
translated: One should conceive of it as fourfold, with only the illuminator.

original: navavarṇam idaṃ devi saptamaṃ padam uddhṛtam /
analyzed: nava varṇam idam devi saptamam padam uddhṛtam
translated: This is the ninth syllable, O Goddess, the seventh pada has been extracted.

analyzed: ambikā śūla daṇḍa sthā guhya śaktyā vibhūṣitā
translated: Ambika, dwelling on the shaft of the trident, adorned with the secret power.

original: punar eva tathāpy evaṃ śūladaṇḍāsane sthitā /
analyzed: punar eva tathā api evam śūla daṇḍa āsane sthitā
translated: Again, in the same way, dwelling on the seat of the shaft of the trident.

original: prajñāyuktā tu kartavyā vāmapādaṃ tataḥ punaḥ // / //🔽śūladaṇḍāsanāsīnaṃ jñānadevyā hy alaṅkṛtam /
analyzed: prajñā yuktā tu kartavyā vāma pādam tatas punar  śūla daṇḍa āsana āsīnam jñānadevyā hi alaṅkṛtam
translated: One should be united with wisdom, then the left foot.🔽Seated on the seat of the shaft of the trident, adorned with the goddess of knowledge.

analyzed: prāṇam jīva samāyuktam śūla daṇḍa āsane sthitam
translated: The life force, united with the individual soul, dwelling on the seat of the shaft of the trident.

original: sāvitryā sahitaṃ kāryaṃ bhūṣitaṃ bhūṣaṇena tu /
analyzed: sāvitryā sahitam kāryam bhūṣitam bhūṣaṇena tu
translated: One should make it accompanied by Savitri, adorned with the ornament.

analyzed: vāma karṇasya deveśi kriyādevyā tatas punar
translated: On the left ear, O Goddess of the gods, then with the goddess of action.

original: binduyuktaṃ tu kartavyaṃ padaṃ devyās tu cāṣṭamam /
analyzed: bindu yuktam tu kartavyam padam devyāḥ tu ca aṣṭamam
translated: One should make it endowed with the Bindu, the eighth pada of the Goddess.

original: kubje te prītipūrveṇa kathitaṃ tu viśeṣataḥ // / //
analyzed: kubje te prīti pūrveṇa kathitam tu viśeṣataḥ
translated: O Kubja, this has been told to you with affection, in particular.

analyzed: phetkāra ādi niyogena nādi pha antam tu mālinī
translated: By the injunction beginning with phetkara, Malini from na to pha.

analyzed: vidyā trayam tathā api evam ghoryā aṣṭaka samanvitam
translated: In the same way, the three Vidyas, along with the group of eight Aghoris.

original: dvādaśāṅgaṃ tu suśroṇi vidyāṅgāś ca navātmakam /
analyzed: dvādaśa aṅgam tu suśroṇi vidyā aṅgāḥ ca nava ātmakam
translated: O lady of beautiful hips, the twelve limbs are the nine limbs of knowledge.
